title: Vance Says Israel And Arabs Differ On 2 Key Questions
description: AMMAN, Jordan Aug. 6Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that he had been unable to narrow differences between the Arabs and Israel on two of the key issues holding up the convening of a Geneva conferencethe question of Palestinian rights and the extent of Israeli withdrawals from occupied Arab lands.

title: Miss Spalding Seen in Five Dances
description: Murray Spalding's overheated imagination leads her to try to make dances that simulate contemporary fairy tales but succeed only in being foolish or boring or both. She offered a program of five pieces Friday evening at the American Theater Laboratory.

title: Blackout in Salt Lake City
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 6 (AP)Much of Salt Lake City and its suburbs were without electrical power for almost two hours last night when a brief electrical storm shattered power transformers and triggered a fire in a substation, A spokesman for the Utah Power and Light Company said that several power lines were down and direct lightning strikes ignited fires on top of poles. A portion of a circuit breaker at a large transformer burst into flames at 7:20 P.M., a company spokesman said. It was quickly extinguished.

description: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972.

title: Ridgefield Burnishes Its Past
description: IF PAMELA KRAUS has her way, and indications are that she will, about 800 homes and other buildings in Ridgefield will be entitled in the months ahead to display a discreet plaque proclaiming membership in that exclusive club, the National Register of Historic Districts.

title: Wildcliff Lets Kids Do Things
description: A farm in New Rochelle? Well, a minifarm, anyway. The setting is the Wildcliff Museum at the south end of New Rochelle. And the chickens and turkeys that may accompany you to the edge of Long Island Sound to admire the view are part of the museum's effort to make Wildcliff a place to do something, not just to see something.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: For a fellow who never had a burning desire to get to the top, Robert S. Hatfield has come a long way to be the chairman and chief executive officer of the Continental Group Inc., the world's largest maker of cans.

title: Greenport Ferry: Plan Draws Fire
description: GREENPORT IT IS a typical Saturday morning during the summer. The two main roads leading into the downtown shopping area in the Village of Greenport are jammed with cars inching their way along the streets in both directions. Trucks, bicycles, cars and pedestrians all compete for a space on the narrow thoroughfare lined with parked cars, cars pulling out and other cars attempting to park.

title: THAIS, MALAYSIANS WAGE WAR ON REDS
description: BETONG, Thailand (UPI)In the jungles of southern Thailand, Thai and Malaysian troops are pursuing Communist guerrillas in the first largescale military operation on the southeast Asian mainland since the end of the Indochina war.

title: INTERVIEW
description: WHILE memories of the July 13 blackout recede in time and most New Yorkers return to business as usual in airconditioned, welllighted, fully powered offices; Jonathan L. Rosner is just beginning to go to work on the episode.

title: Superwelterweight Title Is Captured by Mattioli
description: BERLIN, Aug. 6 (AP)Rocco Mattioli won the world superwelterweight boxing championship tonight by knocking out Eckhard Dogge of West Germany with a left to the head in the fifth round.

title: The Youth Unemployment Capital
description: New York City is now the country's youth unemployment capital. The title, contributed by Herbert Bienstock, regional commissioner of the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics, reflects the grim fact that only one in seven black teenagers in this city and only one in four white youths have jobs. The situation is far worse than in other major cities, and worse even than it was in New York just a few years ago.

title: LETTERS
description: May I offer a footnote to Ann Crittenden's excellent Why Does a Healthy Economy Feel So Bad? (July 10).

In lieu of flowers donations may be sent to Sharon Hospital, Sharon, Conn. or the Sharon Fire Dept. Ambulance Brigade.

description: A couple of years ago, I began to wonder why it was that pitchers, taken as a group, seemed to be so much livelier and more garrulous than hitters.

description: Workers laid down their picks and shovels, or the mechanical equivalents thereof, in many of the nation's coal and ironore mines last week, in wave of walkouts affecting thousands of workers and halting about 85 percent of the country's ironore production.

title: 2 Survivors Married After 21 Days Adrift
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug 6 (Reuters)After surviving 21 days adrift in the Pacific Ocean by drinking the blood of turtles and seabirds, Robert Campbell, 37 years old, of Chicago and Sandra Corea, 30, a Nicaraguan, were married, here last night. The best man was the third survivor, Joseph Almond, 27, a Britishborn Nicaraguan.

title: I'm an Emotional Actress Who Does Enormous Research
description: STRATFORD, Ontario I tend to think of myself as pretty versatile. And I think that confuses a lot of people enormously. It would be better to be typecast. Then they could look down part for Tyzack. Yes, it would be much better to be typecast.

title: Miss Phillips, 18, Takes Jumper Stake on Encore
description: MIDDLETOWN, N.Y., Aug. 6Unknown and unheralded Susan Phillips; an 18yearold from Woodland. Hills, Calif., rode Encore to victory in the $5,000added junior jumper stake today at the raindampened final session of the weeklong Orange County Horse Show.

description: The party line of the New York Mets the one that says they are a better team without Tom Seaver and Dave Kingmanwas stepped on a bit last night in Shea Stadium when the San Francisco Giants unloaded 15 hits and overpowered the Mets. 73.

description: ATTICA, N.Y., Aug. 6A woman cook at the maximumsecurity Attica Correctional Facility was found stabbed to death yesterday, and the state police said today that a 29yearold inmate was a suspect in the case.

D. Lyon Jr. of Essex, Conn., and Blue Hill, Me. The Rev. John W. Thomas performed the ceremony.

title: INDIAN JURISDICTION IN WEST IS DISPUTED
description: SUQUAMISH, Wash., Aug. 6At roads leading to the Port Madison Indian Reservation signs proclaim that a condition of entry is submission to the lawful jurisdiction of Suquamish Indian Tribe. The Suquamish say this includes police, jurisdiction for Indians and nonIndians alike.

title: The Last Mile: Pray for Us
description: OUR long wait was over. The sound of voices was coming closer, but the words were still indistinct. Then the side door was opened and we could hear them clearly. They were reciting the litany of the saints.

title: Yemen Expels Soviet Reporter
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 6 (AP)The official SoViet press agency Tass said today its correspondent in Yemen had been ord??d to leave the country. This act of the leadership is of an unfriendly character, Tass said, and has probably been caused by the pressure of forces which would like to damage YemenSoviet relations. No other details were given and Tass editors declined to name the correspondent.

title: Miss Cullman, Jeffrey Hedges Married in Rye
description: Katherine Victoria Cullman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Cullman of Rye, N. Y., was married there yesterday to Jeffrey Leland Hedges, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Hedges of Chevy Chase, Md.

title: Minor Minor and Major Minor
description: A ROMAN A CLEF about Barbra Streisand and friends? As reasonable a subject as any for a work of decidedly popular fiction, I suppose. And there's nothing wrong in wanting to write a bestseller; writers, like other endangered species, should be given a chance to survive. But, alas, James Fritzhand is just not a glorious natural in the luminous RobbinsWallaceSusann tradition of contemporary schlock. He is, instead, an exserious novelist condescending for the cash, and it shows.

title: Carter Is Corrected On Food Stamp Data
description: A spokesman for the United States Department of Agriculture said yesterday that, because of a bureaucratic error in the transmission of statistics from his department to the. Department of Health, Education and Welfare, President Carter, in his news conference, inaccurately described food stamp fraud and ineligibility.

title: THOMAS AQUIN KELLY
description: Thomas Aquin Kelly, 74, a founder of Griswold, Heckl & Kelly, an interior industrial design firm, died at home in East Hampton, L. L, on Wednesday.

title: Michelle Dunn Engaged To Jesse J. Morgan 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. James O. Dunn of New Smyrna Beach, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Michelle Christine Dunn, to Jesse Johnson Morgan 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morgan Jr. of Hillside. N. J.

title: Newark Airport? Where's That?
description: Dr. Frank Purnell, of Manhattan, was about to board an Eastern flight from Charlotte, N.C., to La Guardia when the ticket agent informed passengers that a snowstorm might force the flight to divert from the New York area. Envisioning the ordeal of having to get to New York from Philadelphia, Boston or even Montreal, Dr. Purnell hesitantly asked where the diverted flight might land. The reply: I'm sorry. Newark, I'm afraid.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 11:30 A.M. (Channel 2) Face the Nation: Joseph A. Califano Jr., Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: This Is a Good Time for Mending Home Fences
description: A homeowner who may be quite diligent about painting and otherwise maintaining the outside of his house will often neglect or postpone minor repairs to a fence around his property because he feels that the fence can always be mended. later on when there will be more time available (he hopes).

title: Maryalice Phillips Fiancee Of Frederick W. Hoogland
description: Maryalice Michelle Phillips, an editorial assistant with the Cambridge University Press in New York, and Frederick William Taylor Hoogland, an associate with the Shell Oil Company's legal department in Houston, plan to be married Aug. 27.

description: When Frank Robinson became the first black manager to be dismissed, he did not head directly for the unemployment line. Instead he returned home to California, prepared to wait patiently for his paychecks for the remainder of the season from Cleveland and the possibility of another job.

title: The Studio Coop: An Orphan Coming Into Its Own
description: Bob Arons's piece of New York real estate measures 500 square feet and looks down over a coffee shop on Second Avenue. Mr. Arons, a 36yearold bachelor who works for a bank, is the owner of a studio coop, a type of apartment that just a few years ago brokers termed impossible to sell.

title: Latin Leaders Praise Panama And U.S. for Progress on Canal
description: BOGOTA. Colombia. Aug. 6Four LatinAmerican countries and Jamaica lent their backing today to a Panamanian proposal for a new pact between Panama and the Untied States over the Panama Canal.

description: PEEKSKILL I HAVE just come back from my weekly visit to the Unemployment. This is its popular name, abridged from the full designation, New York State Department of Labor, Unemployment Insurance Division.

description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Aug. 6Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa has severely attacked the Carter Administration, accusing it of promoting chaos and anarchy in southern Africa.

description: ROME, Aug. 6From the village squares in the Abruzzi Mountains to the outdoor stages of Rome, Italian summer nights ring with the sounds of young American musicians.

description: LONDON, Aug. 5 (AP)British Airways said today that it had begun repairs on its 25 Trident 3 jetliners, nearly half of which were grounded last week with hairline wing cracks.

title: Chicago Area, a Scene of Racial Tensions, Tries to Explain Its Fears
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 6The people of Marquette Park keep trying to explain themselves. But over the years they have become convinced that no one is listening, that no one really understands. Or worse, that nobody cares.

title: Water, Air, Here and ThereNuclear Plants All Over
description: Progress on some European ecological issues can be agonizingly slow, complicated by international responsibility. About 75 years after the last salmon left the Rhine, the countries along it have finally signed an agreement to clean up the river. Decades of discussion on the foul state of the Mediterranean have led only to a 16nation agreement In principle.

title: NBC PLANS TO END TOURS; LACK OF INTEREST CITED
description: NBC announced yesterday that guided tours of its radio and television studios in Rockefeller Center would end on Sept. 4.

title: Westchester Literally Has Storybook Charm
description: JOHN CHEEVER, whose latest novel, Falconer, is a national best seller, lives in Ossining and is unabashedly partial to what he considers its virtues. I think it is by far the most beautiful village in Westchester, he said recently, with its commanding view of the river, its rich and diverse architecture and its amiable people.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: PERSONALLY SPEAKING
description: EVERYBODY loves boatingor so they say. To most people the very word evokes images of sleek cabin cruisers and racy sailing vessels with billowing canvas, clear skies and misty spray, cocktails on the stern and not a care in the world.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ART

title: The I.L.G.W.U. and D.D.
description: BUILDING a union in the garment world scarcely seemed like a very promising enterprise at the turn of the century. Production was scattered in small units all across lower Manhattan and in small pockets in Brooklyn. Fierce competition kept the industry unstable; companies started up and folded with bewildering rapidity. It required only a small investment to enter the business, but the market was so volatile that it took as much good luck as managerial skill to stay in. Moreover, the trade was irregular; six slack months followed the frenzied production of the season.

title: ExNewark Bishop: A Fond Look Back
description: VERONA IN HIS fourth year of retirement, Bishop Leland Stark lives a quiet life in and around his attractive stone house on a treelined street in Verona. He reads a lot, writes some and works conscientiously at improving his low80's golf scores. It isn't often that his alert mind is occupied these days with thoughts of black power.

title: Summer Vacation  Tough Grind For Young Dancers
description: Train your muscles to go exactly to the position, not sort of, the balletslippered instructor commands, and the teenaged dancers move to shape up what already look like the sleekest, quickest bodies of their generation. O.K., so now you're technical wizards, a former Ballet Russe star shouts to a bevy of boys doing double spins in the air. This is theater; make thse turns say something.

title: Article 12  No Title
Bengali BusTrain Crash Kills 16
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Aug 6 (Reuters)Sixteen people were killed and many others were injured today when a bus and a train collided at a rail crossing near Comilla, 80 miles from here.

description: Today  Hunterdon Hills K.C. 21st show and obedience trial, Flemington Fairgrounds. Route 31. Flemington, N.J: 1,495 dogs; A.M. to 7 P.M.

title: Mandel Is Accused of Orchestrating Corruption Plot
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 6Federal prosecutors forcefully pressed their final arguments against Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland today in an unusual Saturday session of Federal District Court as the prolonged corruption trial of the twoterm Democratic Governor and his five codefendants moved toward a close.

title: Patricia Ann Kramer Bride of Hoke J. Wilson
description: In the Graham Road United MethOdist Church in Falls Church, Va., yesterday afternoon, Patricia Ann Kramer, daughter of the Rev. and Mrs. George C. Kramer of Wilkesboro, Pa., became the bride of Hoke James Wilson, son of Jean Sprain Wilson of New York, writer and associate producer of news documentaries for NBC Television, and the late Don Williams Wilson. who was a newspaper artist.

title: Unlike the United States, Social Payments Help Redistribute the National Income
description: WASHINGTON  As studies have suggested, Americans do not like poor people. Anyone who cannot get things together well enough to afford a ranch house in the suburbs with a twocar garage is considered to be just not trying very hard. That attitude has long undergirded the American approach to public assistance or welfare, and it accounts for much of the difference between the way the poor are treated here and in most other industrialized countries.

title: Reynolds Industries Takes the Hippocratic Oath
description: WINSTONSALEM, N.C.  J. Paul Sticht earns a sixfigure salary and exercises considerable power in this community as president of R.J. Reynolds Industries Inc., the huge conglomerate that is the nation's largest cigarette producer.

title: August In Washington
description: WASHINGTONAugust in Washington is the most civilized month in the Year. The heat's enough to melt the copper on the White House roof, but there are sailboats on the PotOmac and music in the parks, and even the exmusic computers and Xerox machines now talk to each other in whispers.

title: Russia in Prussia
description: METER and rhyme are mnemonic devices to which the educated prisoners of Gulag frequently resorted when trying to preserve their sanity. The most famous example is the woman who translated most of Byron's Don Juan and held it in her memory until after her release. In 1950 in the Siberian labor camp of Ekibastuz (two heads of salt) Solzhenitsyn, when he was known as Shch232, composed rhymed works in this manner. One result is Prussian Nights, a clumsy and disjointed 1400line narrative which can be called poetry only because it is written in meter and rhyme. Sent to any publishing house or migr Russian journal bearing any name but Solzhenitsyn's, it would be rejected unhesitatingly. Here is a characteristic passage:

title: Hetty Harris Tebbs Is Bride
description: Hetty Harris Tebbs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Binns Tebbs 3d of Ridgewood, N.J., was married there yesterday to HermannGnther Hoyt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Larkin Hoyt of Newburgh, N.Y. The Rev. J. Arthur Lazell, uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony in the West Side Presbyterian Church. The bride's father is a Bankers Trust Company vice president. The senior Mr. Hoyt is a lawyer.

title: Robert K. Gates Marries Patricia A. Dixon
description: The Drew University Chapel in Madison, N.J., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Patricia Anne Dixon, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James F. Dixon of Convent Station, N.J., to Robert Kenneth Gates of Arlington, Mass. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Gates of Sun City, Ariz., formerly of East Lansing, Mich.

title: TRENTON NOTEBOOK
description: PRICE advertising by professionals is in the news again. On July 13, the State Supreme Court, following a ruling by the United States Supreme Court, approved restrained advertising in newspapers by New Jersey's 17,000 lawyers.

title: Abortion Aid Gets a Vote
description: ON THE evening of June 8 the 1977 session of the Connecticut General Assembly was officially adjourned, and the state's 187 legislators headed for the doors. Most of us were pleased to see the final pounding of the gavel, because meant that, after more than five grueling months, we could again devote some attention to our fulltime jobs and again spend some time with our families.

title: Article 15  No Title
14 COUNTRIES TO LEND $10 BILLION TO I.M.F. TO AID POORER LANDS
description: PARIS, Aug. 6The United States and 13 other rich industrial and oilexporting countries agreed today to lend roughly $10 billion for a new international loan fund to help poorer countries forced into financial difficulty by the worldwide recession and the rising cost of oil.

title: From Jamaica Queens, to the West Coast, a Growing Number of Blacks Are Flocking to the Tennis Courts
description: The tennis boom has arrived uptown. Blacks are donning tennis clothes in increasing numbers.

title: For Gerber, a Case of Colic
description: Anderson, Clayton's rough and tumble takeover attempt of Gerber has posed fundamental questions about the concept of equity ownership and to what extent corporate directors, who may own only a small minority of the common shares, may legitimately resist a profitable bid for the stock.

title: A Vietnam Movie That Does Not Knock America
description: MINGO JUNCTION, Ohio The sign outside town says Mingo Junction. But just a few blocks away, on the main drag of this tiny steelproducing community in southeastern Ohio, there is another sign, reading Clairton National Bank. And farther on down the street is the Clairton Chapter of The American Legion.

title: Pearls for the Sound?
description: WASHINGTON FIFTEEN recreational areas along the shores of Long Island Soundjust so many flyspecks on most mapswill become pearls on a strong new necklace of Federal financing if Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff of Connecticut gets a new bill through Congress.

title: Atlantic City's Grand Hotel
description: ATLANTIC CITY TO STROLLERS on the Atlantic City boardwalk, the Blenheim Hotel, at Ohio Avenue, catches the eye like a beached whale: noble but out of place, a rarity in a setting of curiosities.

title: Houston Oil Tanks Explode
description: HOUSTON, Aug 6 (UPI)A pipeline ruptured at a chemical tank plant here today, igniting fires and explosions in three petroleum storage tanks along the Houston Ship Channel, the plant man ager said. C. C. Putnam, manager of the General American Tank Corporation plant, estimated damages at up to $3 million. Firemen controlled the blaze ?? about four hours. One fireman suffered heat exhaustion and two newsmen we?? slightly burned.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: MOST home maintenance tasks that involve using a step ladder around the inside or outside of the house also frequently call for the use of various tools, painting equipment or other materials.

title: Fly Fly Solly Scores
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Aug. 6Roosevelt Raceway had no Saturday competition from the Meadowlands track in New Jersey for the first time in a year tonight but instead was harassed by foul weather.

title: Greenland Rebuffs Arabs on Falcons
description: COPENHAGEN, Aug. 6 (AP)A bid by Arab sheiks to buy rare white hunting falcons from Greenland has been rejected after bird lovers protested, Danish officials said this week.

title: Brooklyn Meatpacker Robbed
description: Three men robbed a Brooklyn meatpacking company of $20,000 in cash yesterday, the police reported. When the men, all about 45 years old, held up the ML Packing Company at 110 North sixth Street in the Red Hook section, one was armed with a shotgun and another with a handgun, a police spokesthan said. There were no reported injuries.

title: She Loses Tweezers and Finds Success
description: STAMFORD. BECKY MARK began a milliondollar business by looking for a pair of tweezers. It was that search, combined with a crowded medicine cabinet in her Stamford home, that prompted her to invent Cosmepak, a clear, plastic compartmentalized container that fits in a medicine cabinet, looks good enough to sit on a dressing room table and sells for be tween $10 and $15.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Gleaning New Meanings
description: Beset by uncontrollable fits of shivering. at the close of a recent surffishing excursionwhich were followed in the next two days by a high fever and sharp pains in any lower abdomenI slunk to bed.

title: Episcopal Defections Are Rising Because of Ordination of Women
description: PICAYUNE, Miss., Aug. 6  Bishop Dmitri, wearing old Russian Orthodox vestments and a jeweled crown implanted with ikons, faced the congregation in the chapel of St. Michael's School here today and questioned three whiterobed monks who stood before him.

title: Claimed by Art and Nature
description: AN outstanding figure in 19thcentury American history, Frederick Law Olmsted has hitherto been known to the public as two different personae, the social critic of A Journey in the Seaboard Slave States and the creator of New York's Central Park, college campuses and planned suburbs. The projected seven volumes of his papers60,000 personal and professional items have been deposited over the years in the Library of Congress alonepromise much from Charles Capen McLaughlin's first offering. The man himself is now beginning to emerge.

title: It's Miller vs. Bud in the War of the Brewers
description: Imagine the tall, icydewed goblets, filled to the brim with golden translucent brews, coming to the rescue on those steamy 100degree days. Every night they re on primetime TVquaffed by perspiring athletes, proferred by snowythatched stars with authoritative sex appeal, sprinkled between innings and sets.

title: ATV News Show DiscoversGuess What? News!!!
description: Saul Bellow, the Chicago novelist and Nobel Laureate, recently referred to his hometown as a white knuckle kind of citytough, gritty, brawling. Everything does seem bolder in Chicago: the architecture, the symphony, the political graft, the journalism (Hecht and MacArthur's 1920's comedy The Front Page is replayed daily in the city's newspaper offices). This boldness is also reflected in the field of electronic journalism. Chicago's NBC station, WMAQTV, is in the midst of a brassy experiment that could influence the direction of television newscasting around the country for years to come. Over the years, the station has fallen in ratings and esteem; instead of the usual remedies for poor circulationa new studio set or fresh oncamera personalitiesNBC became so whiteknuckled desperate that it has made the news itself the star of its broadcast schedule.

title: DINING OUT
description: SOME words of praise, this week, for neighborhood Italian restaurants. They have dotted the cities and towns of Westchester since the county began to thrive. Started in response to the settling here of an Italian population, they soon developed a cosmopolitan audience attracted by good downtoearth food at low prices.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Jack Mitchell

title: JOHN L. BARNARD, AUTHOR AND EXU.S. ENVOY, 65
description: John Lawrence Barnard, an author and former Foreign Service officer, died in New York Hospital on Friday at the age of 65 after a long illness.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: KENNETH MACLEISH, 60, OF NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6  Kenneth MacLeish, a senior assistant editor of National Geographic and one of the magazine's most prolific writers, died of cancer yesterday at his home in Annapolis, Md. He was 60 years old.

title: INTERVIEW
description: WHEN the students return next month to the College of Liberal Arts at Hofstra University, they'll find a new dean who's also the old dean.

title: St. Benedict' Makes Comeback
description: NEWARK FOUR years since it reopened as a smaller version of its former self, St Benedict's Prep, the wellknown Roman Catholic high school for boys that Benedictine monks founded in 1868, is carrying on in Newark's Central Ward.

title: STUDY SAYS NATIONS TEND. TO HAMPER DISASTER AID
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 6 (AP)A private study group says that new international protection is needed for victims of natural disasters because relief aid is frequently withheld for political reasons.

title: Captured by Meanings
description: THIS book is a sort of serious joke. It rust appeared in a series called x par luimmefor example, Michelet by Himself, to name the volume for which Barthes happens to have been responsible. So to ask a writer to do his own par luimme was part compliment, part gag, and Barthes followed up by reviewing the book himself in the Quinzaine litteraire, under the heading Berates by Barthes by Barthes. But the joke is serious because there is more to it than literary frivolity or onceoff publicity value. Asking Barthes to do something so close to autobiography is no light challenge; for to anybody holding his views on writing (and this remains true however they change) autobiography ought to be anathema. Consequently the book is partly about the problem he must have in writing it and partly about other and related problems such the differene between what, as a writer, he thinks ought to be done and what in fact he does.

title: Behind the Olmsted Papers
description: Although justly famous in his own time, Frederick Law Olmsted was quickly forgotten. The recent rediscovery and appreciation of the remarkable 19th century American has been aided by the personal charm and enthusiasm of Charles Capen McLaughlin, the editor of the Olmsted papers. Environmentalists, planners, historians, researchers, all eventually find themselves in enthusiastic, openended correspondence with the associate professor of American history at American University in Washington, D.C.

title: GARDENING
description: HOME GARDENERS are reaping the benefits of agricultural research when they grow crops resistant to disease, control pests successfully and harvest perfect, goodtasting fruit. Yet, most planters are ignorant of what is behind all these good results.

title: CENTER IN OLD CHURCH OFFERS EXFELONS AID
description: Robert Miller, exrobber, exconvict has every right to be frustrated. When he left the Auburn Correctional Facility on June 17 after serving two and a half years for robbery he was assured he could soon have a job and be enrolled in night courses at a technical school, but he lost his social security number, and bureaucratic red tape has kept him jobless and out of technical school.

title: Fashion
description: These are the barometers the new fall fashions that are moving out of the stores as fast as they come in, The clothes on these pages are representative of what women are buying right now and usually, as surely as fall follows summer. what sells now becomes a landslide in September. This year, that means anything in challis print ; shawls of all sorts; skirts, dirndl or fuller: short. tailored jackets: lacetrimmed blouses: the big look of loose dresses and blouson tops; slim pegbottom pants; bulky knit sweater jackets: short, soft dinner dresses; brightly col ored Ultrasuedes; crepe de chine shirts and skirts: and luxury  all are on the move. Wherever there has been a designer look to be had in beautiful fabrics. it has sold immediately. What is heartening to fashion observers is that all over America. women like the new looser, softer silhouette: the silky smooth feel of fabrics like crepe de chine and cashmere. They haven't given up the classic hacking jacket but they like it the new way  over pretty lacetrimmed blouses and with softer. fuller skirts. And what must be especially heartening to stores and designers alike is that women everywhere share their fondness for challis prints  probably the most promoted of fail fashions. But the best news of all is, as the designer Kasper succinctly puts it. fashion is selling.

title: Radio
description: 7:308 A.M., WABC: Message of Israel. The Right to Ask Questions.

title: U.S.TO ISSUE REPORT ON PESTICIDE EFFECT
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 6After extensive examinations of 155 employees and former employees of the Velsicol Chemical Corporation, Government scientists will report next month on whether exposure to leptophos, a powerful pesticide, caused nervous disorders among Velsicol workers.

title: New Chief Scores G.O.P. Dependency On Rockefeller Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6New York's New Republican state chairman, Bernard M. Kilbourn. says that the state party developed bad habits under the domination of former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller.

title: Roosevelt Drivers
ALBERT H. DOUGLAS, 71, PHYSICIAN AND PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Albert H. Douglas, a professor of clinical medicine at the State University of New York at Stony Brook Medical School since its founding in 1971 and a prominent member of the medical community in New York City, died in Long Island Jewish Hospital in New Hyde Park, L. I., on Wednesday. He was 71 years old.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: The soil is dry; priorities for watering: vegetables, annuals, perennials, new shrubs and trees; older shrubs and lrees, and finally; the lawn.... Start taking cuttings of favored geraniums, lantanas, fuschsias and other summering plants to root for indoor pot plants this winter....Keep after beans and squash which are growing bumper crops this year....Greywhite coatings on lilac, phlox, rose is powdery mildew; use Karathane or benomyl.

title: Major League Scores
description: EWilcox. LOBTexas 4, Detroit 5. 2BStaub. HRHarrah (17), LeFlore (13). SBWashington. SCapaneris.

title: Reporter's Notebook: 85 Hours Aboard a Tanker Out of Alaska
description: CHERRY POINT, Wash., Aug. 5It began in the Valdez Narrows going into an icy squall and ended in Puget Sound coming out of a peasoup fog three and a half days of gray, 1,315 miles and a footnote in history as the first Alaskan pipeline crude oil reached the oilthirsty lower 48 states.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: I have a small, rather tricky psychological problem for you. In Roberto Athayde's Miss Margarida's Way, Estelle Parsons strides onstage to the shrill clamor of a school bell, arms full of books, a devouring smile on her glistening face for each and every one of us. The auditorium lights, broadly shaded like those in apool hall or a fight arena, remain on at Joseph Papp's Newman Theater because the house as a whole is meant to represent Miss Parsons's educational domain; those of us who have come for the evening are her pupils. And she wants to be able to keep a sharp eye on the lot of us, with binoculars if necessary, for fear that someone may be preparing a paper airplane or even a stink bomb with which to disrupt the orderly proceedings. Life is going to flow back and forth for the play's two acts between student audience and Miss Margarida at her desk or her blackboard (greenboard, strictly speaking), but Miss Margarida means to do all of the talking.

title: Ecology Is Suddenly A European Power
description: PARISIt is rare in postwar Europe that a movement with wide political and economic impact attempts to accomplish its aims while remaining aloof to ties with established political parties and ideologies.

title: F.T.C. Inquiries Will Hunt Bias In HomeLoan and Credit Field
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commission announced today new investigations to determine if women members of minorities and the elderly were being treated unfairly when they applied for home loans and credit cards.

title: Article 19  No Title
City Blues
description: Philip Lopate's new book is titled perfectly. The daily round is exactly what he writes about, and a damned, dull, dreadful, despairing round it is too, most of the time. Oh, occasionally a tentative cheer for the sunset in the park, a dry exclamation at the sight of a girl with her jeans off; sometimes there's even a gasp of refreshing radical anger. But the prevailing tone is melancholy: specifically, the melancholy of New York.

title: Giants' Offense a NoShow in Opener As Patriots Register a 193 Victory
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Aug. 6After the New England Patriots had defeated the Giants tonight, 193, irl the preseason opener for both teams, Harry Carson of the losers was wondering, Why can't a town like New York, the biggest in the country, have a winning football team?

title: Inn at East Hampton Bursts With Blumes
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I.Behind The Hedges grow many Blumes.

title: 92 Loss Puts Club 5 Behind Red Sox
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 6The Yankees, acknowledged today to be the league leaders in loose talking, dropped another step back tonight from what most people had expected would be their position as league leaders,

title: Nancy L. Rudnik Married In South to James Kelly
description: Nancy L. Rudnik, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene J. Rudnik of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., was married there yesterday to James F. Kelly, son of Mr. and Mrs. James B. Kelly of Rocky Point, L.I. The Rev. Francis Flynn performed the ceremony in St. John the Baptist Roman Catholic Church.

title: Yokum Hokum
description: THE ASSUMPTION has always been that people do not want to think in the summer. They want their reading, their movies, and their theater on the light sidein other words, the arts are supposed to come fully airconditioned. And that may explain the revival of the 1956 musical Li'l Abner at An Evening Dinner Theater in Elmsford. Unfortunately, the lightness was not of the sort that made you forget the heat: it merely added boredom.

title: Behind the Nassau Budget
description: SLOWLY but steadily, Nassau residents are gaining the right to participate meaningfully in the making of decisions that affect their wellbeing, via the budgetmaking process of their county government.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Next door lives Anna Karenina. She has been carrying on with a count named Vronsky.

title: THE NEW TYCOONS OF HOLLYWOOD
description: The day of the almighty mogul is over. Now moviemaking is in the hands of packagers and budgetwatchers who are the hired hands of the conglomerates that own the studios. And what they're after is blockbusters.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: EVER since we moved out of the house onto the patioa situation that started as soon as the temperature thawed the frost off the hedgeswe have been deeply involved in one of our oldest family competitions. It can be played indoors or outdoors and by any number of people, as long as you know them well enough not to care about whether they will react with ferocity, exasperation or nonrecognition. It is a game that tests human endurance and is a challenge to the alltoohuman urge to bestir yourself.

title: Late Sowings For the Fall Harvest
description: Here in the metropolitan area the average frostfree growing season is from 170190 days long. Most gardeners avail themselves of only a fraction of that pre cious, short period. In order to make the most of space and time, second sowing of garden vegetables will greatly increase the yield.

title: Income Support
description: For aged, blind or disabled, and for single parents of children under 14. A family of four eligible for full income support would receive a basic benefit of $4,200 a year. Benefit would be reduced 50 cents for each dollar earned in outside income, with the payments phased out entirely if the family earns $8,400 or more in outside income.

title: Nina BenAvi Becomes the Bride of a Student
description: Nina BenAvi, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Avrum BenAvi of White Plains, was married yesterday in New York to Stephen Purshouse BenAvi, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon Purshouse of Sheffield, England.

title: New York City Offers New Plan for Poverty Agencies
description: Hoping to insure the flow of Federal antipoverty moneynow $39 million a yearNew York City has reluctantly submitted to the Federal Community Service Agency a proposal calling for both the election and the appointment of the board members of 26 antipoverty agencies.

title: Christopher Henney And Jeanne Crombie Marry in Connecticut
description: Jeanne Frances Crombie, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David J. Crombie of Stamford, Conn., was married there yesterday to Patrick Christopher Henney, son of Mrs. Alfred Henney of Columbus, Ohio, and the late Mr. Henney. The Rev. Martin J. McDermott performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Preseason Football
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Transcript of President's News Conference on His Proposals to Overhaul Welfare
description: Following is a transcript of President; Carter's news conference in Plains, Ga., yesterday morning as recarded by The New York Times through the facilities of ABC News:

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: I live in Long Beach, a yearround residential communitya community of treelined streets and many luxurious, custombuilt homes, a community of modest homes situated one block from the beach or shopping, a community of houses nestled on private canals. As varied as the homes are, are the people who reside hersin color, nationality, income and religion.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Manager Joe Torre bemoans the fans' flood of lineup suggestions for his struggling Mets: What hurts most is that no one suggested that I reactivate myself.

title: The Illuminating Last Works of Two Musical Poets
description: The music a composer writes in the last years of his life, no matter how long or short that life might have been, always conveys a special mystique. Beethoven is the classic exampledeaf, solitary and ravaged by illness, he withdrew into himself to devise a series of profoundly disturbing creations that have challenged posterity's deepest emotional and intellectual responses ever since. Other composers, like Verdi, Mozart or Janacek, continued to refine and develop their styles while never losing the common touch as they penetrated ever deeper into the ways music can express humanistic universalities.

title: New Parking Issue Is Whether Carey Can Postpone Ban
description: Representatives Herman Badillo and Mario Biaggi said yesterday that an amendment to the Federal Clean Air Act passed by Congress on Thursday would permit Governor Carey to stay for 17 months some facets of a Governmentordered ban on parking in midtown Manhattan.

title: The Battle With Egypt May Have W on Him New Sympathy Among Arabs
description: ALEXANDRIA, EgyptThe basic trouble with Col. Muammar elQaddafi, close associates say, is that he sees himself as a combination of the Prophet Mohammed and the late Egyptian leftist leader, Gamal Abdel Nasser. It wouldn't be easy to reincarnate one let alone both Moslem figures, and therein lie Colonel Qaddafi's strains with other nations and in particular with his fellow Arabs.

title: Mets' Box Score
description: SAN FRANCISCO (N.)

title: Cholera Outbreak in Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 6 (Reuters) At least 37 persons, mostly children, have died of cholera in the past three days in a suburb of Jakarta. Health authorities, who blamed the outbreak on unclean food and water, said more cases were being treated in hospitals.

title: This Week in Sports
description: Waite Hoyt, Al Lopez, Joe DiMaggio, Bill Bevens, Mickey Mantle, Eddie Mathews, Enos Slaughter, Don Larsen and Joe Pepitone have accepted invitations to participate in the OldTime& Day ceremonies before Saturday's game between the Yankees and the California Angels at Yankee Stadium.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor:

title: County Helps Elderly Get Jobs
description: WHITE PLAINS JONH K. FITZGERALD retired as a senior vice president of the Chemical Bank in January 1972, when he reached the mandatory retirement age of 65. He was retained for a time as a consultant and when that ended he found time was hanging heavy on my hands.

title: U.S. and Bonn Call Strong Dollar Economically Vital
description: PARIS, Aug. 6Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal of the United States and Finance Minister Hans Apel of West Germany agreed today that the dollar must remain strong to maintain the economic health not only of the United States but of the rest of the world.

title: Corporate Quest For Idyllic Sites Begins to Ruffle Estate Country
description: HARRISON, N.Y.It used to be the president of the corporation who was looking for a nice, rolling estate in a rural setting just beyond the suburban fringe. Now it's the corporation itself. And residents of estate country aren't all that happy about their new neighbors.

title: CHESS
description: There is one grandmaster, whom I shall not name, that far surpasses all others in his singular reluctance to resign a lost game. Nothing fazes him. He can drop several pieces, his queen, or a brace of rooks, and still play on. It's not that he expects a miracle to overturn the position, nor is it that he prolongs his agony as a kind of selfpunishment for having allowed himself to be bestedhe wants to reach the 40th move so he can adjourn the game.

title: Moscow Plans to Build New Zoo Using Ditches Instead of Bars
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 6 (Reuters)Moscow is to have a new zoo, 10 times larger than its present one, according to the zoo director, Vladimir Spitsin.

title: BlackoutCleanup Hiring to Begin
description: At least 2,000 unemployed New Yorkers will be hired by the city beginning tomorrow to assist in cleanup activities in the areas affected by looting and vandalism the recent blackout, Mayor Beame announced yesterday.

title: DOCTOR CHALLENGES THEORY ON DROWNING
description: An 18yearold student from Jackson, Mich., was trapped in his submerged car in a frozen pond for 38 minutes. Although rescuers pronounced him dead at the scene, he was revived and two weeks later was able to return to college, where ??e now is an A student.

title: Timber Sale Put Off To Save Two Eagles
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 6 (UPI)The United States Forest Service will delay the sale of eight million board feet of timber in order to save two young bald eagles.

title: Paperbacks:
description: LYNDON JOHNSON AND THE AMERICAN DREAM, by Doris Kearns. (NAL/Signet, $2.50.) The candid conversations LBJ allowed Doris Kearns, from her appointassent as a White House Fellow in 1967 to his death in 1973, enabled her to write this important pychobiography. Especially valuable are its accoutants of his formative youthful years and bis bitter time in retirement. A best seller in hardcover.

title: Architecture
description: The site is a majestic hillside, rough but rolling, not far from Santa Barbara, with a splendid view of the Pacific Ocean. To have built atop the hill would have destroyed a beautiful slice of rural California; to have built at the bottom would have denied the drama of the view. So architect Roland Coate Jr. did neither: He built the Alexander house inside the hill.

title: Encounter: I Was the Only GuestAnd I Was the Last
description: As a traveler I sometimes feel more at ease with the local architecture than the local people. A building, like a piece of music, is always accessible to a strangerand never insulted by a careless remark. Last year, when I was in Puerto Rico working on a television script, I looked about for a place to stay and soon noticed a curious old hotel called the Normandie. It stood on a thin neck of San Juan shoreline, rising from the corner of a hugely dangerous hairpin turn like a great old cruise ship at berth. Which is precisely what, the Hotel Normandie was: an exact replica on land of the prewar French luxury liner Normandie.

title: Joel E. Bueb Weds Patricia A. R. Farrell
description: Patricia Anne Rigas Farrell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James F. Farrell Jr. of New York and Deal, N. J., was married at noon yesterday to Joel Edward Bueb, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Bueb of Goshen, N. Y. Msgr. Paul Bradley performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Michael's Roman Catholic Church in West End, N. J.

title: Pravda to the Rescue
description: SovietAmerican relations have not run smoothly since Jimmy Carter's inauguration and altogether too much time has been spent of late on mutual recrimination. Indeed, Mr. Carter has been getting it from both sides, with a fair number of Americans ascribing the Russian pique to his ineptitude. So there's good news in Pravda's latest complaint against him. Unlike some of the President's jumpier American critics, the Russians accept his avowed desire for agreements, especially on arms control, and assure him that dtente has a future. It is some of his specific proposals they do not likeand some of his attitudes about what is fair and foul between superpower's trying to keep their competition cool. Fair enough.

title: 3 Held in $856,527 Theft
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP)Secret Service agents yesterday arrested a Transportation Department employee, his wife and another woman in the alleged theft of $856,527 from the Government through the fraudulent use of checks, a spokesman announced. He said William C. Sibert, 29 years old, and Lois A. Benson, 30, were taken into custody by Secret Service and agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in Las Vegas, Nev., as they left an airliner from Washington. Mr. Silbert's wife, Eva Marie, 23, was arrested at thb couple's home in Clinton, Md.

title: Visit to Fair to Be His 93d
description: MARION, Ohio, Aug. 7 (UPI)Orla Barks sad he planned to be among the early visitors to the Marion County Fair when it opened tomorrow for the 126th time. This year's even will be the 93d consecutive one he has attended. Barks, 97 years old, aid he did not remember much about the first one he attended at age 4, but he does remember the second. He got his first taste of ice cream that year.

title: Primary Roundup
description: Like it or not, Mario M. Cuomo said yesterday, law and order is the issue in the New York City municipal primary.

title: Bridge:
description: Players who live far from the main centers of bridgeplaying expertise, California, Texas and the Northeast. do not always get the recognition they deserve. While not precisely born to blush unseen, they are not seen as often as they should in finals of major team championships because they lack teammates of comparable ability.

description: Mortimer W. Dreyfus, president of WearRight Gloves of New York City, died Saturday at his home at 7 Lexington Avenue. He was 71 years old.

title: Senator Assails Official of S.E.C. In Alleged Slurs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The chairman of a Senate banking subcommittee has sent an angry letter to Harold M. Williams, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, protesting slurs an S.E.C. staff aide allegedly made on the Senator's integrity.

title: Dino Cardinal Staffa, 72, A Vatican Administrator And Prefect of High Court
description: ROME, Aug. 7 (Reuters)Dino Cardinal Staffa, Prefect of the Supreme Tribunal of the Apostolic Signatura, the highest court of the Roman Catholic Church, died here today at the age of 72, His death reduced to 137 the number of cardinals, of whom 120 are under the age of 80 and thus eligible to vote in the election of a new Pope.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
Belaboring Worker Safety
description: The Occupational Safety and Health Administration is in trouble. Business doesn't like the way it has played big brother, promulgating petty regulations. Labor isn't very happy with the agency's performance, either; it has done little to reduce jobrelated injury and illness.

title: Phillies 3, Dodgers 1
description: AT PHILADELPHIA  Steve Carlton became the first pitcher in the major leagues to win 16 games as he hurled the Phils to their fifth straight triumph. The victory enabled Philadelphia to stretch their Eastern Division lead over the Chicago Cubs to one game. Carlton, who has won 13 consecutive games at home since April 9, helped his cause with two hits and a sacrifice fly that broke a 11 tie.

title: 71 Triumph Eases Problems Slightly
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 7Although they didn't hear their owner call them the team that choked, the Yankees restored some spirit and spark to their sagging lives today by crushing the Seattle Mariners, 71.

title: Actors Who Leave Their Stamp On Roles Are a Theater Trauma
description: I don't want to go on vacation without leaving behind me a few condolences and a few compliments. Condolences are in order. I think, for all actors and actresses who must follow very distinguished performers in parts that they have made their own for all ??ternity, or for as long as living memories last. I had a small intimation of the traumas involved in this matter when, in London a few weeks ago. I watched a young and not particularly arresting player named Ronald Pickup walk onto the stage in Julius Caesar and pretend to be Cassiusrather as though John Gielgud had never existed and had not played Cassius.

title: HUSSEIN LESS GLOOMY OVER A MIDEAST PACT AFTER VISIT BY VANCE
description: TAIF, Saudi Arabia, Aug. 7Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance arrived in this Saudi summer capital today after receiving an encouraging sendoff in Amman, the Jordanian capital from King Hussein.

title: Rangers 4, Tigers 1
description: AT DETROITDock Ellis hurled an eighthitter and won his first game in a month as the charging Rangers moved to within three games of the pacesetting White Sox. Ellis, who has won four games and lost three for Texas since being obtained from Oakland on June 15, survived a basesloaded jam in the first inning on the way to his sixth triumph against nine losses.

title: How Old Is Old?
description: I have recently been retired. I use the passive voice deliberately. This retirement was no act of mine; it was forced upon me by a computer that simply threw up a name to be discarded. It was no act of an administrator who rationally considered the worker and her work. The worker. with an excellent record of attendance, responsibility and reliability, whose vigor and willingness were in no way diminished, had to be dismissed. The years of experience were less than nothing.

title: Phone Workers Strike in Iowa

description: HONOLULU, Aug. 7Mayor Frank F. Fasi's trial on bribery charges, suspended last Monday because he was indicted on a new briberyrelated charge while jury selection was still under way, may be delayed even longer because of tangled new developments.

The American League West Division leaders for Most of the season now have lost seven of their last eight games and have given new hope to the Minnesota Twins, Kansas City Royals and Texas Rangers.

description: PURCHASE, N.Y., Aug. 7Dave Ferrell, a 24yearold native of Mobile, Ala., now living in HoHoKus, N.J., won the Metropolitan Golf Association's 75th amateur championship today and immediately became known as one of the two longesthitting Met amateur champions.

title: The Canal Treaty: Words of Caution
description: WASHINGTONMe terms of the proposed new Panama Canal treaty are about to surface, and already an orchestrated campaign has begun to sell it without amendment to Congress and the public. In the process, two crucial and interrelated considerations are likely to be glossed over:

title: 200,000 AT TIJUANA WAIT TO BE SMUGGLED INTO U.S. BY DEADLINE
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Aug. 7Destitute migrants from the Mexican interior, estimated by the police here to number 200,000 to 250,000, are massed around this border city determined to reach the United States before Congress acts on an amnesty plan for illegal aliens that President Carter proposed last week.

title: World News Briefs
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 7 (Reuters) Rhodesian police were being aided today by one of three rival African nationalist groups in trying to track down those who yesterday killed 11 persons and injured 76 in a major bombing in Salisbury.

description: Sally Gail Cohen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ronald H. Cohen of Forest Hills, Queens, was married yesterday evening to Lawrence David Swift, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leon Swift of Cedar Springs, Mich.

title: Winter Mellowing His Blues
description: Johnny Winter, who performed at the Palladium a few months ago with an allstar blues group built around Muddy Waters, was back Saturday night with his own band. The changes his music has undergone since he began touring nationally in the late 1960's were evident, and largely salutary. But in one respect, at least, his music had come full circle, from hard blues through hard rock and back to the blues.

title: Argentine Journalist Kidnapped
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug 7 (Reuters)An Argentine journalist, Rodolfo Fernndez Pondal, 29yearold assistant editor of the weekly newsletter Ultima Clave, has been kidnapped, his relatives said today. They said he was seized Friday by two armed men near a central railway station and taken away in a car.

title: Vatican Still Bars BirthControl Vasectomy

But Viktor Korchnoi, a Russian emigree, ran away with the other semifinal, defeating Lev Polugaevsky, a Soviet grandmaster, 8 to 4 in Evian, France.

title: Argentine Beats McEnroeLindsay Beaven Victor
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug. 7Maybe John McEnroe would have lost anyway, because no one is beating Guillermo Vilas these days.

title: That Other Political Arena
description: Hour after hour last Wednesday and Friday, signers of Liberal Party mayoral petitions trooped to the witness stand in a dingy Supreme Court courtroom in Manhattan  unwitting and unwilling participants in the latest example of New York candidates' trying to use the state's election law maze to win in the courts rather than at the polls. State Senator Roy M. Goodman, the Republican organization mayoral designee who failed to win the Liberal designation, is trying to invalidate the Liberal endorsement of Mario M. Cuomo, one of the Democratic mayoral hopefuls, and force a freeforall, writein Liberal primary in which he would have a chance of winning the Liberal nomination. The Board of Elections upheld the Liberal petitions, but Mr. Goodman has taken his challenge to the courts.

title: $1.5 Billion Wasted on Alaska Pipeline, Report Says
description: ANCHORAGE, Aug. 7Builders of the $7.7 billion transAlaska pipeline wasted 51.5 billion through poor management and indifference to costs, a special report to the Alaska Pipeline Commission charged today.

description: WICHITA, Kan., Aug. 7Furrows of fatigue had added a dozen years to Elbert Urban's face as he rested his long frame against a car pulled up into the rich, red field where he had been plowing.

In the opener, Steve Brye wiped out a 10 Toronto lead with a tworun homer in the fourth inning, and sent Jerry Garvin to his 10th straight loss and his 13th in 20 decisions. In the second game, Brye again knocked in the goahead run in a threerun fifth inning with a double.

title: At This Saratoga Racing Party, Everybody Was in the Chips
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 7 Pretend you're rich and social and your husband is both a Vanderbilt and a Whitney. Would you care, really care, about potato chips?

title: California Homosexuals Prepare f or Schools Battle
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7Homosexual organizations in southern California, stung by the antihomosexual vote last June in Dade County, Fla., are preparing to fight a statewide initiative that would allow local school boards to dismiss or to deny employment to teachers who are onen and notorious homosexuals.

title: 2 Million Acres in the West Burn; Lightning Storms Increase Danger
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 7More than 1,000 fires have ravaged the West in recent days and nearly two million acres of and grasslands were still ablaze today in every state west of the Rockies from Alaska south.

title: 'Sandakan 8,' Japanese Film: Girl's Sold Into Prostitution
description: "Sandakan 8" is a Japanese film about prostitution, narrated from what is supposed to be a feminist point of view. However feminism, in this case, only means interjecting a particularly noxious form of man-hating where the pornographic touches ordinarily might be.The film doesn't dwell on sex unnecessarily, but it's plenty lurid just the same, in a disturbingly neo-Victorian way. This kind of treatment can't pass for enlightened, not by any stretch of the imagination. It's just plain reactionary.The story is told by a saccharine middle-class woman, a feminist historian of sorts, who encounters Osaki, a former karayuki-san, a term for girls who were sold into prostitution early in the century and then shipped out to colonies all over the Pacific. Osaki, now impoverished and nearly 70, invites the historian to her hovel, where the younger woman begins behaving like Little Miss Muffet, cringing prettily at the worms in the bath water.The historian just barely manages to stifle her revulsion until the old lady decides to tell her story, which turns out not to have been worth waiting for. Sample pearl: "Don't fall in love, no matter what. When you're in love, you're blind."Osaki's tale, told in flashback, repeatedly illustrates what loathsome brutes men are, and the historian, in a series of senseless cuts to the present, keeps on nodding sympathetically. Along the way, there is also some mention of Japanese imperialism, and of the homeland's hypocrisy in shunning the karayuki-san when they tried to return from the colonies. But most of the film, which is artlessly shot and acted in an exaggerated, melodramatic style, concentrates on proving that there really is a fate worse than death.Yoko Takahashi and Kinuyo Tanaka, two lovely actresses who play Osaki as a young girl and an old woman, have some impressive moments, on those few occasions when Kei Kumai's direction allows for any subtlety. As the historian, Komaki Kurihara wears an impenetrably pasty smile and does more harm than good. Osaki's story might have retained some of its integrity had it not been set in flashback; this way, too many present-day ironies are allowed to interrupt it, trivialize it and blunt its power.

description: ROBERT MOSES STATE PARK, L.I.At about 5 o'clock in the evening on every nice Sunday during the summer, thousands of people get the idea to leave this park at the same time, and their cars jam up bumper to bumper on the roads and bridges that lead back to their Long Island and New York City homes.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TURN OF THE SCREW With the minimal fanfare, a new display of graphic designs of the 1920's and 30's has just opened, running through October on the secondfloor Goodwin Galleries of the Museum of Modern Art. Drawn from the collection assembled by the designer Jan Tschichold that the museum acquired in 1950, the exhibition underscores a revolution in graphic arts between 1915 and 1935, when artists began conveying the power of turbines and engines, and glorified speed as symbolized by cars, steamships and airplanes.

description: BOSTON, Aug. 7 (AP)The glasssheathed John Hancock Tower, Boston's tallest building, continues to be plagued by window problems. A 52dfloor window blew out yesterday and fell to the street. No injuries were reported.

title: Purchasers Divided On Economic Trend
description: It Is an Inconclusive summernot too bad and not too goodaccording to the July report of the National Association of Purchasing Management. This group conducts a monthly survey of corporate purchasing agents, whose observations are considered to be an important indication of the cutting edge of economic activity. The latest verdict, in effect, is that the economy is in moderately good shape but that there's nothing to cheer about.

title: AMERICAN LEAGUE TWins 11, Indians 1

Mike Cubbage drove in five runs with his sixth homer and a threerun double. Rod Carew lined four hits, including three doubles, to raise his majorleague leading average to 387. It was the seventh time this season that Carew had four or more hits in a game.

A coastal plain extends along the Gulf of Mexico from Texas to the Yucatan Peninsula. About half the country lies below the Tropic of Cancer and most areas are deficient in rainfall for at least part of the year.

title: The Fun Governor
description: LOS ANGELESOutside the Los Angeles office of Jerry Brown is a large poster of Linda Ronstadt, the delectable folkrock artist who is occasionally seen with the young California governor.

title: Sweeping Back the Illegal Tide
description: Waves of illegal immigrants will continue to roll into the United States so long as travel is easy, borders are porous and even menial jobs here are better than squalor at home. That is problem one with the program President Carter has proposed to Congress concerning aliens. It is an earnest, creditable attempt to deal with a problem others have ducked; but it retains a Canutelike quality. The program calls for an enlarged Border Patrol, amnesty for most aliens already here and new sanctions against employers who use undocumented foreign workers. Such measures would be constructive, but they are unlikely much to affect a tide.
