title: Lightning Hits 5 in Central Park and a Queens Bather
description: Five persons were struck by lightning in Central Park yesterday afternoon and a sixth person was struck on the beach in Jacob Riis Park in Queens. Five of them were reported to be in serious condition.

title: Margaret A. Roston Wed To George Allan Hagedorn
description: Margaret Ann Roston, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Edward H. Roston of Hewlett, L.I., was married yesterday to George Allan Hagedorn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred A. Hagedorn 2d of Colorado Springs. State Supreme Court Justice Eli Wager performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

title: NYERERE SAYS CARTER IS FIRM OVER AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)President Julius K. Nyerere of Tanzania said today that President Carter was willing to use whatever pressures were necessary to bring an end to rule by white minorities in southern Africa.

title: RAILROADS FORESEE SECONDHALF GLOOM AFTER PEAK PROFITS
description: Many of the nation's railroads have been doing fine, but they are worried.

title: Reds 6, Pirates 0
description: AT CINCINNATIThe Pirates fell three games behind the firstplace Phillies in the National League East as Mario Soto, a 21yearold righthander who was called up from the minor leagues last month, hurled his first major league shutout. Tossing a sevenhitter, Soto raised his wonlost record to 21. The Reds were helped by three Pittsburgh errors, breaking a scoreless tie with five unearned runs in the seventh inning.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Explosion of Steam Pipe Kills 5 Pennsylvanians at Plantl
description: ALTOONA, Pa., Aug. 7 (UPI)A 12inch pipe carrying pressurized steam exploded today at a Pennsylvania Electric Company power plant in nearby Williamsburg, killing five men, critically injuring a sixth and causing extensive damage.

title: Around the Nation
description: PORT SAN LUIS, Calif., Aug. 7Fifty antinuclear protesters, using two stepladders to surmount a fivefoothigh barbedwire fence, today staged a carefully orchestrated symbolic incursion into the grounds of the inactive but highly controversial Diablo Canyon atomic power plant here.

title: Thais Report Cambodian Attack
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 7 (AP)About 50 Cambodian soldiers attacked Thai troops patrolling near the border in southeastern Thailand, the border police command said today. A spokesman here said three Thai soldiers were seriously wounded in the attack yesterday. After a 20minute exchange of fire the attackers retreated back across the border

title: Ailing Matlack Hurls Only an Inning
description: Rain, rain, come again; the wetter the Mets, the better their game.

title: Banks Promoting A Mechanical Pal
description: Tillie, Tallulah, Buttons and George. Ginny, Pat, Buddy and Sam. Harvey, Miss X, Ugly and It. Not to mention Turkey.

title: Namath's Ram Debut Short but Passable
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7Orderly was the word for Joe Namath's debut as a Los Angeles Ram last night.

title: Jamshid A mouzegar Is Named to Head Iran's Government
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 7 (AP)Jamshid Amouzegar, an Americaneducated engineer who as Iran's oil minister played a major role in raising world oil prices sharply three and a half years ago, was named Prime Minister today to replace Amir Abbas Hoveida, a Government spokesman announced.

title: Major League Leaders
description: HOME RUNS

title: Aussie Attains a Personal Comeback, 26, 64, 64
description: NORTH CONWAY, N.H., Aug. 7Manuel Orantes of Spain presided over the resurrection of John Alexander of Australia today in the finals of the $125,000 Volvo International tennis tournament in this tiny village deep in the heart of New Hampshire's White Mountains.

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed in order of post posit ons Letter designates OTB listing.

title: Kratzert Triumphs With 265
description: WETHERSFIELD, Corm., Aug. 7Two years ago, when he was frustrated after Raving failed to qualify for the Professional Golfers' Association tour, Bill Kratzert quit the sport and went to work driving a forklift truck in his home Town of Fort Wayne, Ind

title: Flogging Ordered in Rape Case
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates,. Aug. 7 (Reuters)A religious court here has jailed a 22yearold Lebanese for 12 years for raping two foreign women and ordered him to receive a public flogging of 100 lashes.

title: U.S. Negotiators in Panama: Both Sides Hopeful of Early Canal Pact
description: PANAMA, Aug. 7A highlevel United States negotiating team arrived here tonight for what may be the final week of 13 years of sporadic talks aimed at concluding a new treaty between the United States and Panama over the Panama Canal.

title: Commodities
description: Between June 1 and Oct. 1, Americans eat more bacon than during the rest of the year combined. Bacon, a lighter meat, goes well with the warmer weather. In particular, according to trade circles, every summer finds Americans consuming bacon, lettuce and tomato sandwiches in staggering numbers. The BLT's send bacon sales soaring.

title: How Citibank Simplified Loan Form
description: The translation of Citibank's old loan form has resulted in a legal document that seems almost absurdly simple by comparison. Here are two samples:

title: 200,000 AT TIJUANA WAIT TO BE SMUGGLED INTO U.S. BY DEADLINE
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Aug. 7Destitute migrants from the Mexican interior, estimated by the police here to number 200,000 to 250,000, are massed around this border city determined to reach the United States before Congress acts on an amnesty plan for illegal aliens that President Carter proposed last week.

title: Books of The Times
description: After reading Jules Witcover's Marathon: The Pursuit of the Presidency, 19721976, we feel a little like the Pittsburgh woman in hair curlers whom the author interviewed at the height of the campaign. Have you been watching the Presidential debates? he asked her. Oh, I watched a few minutes of the first one and then turned it off, she said. I don't want either of them influencing my vote. I want to make up my own mind.

title: A Poughkeepsie Bridge Still Stirs Controversy
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Aug. 7  A blackened bridge stands tall against the sky across the Hudson River here, unrepaired, unused and unsightly.

title: Con Ed's Obvious Flaws
description: The Federal Power Commission's investigation into the causes of the July 13 blackout puts much of the blame on Consolidated Edison. In a preliminary report, the F.P.C. cites obvious flaws in Con Edison's ability to provide reliable service. Stung by such harsh language, the utility retorted that if the flaws were all that obvious, why didn't the F.P.C.a regulatory body concerned with the reliability of the nation's power supply speak up sooner?

title: The Opera: Corsaro's Dr. Faust
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7In his new production of Ferruccio Busoni's Dr. Faust, which had its premiere last night at Wolf Trap, Frank Corsaro has outdone himself. He has produced a supercolossal Ken Russell type of interpretive musical psychology, using poor Busoni as a takeoff point. Banners bravely aloft, all systems go, the Corsaro army has once again marched down the wrong road. As in many of his previous productions, Mr. Corsaro has felt the urgent need to Do Something. But an audience exposed to Busoni's Dr. Faust for the first timeas most will be, considering the scarcity of performancescan come away from the Corsaro interpretation with only a distorted view of the strange, introspective, enigmatic opera.

title: Woman Slain in IRT  At Lincoln Center
description: A 34yearold teacher of Spanish was stabbed to death as she entered the IRT subway station at Lincoln Center shortly after noon yesterday.

title: THREE STRUCK AND KILLED BY LONG ISLAND TRAINS
description: A woman and two men were killed in separate incidents yesterday when they were struck by Long Island Rail Road trains.

title: Golf
description: AT WETHERSFIELD, CONN.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Speaking of corn, we have noted before that there is almost no food or indulgence that one medical man or survey cannot prove is harmful in one way or another. Sugar rots teeth, salt clogs up the arteries, dairy products are deadly, and clams give you hepatitis.

title: KODAK OBJECTS, BUT JUDGE ACCEPTS BERKEY EVIDENCE
description: The judge in a $300 million antitrust suit against the Eastman Kodak Company has agreed over Kodak's objections, to admit evidence intended to prove that the company's innovations have injured its filmprocessing competitors.

title: Algerian Truckers Opening Route Across Sahara to Nigerian Coast
description: ALGIERS (UPI)Except for camel caravans and possibly chariots driven by the mysterious Garamantes. the Sahara has been an impassable barrier to commercial traffic ever since the Western colonization of Africa.

title: Amateur Indians Give Germans Taste of Wild West
description: WEST BERLIN, Aug. 7 (AP)Fred Metasch and his fellow Radebeul Indians have pitched wigwams near Dresden, East Germany, for their annual festival of war dances, knife throwing and solidarity with the real native Americans.

title: Dividend Meetings This Week
description: Partial list scheduled for week follows:

title: Researchers Assert New Inflation in U.S. Can't Be Cured by Conventional Methods
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The nation is experiencing a new form of inflation that cannot be curbed by the conventional economic policies being pursued by the Carter Administration, concludes a report issued today by a Washingtonbased economic research group.

title: Standard Poodle Is Best at Hunterdon Hills
description: FLEMINGTON, N.J., Aug. 7Ch. Atekai Aphrodite, a magnificentlycoated white standard poodle owned by Mr. and Mrs. Terence Levy of Huntington, L.I., was judged the best in an allbreed field of 1,495 tonight at the 21st Hunterdon Hills show at the Flemington Fair Grounds.

title: Waltrip, Relief Driver, Takes Talladega 500
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., Aug. 7 (AP)Darrell Waltrip, driving in relief of Donnie Allison, who was suffering from heat fatigue, won the ninth annual Talladega 500 Grand National stockcar race today, as his two chief challengers faded because of engine trouble.

title: Rusie Among 6 Inductees Into Baseball Hall Today
description: COOPERTOWN, N.Y., Aug. 7 (AP)Amos Rusie, a pitcher at the turn of the century who sat out an entire season because of a contract dispute, will be among six former players enshrined in baseball's Hall of Fame tomorrow.

title: Advertising
description: Even in this age of conspicuous consumption, having eight television sets in the living room seems a little much. Kenneth R. Better's apartment at 303 Eat 57th Street is so equippednot for pleasure and not for torture but for business.

title: WILLIAM L. PHINNEY, 68, NEW HAMPSHIRE LAWYER
description: William L. Phinney, a prominent New Hampshire lawyer who prosecuted one of the nation's first cases of alleged euthanasia, died Saturday at his home in Manchester, N. H. He was 68 years old.

title: U.S. Information Act: Difficulties Despite Successes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7In the 10 years since it became law, the Freedom of Information Act has provided a powerful lever with which news organizations and private citizens have successfully pried secret facts and figures out of a reluctant Government.

title: Problems in Turkey Appear Too Deer for Its Coalitions
description: ANKARA, TurkeyDuring Turkey's recent election campaign, Prime Minister Suleyman Demirel declared: No matter how well they seem to function, coalitions are not stable forms of government. They have trouble in solving big problems, especially if these problems are fundamental ones.

title: Tanker Aground Near Miami
description: MIAMI, Aug. 7 (UPI)A tug failed today in a nattempt to free a Norwegian tanker that had run aground 15 miles southwest of Miami with 4,000 metric tons of fuel. The Coast Guard said that the 411foot vessel, the Bow El, had suffered no structural damage. Diesel fuel was to be pumped off the tanker in an effort to lighten it for a new effort by the tug.

title: Deaths
description: ASTLEYBELLLeonard A. In Sharon, Connection on August, ??, 1977. nusbanu of Priscilia rairlie Asiley bell of Sharon, Conn. Father or Mrs. Richard VanMeil Chicago. Brother or Mrs. E. M. Grayling Garsrang, England. Memorial services Wednesday Aug. 10th at 3:00 P.M. Christ Episcopal Church, Sharon, Conn. Burial private. In lieu of flowers donations may be sent to Sharon Hospital, Sharon, Conn. or the Sharon Fire Depi. Ambulance Brigage.

title: Opera: La Cenerentola in Paris Is Bit of Fun, but It's Not Rossini
description: PARISThe new production of Rossini's La Cenerentola at the Theatre National de l'Opra continues Rolf Liebermann's policy of rebuilding the company's repertory of 18th  and 19thcentury staples in productions that might most charitably be described as unusual. The Paris Cenerentola, by Jacques Rosner (direction) and Max Schoendorff (sets and costumes) is Cross between the same company's Faust, seen in New York last year, and the new Beaubourg arts center herea fanciful recreation of 19thcentury mechanics through the eyes of 20thcentury Surrealism and Dadaism. It's sort of fun, but it has absolutely nothing to do with anything Rossini might have intended.

title: Red Sox 5, A's 2
description: AT OAKLANDThe Red Sox rolled to their 10th straight triumph, including nine straight on their West Coast road trip, and raised their margin over Baltimore in the American League East to 3 games. The Red Sox broke a 11 tie in the ninth on Bernie Carbo's 12th home run. Fred Lynn later added three more runs with his 13th home run.

title: LUMMIS SAYS HUGHES WAS NOT GIVEN DATA
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 7Evidence turned up recently suggests that employees of the late Howard R. Hughes kept important business matters from him and failed to warn him of the consequences of some actions, the principal administrator of the Hughes estate has told a Federal district judge here.

title: Loss to Diplomats Only a Playoff Tuneup for Cosmos
description: The 21 loss to the Diplomats in Washington on Saturday night was nothing more than a tuneup match for the playoffs, according to Eddie Yirmani, the coach of the Cosmos who had rested four regulars, including Franz Beckenbauer and Giorgio Chinaglia.

title: New Energy Chief to Press Goals in Albany
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Brooklynborn James L. Larocca, scheduled for formal designation Thursday as the New York State Energy Commissioner, plans to emphasize conservation, conversion to coal and the carrot approach.

title: Texas Farmers in Price Protest
description: PAMPA, Tex., Aug. 7 (UPI)Texas farmers say they are not being paid much for their crops these days, so they are going to give some of them to President Carter.

title: Protesters Attack Police in Japan
description: TOKYO, Aug. 7 (UPI)Student radicals wearing red helmets and armed with homemade fire bombs attacked policemen today at Tokyo's new $733 million international airport in an attempt to halt the first day of noise tests by a Boeing 747. The police said two of the 3,200 riot policemen guarding the airport were injured. One suffered burns from a fire bomb while another was seriously injured when hit by a truck driven by one of the students.

title: Red Smith
description: CHILMARK, Mass., Aug. 7Grandpa, the fisherman asked, watching his companion crawl under a barbedwire fence; did you grow old or were you made old?

title: Providence Rugby Victor
description: SARANAC LAKE, N.Y., Aug. 7 (AP) The Providence (R.I.) Rugby Football Club, led by Bill Mullin's 18 points at fullback, blanked Old Blue of New York City, 300, and won the CanAm rugby tournament today.

title: Audit by Goldin Scores Ports Dept.
description: The New York City Department of Ports and Terminals could collect $4 million in additional annual revenues if it were better managed and awarded more of its concessions through competitive bidding, City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin charged in an audit released over the weekend.

title: Market Place
description: The battle for the Babcock & Wilcox Company seems to be entering a crucial final phase with price the ultimate weapon.

title: Business Said to Dominate Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7A detailed study by a Senate committee has found that business interests almost totally dominate Federal regulatory agencies and has recommended steps to right the balance, including public funding of citizen groups and the creation of an independent consumer agency.

title: Tongsun Park Is Sued
description: LOS ANGELES, July 30 (UPI)Tongsun Park has been charged in a multimilliondollar lawsuit with conspiring to take over a Korean food company here by illegal means.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Long Island Lighting Company said more than 30,000 cutomers were without electricity temporarily yesterday after thunderstorms passed over the Island.

description: NORTH AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Hundreds of Concerns in France Cooperate With Arab Boycott of Israel
description: PARIS, Aug. 7Last fall Asher Knippel, director of an importing concern in Israel, wrote to a large manufacturer of electrical household appliances in France asking it to forward us, at your earliest convenience, descriptive catalogues regarding all the range of your products.

title: Peter Sherwood Gengler Weds Judith A. Cheeseman
description: Judith Ann Cheeseman, daughter of Edward G. Cheeseman of North Kingston, R.I., and Jeanne E. Sjovall of Warwick, R.I., was married yesterday morning to Peter Sherwood Gengler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Gengler of Southport, Conn. The Rev. Thomas Ahlburn, a Unitarian minister, performed the ceremony at the Gengler home.

title: 2 Die, 6 Hurt in 4 A.M. Collapse Of CenturyOld Brooklyn House
description: A centuryold tenement in a rundown Brooklyn waterfront district partly collapsed in a cataract of bricks and timber before dawn yesterday, killing both an 8yearold girl left behind in a hurried evacuation and her father, who had rushed back into the tottering structure to try to rescue her.

title: Joe Baksi Dies at 55; Was a Top Heavyweight; Fought Charles, Walcott
description: Joseph William Baksi, who worked his way out of the Pennsylvania coal mines to become a top heavyweight fighter, died Saturday of a heart attack at the Albany Medical Center in Albany, N. Y. He was 55 years old.

description: AT FLEMINGTON, N.J. HUNTERDON HILLS THE CHIEF AWARDS

title: Hydroplane Racer Is Killed; N.F.L. Rookie Dies in Crash
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 7 (UPI)Jerry Bangs, an unlimitedhydroplane driver, was killed today when he was tossed from his speeding boat as it spun during the $30,000 Seafair Trophy race, won by Bill Muncey aboard Atlas Van Lines.

title: Night Law Schools Feel Pressure to Meet Higher Standards
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Aug. 7Like her neighbor, Emily Gassenheimer, Charlotte Mussafer decided that when her three children no longer required constant motherly attention, she would go to law school.

title: South Korean Labor Force Shows Increasing Unrest
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 7Four hundred workers defiantly refuse to work compulsory overtime. Seven hundred strike for six hours over wage demands. More than 300 start a demonstration march that clashes with the police.

title: Minimum Wage Rise Predicted
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)Sen. Harrison A. Williams Jr., chairman of the Human Resources Committee, predicted in an interview that Congress would pass the proposed increase in the minimum wage without excluding young people. The New Jersey Democrat said two weeks of hearings on the proposed increase, from $2.30 an hour to $2.65, had brought out less dugin opposition to dealing with minimum wage this year than before.

title: BRUNO DUE TO TESTIFY ABOUT CASINOS TODAY
description: TRENTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)Angelo Bruno, said to be the Mafia boss of Philadelphia and southern New Jersey, will be the star witness tomorrow when the State Commission of Investigation begins a series of hearings on casino gambling in Atlantic City.

title: QUEENS PROSECUTOR NAMES PAROLE UNIT
description: The District Attorney of Queens, John J. Santucci, has set up a panel of six assistants to provide more consistent handling in reviewing cases of Queens convicts coming up for parole.

title: Padres 8, Cubs 6 Cubs 9, Padres 4
description: AT CHICAGO  Gene Tenace and Dave Kingman each cracked tworun homers and Bill Almon and Mike Champion contributed three hits each as the Padres won the opener. The Cubs gained a split as Jose Cardenal drove in four runs wtih a threerun homer and a single in the second game. Kingman and Mick Kelleher of the Cubs were ejected in the second game after Kingman knocked Kelleher down while sliding into second base.

title: Young Is Confident That Mexicans Will Favor Carter Plan on Aliens
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 7Andrew Young, who is on a 10country goodwill mission for President Carter, said on his arrival here today that he expected the Mexican Government to react favorably to a new White House plan to regularize the status. of millions of aliens who have slipped illegally into the United States, mainly from Mexico and the Caribbean islands.

title: Energy Department Planners Working for Oct. 1 Opening
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)  Ahundredmember team is working to put together the new Department of Energy by Oct. 1.

title: Bergen Women Sought for High Political Office
description: HACKENSACK, Aug 7Bergen County, which has never had a woman legislator in Washington, has started a drive to correct that shortcoming.

title: HUSSEIN LESS GLOOMY OVER A MIDEAST PACT AFTER VISIT BY VANCE
description: TAIF, Saudi Arabia, Aug. 7Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance arrived in this Saudi summer capital today after receiving an encouraging sendoff in Amman, the Jordanian capital, from King Hussein.
