description: For most people, Elvis Presley was rockandroll. And they were right. Bill Haley may have made the first massive rock hit, and people such as Chuck BerrY and Little Richard may have had an equally important creative

title: Four in Family Die in Fire
description: GLOCESTER, R.I., Aug. 16 (AP)A family of four perished this morning when flames swept through their cottage in the Chepachet section of this rural northwestern Rhode Island town, according to the state police. Positive identification has not been made, the state police said.

title: Companies Issue Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended June 30 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) Indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (0), Overthecounter.

title: Bus Agency for Suburban Detroit Warns Striking Drivers on Jobs
description: DETROIT, Aug. 16(AP)  Striking drivers will be dismissed if they do not return to work, the general manager of the bus agency serving Detroit suburbs said today.

title: Coal Output Short of Demand
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 16 (AP)Nationwide coal production this year will fall 33 million tons shorts of demand because of a twomonth wildcat strike by Appalachian miners, industry officials said today. Edwin Anthony, spokesman for the National Coal Association, said it would he the first time in three years that coal production had not met consumption demand. the amount consumed by domestic and foreign customers.

title: Catholic Prelates Organizing a Drive Against Abortions
description: Archbishop Joseph L. Bernardin, president of the National Conference of Catholic Bishops, signaled the start of a major new church drive against abortion last night, coupling it with proposals for churchled campaign against social ills that cause women to seek abortions.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: ON A RECENT hot afternoon, John BuettnerJanusch was walking home from his office on Washington Square when he decided buy a glass of orange juice from a young Hispanic man who had set up shop on the southeast corner of Fifth Avenue and Eighth Street.

title: Tremor Strikes South Italy
description: ROME,Aug. 16 (UPI)Thousands of tourists and residents in the Calabria and Puglia regions of southern Italy slept outdoors early today after a sharp earth tremor that shook many from their beds. Officials said the tremor, which struck shortly after midnight, measured a moderately strong 78 on the Mercalli scale, but caused no damage or injuries.

title: Launching of Trident Is Delayed by Winds
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Aug. 16 (AP)Adverse wind conditions forced a delay in a test launching of the Navy's powerful Trident missile until tomorrow, automatically postponing a launching of the Italian satellite Sirio.

title: Kin of Jailed Dissidents Meet In Seoul to Demand Their Release
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 16 (Reuters) Wives and mothers of about 30 jailed South Korean political dissidents today demanded the immediate and unconditional release of all dissidents.

title: Focus on Fancy Furs In a 2Part Campaign
description: How do you make an advertising impact when you're selling fur coats that range in price from $15,000 to $50,000? The answer, according to D. H. Grosvenor Inc., a leading Canadian fur manufacturer, is to run a series of multipage ads in Vogue magazine to present the company's theme, Furs From Around The World.

title: HOUSING STARTS UP TO AN ANNUAL RATE OF OVER 2 MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP)Housing construction picked up suddenly in July, indicating that 1977 may be a better year for housing than economists had expected, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Russian Dressing
description: The ultimate salad bar includes nearly 20 side dishes to be added to the composeityourself salad, including a variety of dressings, relishes, pickles, cottage cheese and whatever else the unleashed imagination finds suitable. Of course, in its most pedestrian form the salad bar may consist of nothing more than an enormous bowl of torn or cut iceberg lettuce centered on table and surrounded by fewer than a basic dozen side dishes. The salad bar is essentially a kind of smorgasbord, an uncovered dish supper of garden greenery with elaborate (or not so elaborate) trimmings.

title: Joffrey to Open 5 Weeks at City Center on Oct. 13
description: AFTER A YEAR'S absence, the Joffrey Ballet will return to City Center55th Street Theater for a fiveweek fall season beginning on Oct. 13. The company will present seven premieres, including its first fulllength ballet, Romeo and Juliet, by Oscar Araiz. The ballet will first be performed at a gala benefit Oct. 12, the night preceding the company's official opening.

title: Italians,Bitter at Escape of Nazi, Gather at Graves of His Victims
description: ROME,Aug. 16Sorrow, skepticism and anger marked a demonstration here today to protest the escape of convicted Nazi war criminal, Col. Herbert Kappler, from a Rome military prison Sunday night.

title: Giants Close To Deal for A New Man
description: The Giants are close to a trade for someone we really like, Coach John McVay said yesterday.

Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, ndicated that he welcomed President Carter's latest efforts to mend troubled Soviet _American relations. He pledged that the Soviet Union would respond to Iny practical measures to resolve the :urrent differences. [Page Al, Column 6.]

description: When I reached the age of reason, between the dog tag years and the bomb shelter era, I gathered up my coloring books and Crayolas and took to my bed. I spent the better part of my youth in a prone position, working my way through Nandy Drew and contributing heavily'to the growth of Mallomar futures. She likes to read, my parents told neighbors who inquired after my health.

title: BREZINEV DEPICTS CARTER'S OVERTURE AS A POSITIVE MOVE.
description: MOSCOW, Aug, 16Leonid  Brezhnev indicated today that he welcomed President'Carter's latest efforts to mend SovietAmerican relations and pledged that the Soviet Union would respond to any practical measures to resolve the current! differences.

title: London Financial Times Closed
description: LONDON,Aug. 16 (Reuters)  The Financial Times will not appear tomorrow for the eleventh consecutive day, a management spokesman said today. The business daily has been closed by a dispute that followed a decision by the management to stop 57 compositors from taking nights off when they were being paid.

title: Elephant and Tiger and Rhinoceros Roaming the Bronx? Preposterous!
description: Elephants crashed out of the forest and lumbered down the hillside to splash into the water. Four of them plunged in over their heads, bobbed up to spray the water from their trunks and cavorted playfully together.

title: Riot Act Used to Stop Feminists in Pretoria
description: PRETORIA, South Africa Aug. 16 (Reuters)South African riot policemen, seeking to stop a protest march by white women demanding equal rights with white men, invoked a law today that was designed to prevent black riots.

title: 60 Minute Gourmet
description: WHEN it comes to what might be called cooking a la minute, the virtues of pound meat are immediately apparent. Chief among them is their cooking nature. Toss a quarterpound of firstquality ground beef on a hot grill or into a lightly oiled (or even moiled) skillet, a touch of salt, a sprinkling of pepper and a dollop of butter and the results are almost foolproof.

title: 9 INJURED IN BOMB BLAST ON BUS IN NORTH ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 16Terrorists struck again at Israeli public transportation today when a bomb exploded in a crowded bus in the Jezreel Valley in northern Israel, injuring eight passengers and the driver.

description: DIJON, FRANCE

title: S.I.A. Requests S.E.C. to Support Company to Build National Market
description: The Securities Industry Association, as expected, formally recommended yesterday a corporation governed and financed by the securities industry to oversee the development of the network leading to a national market system.

title: Suharto Gives Rebels Amnesty
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 6 (Reuters) President Suharto announced a general amnesty today for remnants of leftwing guerrilla forces still roaming the mountains in the former Portuguese colony of East Timor, now part of Indonesia. President Suharto made the announcement in a speech to Parliament on the eve of the country's 32d independence day. He said the security situation in East Timor had improved rapidly since it was incorporated into Indonesia last year.

description: GOLDSMITHLeonIf possible, I love you more than ever.

title: HARRY A. RICHARDS SR.
description: Harry Ames Richards Sr., who retired in 1957 as vice president, counsel and director of Case, Pomeroy & Company, privateinvestment company in Manhattan, died Monday in Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. He lived at 755 Westover Road, Stamford. and was 89 years old.

title: A. R. Luria, Soviet Psychologist, 75; A Pioneer in Studies of the Brain
description: Aleksandr R. Luria, a Moscow University psychologist and brain specialist, has died at the age of 75, the Soviet press agency Vass reported yesterday.

title: Chess:
description: Every player should experiment from time to time with formations foreign to his style for the sake of gaining broader experience and introducing freshness into his play. title: U.S. RIGHTS DRIVE ASKS AID OF LATIN MILITARY
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 16President Carter's diplomatic representatives are seeking to promote respect for human rights in South America by working through the existing military regimes, not aeainst them.

title: DR. JOHN G. LEXA
description: Dr. John G. Lexa, an adjunct associate professor of comparative constitutional law at New York University, died Sunday in his home, 7419 43d Avenue, Elmhurst, Queens, after suffering a heart attack. He was 62 years old.

title: BROOKLYN CONCERN TO PAY $110,000 IN BACK WAGES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16A New York City construction company has agreed to pay $110,000 in back wages to 46 employees in what a Department of Labor official described as perhaps the largest such payment made under a Federal contract law.

title: Atlas Copco Makes Offer
description: Atlas Copco, a machinery manufacturer in Stockholm, announced it had offered $40 million, or $25 a share, for all shares of Sullair Inc. of Michigan City, Ind. Sullair is a producer of portable compressors. It reported sales of $65 million in 1976 and forecasts sales of $85 million this year.

description: The nation's coal industry, readying itself to meet sharply rising demand, has hung up a giantsized Help Wanted sign.

description: It has been a good year for the Bally Manufacturing Corporation of Chicago: New Jersey legalized casino gambling and New York City lifted a 35year ban on pinball machines.

title: Dead Fish Found in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 16 (AP)Thousands of dead fish have been found floating in the Delaware River at the Philadelphia Naval Yard. They apparently suffocated. The oxygen content was low, but that's frequently true this time of year, Scott Stenquist of the Federal Fish and Wildlife Service said today. We don't know whether the oxygsen was responsible, but that's what is suspected. He said the dead fish, numbering between 2,000 and 3,000, were alewives, a a member of the herring family.

title: South Carolina News Groups Ask High Court Ruling on Press Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (UPI)South Carolina newspapers and broadcasters today asked the Supreme Court to reconcile the differing views of lower Federal courts on when and how the activities of reporters covering trials can be restricted.

title: Explanation by Teng Printed in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 16 (UPI)Teng Ilgiaoping, reinstated last month as China's thirdranking leader, says he was dismissed last year because he promoted young leaders to oppose the radical group that has since been pured, the newspaper Ming Pao of Hong Kong said today.

title: Brazil Reports Trade Surplus
description: BRASILIA, Aug. 16 (UPI)Brazil has registered its third consecutive month of trade surplus in July, the Finance Ministry reported today. The July surplus totaled $110.3 million with exports of $1.02 billion, against imports of $910.6 million. Finance Minister Mario Henrique Simonsen said the July figures were particularly favorable because coffee exports?long the trade leader, only represented 9.69 percent ($95 million) of the total exports.

title: Renee Richards Ruled Eligible for U.S. Open
description: Dr. Renee Richards has won the right to qualify for the United States Open tennis championships without passing a sex chromosome test.

title: Spanish Bread Bakers Punished:. For Reducing Size of the Loaves
description: MADRID, Spain, Aug. 16 (UPI)The Government imposed heavy fines today on leaders of the bakery industry, arrested four of them and warned that army bakers might take over the ovens.

title: GLAMOUR WEAKNESS SENDS KEY AVERAGES OF MARKET PLUNGING
description: Weakness in the glamour sector helped to unsettle the stock market yesterday and plunged both the Dow Jones industrial and transportation averages to their lowest levels of 1977.

title: Nuclear Test Planned Under Desert Today.
description: YUCCA FLAT, Nev., Aug 16 (UPI)The United Stated plans to explode its fifth nuclear test this year at 10:20 A.M. tomorrow, Federal officials said yesterday.

title: Stronger Dollar Up Against Most Currencies Except Yen and Pound
description: Buoyed by the Federal Reserve Board's tightening of its credit posture, the dollar gained yesterday against most world currencies in foreignexchange trading, The Associated Press reported.

title: POLICE ARE CRITICIZED ON TOWAWAY STATISTICS
description: The New York City Police Department was accused yesterday by City Councilwoman Carol Greitzer, Democrat of Manhattan, of falsifying towaway statistics to indicate that it was complying with Federal cleanair standards by cracking down on midtown parking.

title: COMMERCIAL PAPER RISE DESCRIBED AS CYCLICAL
description: It is not so, as some have suggested, that large corporate borrowers are making a fundamental shift away from banks and toward the commercial paper market for their shortterm credit needs. That, at least, is the message the three top officials at the Manufacturers Hanover Corporation delivered in a letter to stockholders that was released yesterday.

title: LaBelle Lance Says the Carters Are Still Friends
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16  LaBelle Lance says that she and her husband, Bert, director of the Office of Management and Budget, remain on good terms with their longtime friends, President and Mrs. Carter, despite the pressures of Federal investigation into Mr. Lance's personal and business finances.

title: Television
description: Morning 6:10(2,7)News

title: 3% of Weeden Holding Will Go To Nomura After Wainwright Tie
description: Nomura Securities International Inc. will own about 3 percent of the Weeden Holding Corporation's equity upon completion of the recently proposed merger of Wainwright Securities Inc. of New York into Weeden, Donald E. Weeden, chairman of Weeden, said yesterday.

title: PARIS NEWSPAPER STRIKE ENDS AFTER 29 MONTHS
description: PARIS, Aug. 16The 29month strike against Parisien Libere, the longest and bitterest in the history of the French press, ended tonight with a compromise agreement between management and labor.

title: Rotian Defends T rips at Assembly Committee Hearing
description: Dr. William J. Ronan defended yesterday the expensepaid overseas trips he took with his wife when he was chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, and he told a legislative inquiry that such business travel by commissioners and their spouses should be encouraged.

title: PROF. H. H. WILSON, 68, IN ACCIDENT AT HOME
description: Dr. H. H. Wilson, a civil rights activist who was a professor in Princeton University's department of politics for 30 years until his retirement last May, died Monday in an accident at his home in Solebury. Penn. He was 68 years old.

title: Brenninkmeyers Seek MillerWohl
description: The Dutch Brenninkmeyer interests, which acquired the Ohrbach's stores 15 years ago, were identified yesterday by the MillerWahl Company as the source of a $160 million offer in a prospective merger transaction.

title: Gov. Rhodes Is Hit in Face With a Pie by Protester
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 16  Gov. James A. Rhodes was hit in the face and shoulder with a banana cream pie as about 25 young demonstrators disrupted the opening of the Ohio State Fair today.

title: Carey Signs a Bill Aimed at Holding Down Auto Insurance Premiums
description: ALBANY, Aug. 16Governor Carey announced today that he had signed bill revising the state's nofault automobile insurance law. The bill is intended to hold down increases in premiums by limiting medical costs and reducing the number of suits for pain and suffering that can be brought in the courts.

title: Bargain Hunters Help Stabilize Most Commodity Futures Markets
description: Bargain hunters moved into the commodity futures pits yesterday along with price and volume chart watchers, and their combined buying helped stabilize most markets after last Monday's broad selloff.

title: Mets Defeat Cards on SevenHitter by Zachry, 51
description: ST.LOUIS, Aug. 16The patience of Joe...and Rube...and John helped put Pat Zachry back together again tonight, and the pitcher went on to beat the St. Louis Cardinals, 51, for his first complete game in a New York uniform.

title: Sea Creatures Survive Ascent From Ocean Depths for First Time
description: LA JOLLA, Calif.,Aug. 16Shrimplike creatures, amphipod crustaceans, have been recovered alive from ocean depths as great as 18,700 feet, the first time I animals have survived ascent from the Very deep sea floor.

title: LANCE INVESTIGATION IS TERMED UNETHICAL
description: CALHOUN, Ga., Aug. 16The chairman of the board of Calhoun's First National Sank, which Bert Lance, the director of the Office of Management and Budget, once headed, accused the Comptroller of the Currency today of unethical, unfair, And illegal conduct in his investigation of Mr. Lance's finances and the affairs of the bank.

title: Williams Leads Sweep Of 100 Meters by U.S.
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 16 (AP)Steve Williams led a United States sweep today of the top three places in the 100meter dash at an international track and field meet.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16Ranking officials of the Securities and Exchange Commission's enforcement staff are personally directing an intensive effort to salvage what regulatory sources close to the investigation describe as an inade quate report on New York City's financial crisis.

title: Sitting During Flag Pledge Upheld
description: NEWARK, Aug, 16A state law requiring all public school students in New Jersey to at least stand at attention during the pledge of allegiance to the American flag was overturned as unconstitutional today in Federal District Court.

title: U.S. JUDGE IS CHOICE AS NEW F.B.I.DIRECTOR
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16Frank M. Johnson Jr. of Alabama, a Federal District Court judge who gained a national reputation in the late 1950's and early 1960's because of decisions that advanced the cause of civil rights, has been selected to be the new director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Administration sources said today.

title: Books: Out of Obscurity
description: THE science of maritime surveying, a practical art so necessary to sea commerce and warfare, was virtually created by Sir Francis Beaufort, the British Navy's hydrographer, or chartmaker, from 1829 to his death. His work was so good, so precise, thtt much of it still stands as authoritative, yet the man himself is all but forgotten except by those who know his scale of wind forces, by historians of cryptography or by those to whom the Beaufort Sea off North Alaska is more than a place

title: Tremor Called 71 Aftershock
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 16 (AP)A tremor that jarred. southern Californians last week was not a quake in its own right but a muchdelayed aftershock of the 1971 San Fernando Valley temblor that killed 65 persons, the California Institute of Technology says.

title: New York Borrows $150 Million From U.S.
description: New York City borrowed $150 million from the United States Treasury Department at 7.38 percentthe highest rate it has had to pay for shortterm loans since the beginning of the Federal Seasonal Financing Act of 1975.

title: David E. Schimmel Dies at 70; A Former Plastics Executive
description: David E. Schimmel, a director and former president of the Dayco Corporation, plastics manufacturers of Dayton, Ohio, died Saturday in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 70 years old.

title: K mart Net Adds 19.6% in Quarter; Penney Gains 9%
description: The K mart Corporation, yesterday reported profit increases of 19.6 percent for its second fisal quarter, while the J. C. Penney Company, nudged out of second place in the retail merchandising field by K mart early this year, showed a gain of 9 percent for its latest quarter.

title: An Imperfect School Board Plan
description: Even some of the severest critics of New York City's Board of Education opposed Mayor Beame's desire replace the board with a commissioner of his choice, responsible only to City Hall. So the Mayor has revised his proposal. He would now retain a lay board, but unsalaried, the members to serve at his pleasure. That is good idea. A less good idea is to have a professional chancellor manage the systemand also preside over the board. That would further obscure the central issue: how much powerand therefore responsibilitycan Mayor currently exercise over the school system and how much more does he, and should he, want? The question arises with such intensity not because it can be resolved before the election but because Mr. Beame wishes to dramatize his alleged impotence in education over the past four years. Yet he has budget power, and more, as he demonstrated in decapitating the equally independent Health and Hospitals Corporation. The public's influence over a clearly unsatisfactory school system might well be increased if elected officials bore more visible responsibility for it. But there is also sound tradition in American education for lay boards of education to uphold educational values against public officials, unions and other power centers. These considerations need to be balanced in a new structure by a new state law. The matter is Dressing but best left till after the election.

title: Madison Avenue On Mott Street
description: Have you ever dined in a restaurant in Chinatown and wondered what those streamerlike signs hanging from the walls'were all about? Generally, they are there to advertiseto the Chinesereading customersthe specialty of the house, a special of the day, or just to call attention to one of the restaurant's recommended dishes. These dishes may or may not be on the menu, and those who cannot read Chinese are welcome to request a translation. These signs, photographed recently in 4 Chinatown restaurant, advertise clockwise from the top: fried shrimp, fresh live lobsters worth eating; steamed crabs; duck blood with bean sprouts; steamed flounder; deepfried pigeon.

title: Notes on People
description: THE FAMED Nazihunter Simon Wiesenthal said in Vienna yesterday that Josef Mengele, known as the death doctor of Auschwitz is living in Paraguay and it is impossible to get him out of that country because the Germans established in Paraguay are wielding powerful influence there. Mr. Wiesenthal, whose Jewish Documentation Center tracks down missing war criminals, said that Dr. Mengele was photographed walking on a road in Asuncion last year and he frequently visits German club in the Paraguayan capital. Dr. Mengele is accused by the Polish Government of conducting criminal medical experiments at Auschwitz on death camp internees, and of ordering the gassing of 4,000 gypsies in 1943 to obtain medical samples.

title: Aides Call Conference
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 17Two of Elvis Presley's bodyguards and coauthors of .a book about the perform er, said at a press conference in Beverly Hills today that the 42yearold rockandroll star had used drugs extensively. The bodyguards, who had been dismissed by Mr. Presley in July 1976, said that the performer had used stimulants, depressants, qualudes and cocaine. They said he had never used heroine. He started using drugs in the early 60's when he was making movies and couldn't get to sleep, said Sonny West, an old friend of Mr. Presley's from Memphis and his bodyguard for 16 years. Mr. West and his cousin, Red West, another bodyguard and coauthor, knew the star in high school.

title: Notes on People
description: first Thor Heyerdahl crossed the Pacific on the balsa raft KonMi. Then he sailed transAtlantic in a papyrus boat, the Ra II. Now, he said in Laigueglia, Italy, he plans to sail the Indian Ocean on interlaced rushes. The Norwegian explorer, who makes his oceanic trips to show how the ancients could have done the same thing, said yesterday he planned to start his Indian Ocean trip in November from the headwaters of the Persian Gulf. The point of the voyage is to prove that the Sumerians, the ancient people of Iraq, could have traveled as far as southern Africa and India 5,000 years ago. The 62yearold Mr. Heyerdahl's reed craft, called the Tigris, will carry a crew of 14, most of them veterans of the Atlantic crossing on the Ra papyrus boat seven years ago. This time we will sail against the currents and winds, Mr. Heyerdahl said. Thus our efforts will be much difficult.

The body of Dr. Herbert Wilson, 68 years old, was found Mon(lay. by his widow, Virginia, in the swimming pool behind the Wilsons home in nearby Solebury Township, theauthorities said. The Bucks County coroner's office said an autopsy showed that Dr. Wilson's death was caused by. drowning associated with anaphylactic reaction [shock] due to bee stings.

title: GARDENING
description: NOW, JUST when the geraniums impatiens, coleus, begonias, petunias and lantanas are covered with mounds of colorful flowers, is the time to steel yourself to cut them. Not severely, but gently enough to take some succulent shoots for rooting. These little slips, as grandmothers call them, will root easily and be strong enough to pot and grow indoors during the winter. When the ice and snow come, you will have reminders of summer's flower borders on the windowsills.

title: New Carnegie Hill Boutiques Bring Back the Old Elegance
description: AT LAST the Carnegie Hill section of Manhattan has a shop pers area in keeping with the elegant traditions of the neighborhood. This past year 10 new stores, offering everything from Victorian wicker to maizemeal soap, have opened on that stretch of Madison Avenue that runs from 86th Street to 93d Street. The area's fading shoerepair shops and tired delicatessens are being replaced with lively, original boutiques.

title: CORRECTIONS

title: Storm Brings Flooding to Dry Southern California
description: LOS ANGELES. Aug. 17Southern California, which along with most of the West is in the second year of its worst drought of the century, finally got some rain yesterday, and today. And when the rain came, it came in buckets.

title: 'Ruby' Is Not Precious
description: PIPER LAURIE and Stuart Whitman, a couple of actors who have known better days, turned up yesterday in theaters in and around New York City in "Ruby," a movie whose elements have also seen better days.More than inciting shock and horror, this is the sort of movie that inspires genealogy. Floating around in it are large chunks of "The Exorcist"; costumes out of all those 30's and 40's movies in which gangsters affected dinner jackets and gleaming white starched shirtfronts; a soupcon of something called "J.D.'s Revenge," a summer entertainment of recent if not remarkable vintage; and a pair of eyeballs afloat in liquidthe sort of preserves usually put up by the Hammer Films folks in England.What seems to be going on around the swamp-country drive-in movie theater operated by Miss Laurie and Mr. Whitman is a lot of supernatural carnage. It seems that Nicky (Sal Vecchio), the once and future lover of Ruby (Miss Laurie), a one-time chanteuse, starlet and gang moll, has risen from his watery grave to wreak some vengeance, on the underworld colleagues he holds responsible for his demise.From time to time, he manifests his presence through Jannit Baldwin, who plays his and Ruby's silent, protuberant-eyed daughter. To provide the straight-faced mumbo-jumbo intended to lend a scientific veneer to the proceedings, Roger Davis is called in to portray Dr. Keller, a parapsychologist.The makers of "Ruby" apparently believe that lots of gore, hints of incest and necrophilia, skeletal embraces and those preserved eyeballs are the stuff of which adequate horror films are made. Even within its own modest league, this movie is a dull concoction.

title: Mortgage Insurance Costs
description: Private mortgage guarantee insurance companies such as MGIC Investment Corporation, which controls about half the market, tend to compete on the basis of service rather than price. Thus, there is little variation in premium costs. Coverage is generally arranged by the mortgage lender and paid for by the home buyer. The first year's cost is usually 1A of 1 percent of the unpaid balance of the mortgage$150 on a $30,000 mortgage, for example. The cost is onequarter of 1 percent a year thereafter on the unpaid balance, and continues at that rate until the coverage is canceled. That occurs when the loan is amortized to 75 percent of the sales values of the house. Premium costs can be cut by a variety of available prepayment plans.

description: One of the problems of young jazz musicians who grow up in traditional jazz surroundings is that they are encouraged to copy the style of someone who, played 40 or 50 years ago to the exclusion of going beyond that. In fact, therd is little reason to go beyond that nowadays because there are relatively few :jobs for jazz musicians, old or young, whose roots are in preWorld War II jazz styles.

title: Moerken, Petra Thuemer Set World Swim Marks
description: JONKOPING, Sweden, Aug. 17 (AP)Gerald Moerken of West Germany and Petra Thuemer of East Germany set world records today at the 14th European swimming championships.

title: Bell Says F.B.I. Nominee Reconsidered After Deciding He Made a Mistake in Refusing Post Last December
description: WASHLNGTON, Aug. 17  President Carter, as expected, today nominated as the next director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation Frank M. Johnson Jr. of Alabama, a Federal district judge who was offered but tcfused the position eight months ago.

title: Pop: Margaret Whiting Proj ects Intimacy
description: MARGARET WHITING, who is singing at the Rainbow Grill through Saturday, something of an anomaly. Although she is known best for songs she recorded in the 1940'sMoonlight in Vermont, It Might as Well Be Spring and A Tree in the Meadowand she underlines her relationship to that decade with a medley of other songs from the 40's, Miss Whiting seems much more in tune with the contemporary songs that take up a large part of her program.

title: NEW &
description: Lisa Hanunel

title: INSULATION SUPPLIES SHORT AS PRICES RISE
description: A rush by the public to insulate homes and production bottlenecks in two key industries have created a shortage of insulation materials and higher prices for them that industry and consumer leaders expect to worsen if Congress passes the Carter Administration's energy conservation tax incentive program.

title: Lumber and Plywood Futures Increase by Daily Price Limits
description: The nearby deliveries of lumber and plywood futures advanced their daily price limits yesterday, with the more dis tant months closing with strong gains. And all deliveries set contract highs as well.

title: Bomb Plot on Juan Carlos Is Foiled
description: MADRID, Aug. 17 (UPI)An assassination attempt against King Juan Carlos, Queen Sofia and Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez was foiled today when the police discovered a bomb under an overpass only moments before the King's car was duet the national news agency Cifra reported.

title: Bomb Threat on Israeli Ship
description: ELIZABETH, Aug. 17(AP)About 40 crew members from an Israeli cargo ship, Zim Montreal, were evacuated from the vessel Monday after an anonymousbomb threat was phoned in to the police, the authorities said today. The Elizabeth police said someone with a thick accent called shortly before 2 A.M. and said the bomb would go off about an hour later. But a sixhour search failed to turn up any explosive devices, a Port Authority police official said.

title: Financial Times Locks Out Union
description: LONDON, Aug. 17 (AP)The Financial Times, London's leading financial newspaper, today failed to appear for the 11th consecutive day because of a labor dispute, and management announced it was locking out 232 union production workers and suspending their salaries.

title: Two Fine Pianists Join Miss Norman
description: TWO OF AMERICA'S best young pianists joined forces for two of the greatest pieces ot the duet literature Tuesday night in very Fisher Hall. Because the third soloist was the redoubtable American soprano Jessye Norman, the Mostly Mozart program received a sturdy assist from the New World.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: A recent survey by Michael Knight of The Times showed that control of suburban schools is passing from par. ents and local school boards to agencies of state and Federal governments and the teachers unions. The conclusions of this significant report need not be confined to suburban schools. The loss of local power affects cities as well as suburbs. The trend is widely regarded as inevitable and therefore Dassivelv accented. Must it be?

title: 70 HOSTAGES TAKEN ON COAST ARE FREED
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Aug. 17A gunman apparently bent on revenge surrendered to the police late tonight less than six hours after hijacking a Santa Cruz city bus and holding a number of hostages at a religious retreat about 70 south of here.

title: Penn Central Seeks to Sell Land
description: The bankrupt Penn Central Transportation, as part of a continuing liquidation program, yesterday asked its reorganization court in Philadelphia for permission to sell 250 Park Avenue in Manhattan to Parkbullt Associates Inc. for $5.2 million. A portion of the 24,970squarefoot parcel on which the 20story Marine Midland Bank building stands is excluded from the sale because it is leased to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

title: Alaska Oil Loading On Tankers Halted
description: VALDEZ. Alaska. Aug. 17 (AP)Loading at the transAlaska pipeline port of Valdez was halted early today, about 40 hours after an oil leak forced shutdown of the troubleplagued pipeline.

title: Wadkins Still Aglow Over P.G.A.
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Aug. 17Since winning the Professional Golfers Association championship Sunday at Pebble Beach, Calif., Lanny Wadkins has been quite busy and pretty much alone. He also has been rather numb. With no friends or relatives to celebrate with and talk to, I don't think all of it has hit me yet.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: WILLIAM GOLDSMITH, 93, OF ENGINEERING CONCERN
description: William Goldsmith, founder of the Woodcrest Construction Company, an engineering and contracting concern involved in numerous municipal projects here, died Tuesday in White Plains Hospital, He was 93 years old and lived at 111 Miles Avenue in White Plains.

title: Marijuana Records Cleared at 3 Years
description: ALBANY. Aug. 17One of the bills Governor Carey said today that he hid signed would allow the records of those arrested for marijuana violations to be wiped clean after three years.

title: Tension Rises in Soweto as Police With Attack Dogs Raid Schools
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 17A worsening confrontation between policemen and students has exacerbated tensions in Soweto, raising fears among community leaders that the black township, home to 1.25 million people, could be headed for a renewal of the heavy violence that paralyzed the area and left several hundred dead last year.

title: Young Is Heading Home From Caribbean Mission WithWide Support for Regional Partnership Plan
description: BRIDGETOWN, ,Barbados, Aug. 17Andrew Young is bringing home an en1 dorsement by Caribbean leaders of plans for a new regional partnership as a result of his 10country mission for President Carter.

title: PUERTO RICAN RIVALS JOIN AT U.N. IN CRITICISM OF U.S.
description: Rival advocates of statehood and independence for Puerto Rico lobbied before a United Nations committee yesterday for a Cuban resolution condemning the island's present commonwealth relationship with the United States, United Press International reported.

title: Family Money
description: FAMILIES shopping for older homes in New York State may be able to get by with much lower down payments than in the past, thanks to revisions the Legislature has made in the rules governing private mortgageguarantee insurance.

title: MARIE R. PASSANNANTE
description: Marie R. Passannante, a partner in the law firm. of Luttinger & Passannante at 12 East 41st Street, died Sunday in her summer home in Netcong, N.J. She was 62 years old and lived here at 22 West 11th Street.

title: Labor Rejects Trudeau Plan to End PayPrice Curbs
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 17Canadian labor leaders, in a move bringing further uncertainty into this country's troubled economy, today rejected all the conditions proposed by Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau for an early end to wage and Price controls here.

title: U.S. Ambassador Is Called Home For Talki on Jailed Journalists
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP)The United States Ambassador to the Central African Empire, Anthony Quainton, is being recalled for consultations over the recent imprisonment of two journalists, one American and one British.

title: Presley Fans Mourn in Memphis ...
description: MEMPHIS, Aug. 17El'is Presley's fans came to Memphis today by the thousands and thousands to get a last glimpse of their idol. They stood for hours, first in a light rain, later in the hot sun, waiting to see the plump corpse of the great rock and roll singer, neatly laid out in a creamcolored suit. As the afternoon wore on, the scene became increasingly hysterical. Hundreds of people fainted from heat prostration or in the vernacular of those standing on line fell out. Those old enough to remember said there had been nothing like it since Rudolf Valentino died.

title: jets Tackle Another Problem: Empty Seats
description: HEMPSTEAD; L.I., Aug. 17Once it was unthinkable; a JetsSteelers game playing before 50,000 empty seats.

title: `Didn't Cut Nobody's Throat, Says a Proud Pryor
description: I IKE TO GO to movies. I like to be recognized. And I enjoy burning my hair with my cigarette, like I just did, said Richard Pryor, calmly patting out the accidental blaze without missing a beat.

title: Test Flights Planned
description: LONDON, Aug. 17British and French aviation officials, guardedly hailing the decision permitting the Concorde to land at Kennedy International Airport, said today they planned to make the first of half a dozen test flights in about 10 days withoutovaiting for the outcome of an anneal.

title: The .44Caliber Loophole
description: Although he lived in a state with one of the toughest gun control laws in the nation, David R. Berkowitz, the accused Son of Sam killer, had little difficulty assembling an arsenal of weapons. When captured he had pistol, a semiautomatic rifle, a shotgun, and another disassembled rifle: quite an array of firepoweir to be the hands of one willing to plead insanity.

title: FULL EMPLOYMENT WEEK PLANNED BY A COALITION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP)A coalition of union, civic and religious organizations announced today plans to sponsor a Full Employment Week Sept. to 10.

title: Film: 18 Examples Of Fine Animation
description: EVERY YEAR at Academy Award time, someone stands up and hands out a prize for animation. Chances are that only a minuscule portion of the audience has seen the film in question, and those who wonder about it at all are likely to assume it to be a particularly fine example of the sort of cartoon that used to be a regular pan of Saturday afternoons at the movies.A worthwhile chance to correct that impression is now at hand in the form of a collection of 18 extraordinary animated short films grouped together under the title "Fantastic Animation Festival."The show, which opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters, is a long onean hour and 47 minutesbut a good one. The worst than can be said of it is that it may be too much of a good thing, a feast of excellence that probably would be more savory could it be partaken of a little at a time rather than all at once.That cavil recorded, it should be said immediately that here at once is an opportunity to examine the state of a sophisticated art that gives to the imagination wings denied to conventional film makers. Animation offers not only a medium for telling stories, for making points about human nature and society, for speaking in metaphor and wit; it offers freedom from the bonds of literal photographic image. In animation anything is possiblejourneys far into space or deep into the mind; instantaneous transformations of the mundaneand "Fantastic Animation Festival" displays much of the range of these possibilities.Not all of these shorts are likely to appeal equally to everyone, but everyone is likely to find something to admire, from the drama and nostalgia of the 1941 "Superman vs. the Mechanical Monsters" to the succinct wit of "Bambi Meets Godzilla" to the commentaries and humor of "Icarus," "Mountain Music," "The Last Cartoon Man," "Room and Board" and "Closed Mondays," an Academy Award-winner, to the sophisticated technique and evocations of "French Windows," "Light" and the eerie and enigmatic "Nightbird."The PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested") rating is probably attributable to a couple of swift depictions of the nude female body, bare female breasts and the use of the words "crap" and "hell."

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Straight Returning To Stage
description: Beatrice Straight, winner of the 1977 Academy Award for supporting actress for her performance in Network, will return to the stage in a new production of Harold Pinter's Old Times at the Academy Festival Theater in Lake Forest, Ill. The production, which will open Sept. 1 for three weeks, will have as costars Irene Worth and Raul Julia, recently the leading actors of The Cherry Orchard at Lincoln Center.

title: 31 Are Arrested in Welfare Fraud
description: Thirtyone persons, most of whom were fulltime public employees, were arrested yesterday on charges of defrauding the city of about $250,000 in illegal welfare payments over the last seven years.

title: Influx of Workers From Canada Provoking Bitterness in Buffalo
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 12At a time when unemployment in Buffalo is above percent, hundreds of Canadians are crossing the border each day to work in jobs ranging from skilled laborer to management specialistan influx that has stirred bitter controversy here:

title: Mandel's Jurors, Deadlocked, Get Order to Go On
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 17After six days of deliberations, the jury in the Federal corruption case against Maryland Gov. Marvin Mandel and five codefendants reported today that it was deadlocked.

title: Virtuosic Dancing By Louis
description: IRTUOSO dancing is one of those twoway pleasures that satisfies the performing artist. and delights audiences even more. To begin the Lincoln Center Out of Doors threeweek season. the Murray Louis Dance Company, led by Mr. Louis, gave an appreciative openingnight crowd a beautiful display of glittering virtuosity at Damrosch Park.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW. Aug. 17 (AP)A Soviet newspaper today criticized as arrogant ignoramuses members of a United States Government pane that monitors EastWest relations.WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP)A Cabinetlevel committee has agreed to let stand, for the time being, a Ford Administration decision to end United States membership in the International Labor Organization this November, the State Department said todayNAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 17 (AP)  A Uganda playwright, the national theater director and a Ministry of Culture official were executed by firing squad in Uganda after being found guilty of insulting President Idi Amin, a refugee army officer said today.UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 17The Israeli Government announced today its decision not to take part in the World Conference for Action against Apartheid. to be held in Lagos, Nigeria, next week.

title: Hugh Scott Says He Urged Ford to Cut Taiwan Tie
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17  Former Senator Hugh Scott said today that after he visited China last year he recommended to President Gerald R. Fcrd that the United States sever diplomatic ties with Taiwan and normalize relations with Peking, even if the mainland Chinese did not pledge to refrain from using force to take over Taiwan.

title: HARRIET S. EDMUNDS
description: Harriet S. Edmunds, a pioneer in the development of visual graphics for use in advertising, died Aug. 11. She was 85 years and lived in Clinton, Conn.

title: Cards Beat Mets, 20, on TwoHitter
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 17In this goingnowhere year, the Mets have had few, if any, wishes granted them. Tonight, still another wish was shot to smithereens when the St. Louis Cardinals heat them, 20, and prevented the Mets from gaining their first threegame sweep since last May.

title: Harmonica Club Answers the Call for Glad Notes
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Washington &
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17On one side stand the President and his Secretary of the Treasury, concerned about what they see as a costly tax gimmick with little to justify it.

title: Courageous Wins, Takes A Big Step Toward Final
description: NEWPORT, R. I.. Aug. 17What will it take for one of the three United States yachts, Courageous, Enterprise or Independence. to be chosen soon as the defender of the America's Cup next month against the foreign challenger? The vague requirement is about dozen victories in these final selection trials. which got under way yesterday, and Courageous chalked, up her third victory today. The others have none.

title: Evangelista Meets Soto On AliShavers Program
description: Alfredo Evangelista, a previous Muhammad All victim, heads a fourfight preliminary card to Ali's 15round heavyweight title defense against rarnie Shavers on Sept. 29 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Phaseout of Stock Tax Set
description: A bill to phase out, the effects of the New York City stock transfer tax over the next four years has been signed by Governor Carey, Page D2.

title: J. Edward Shugrue, 71, ExDirector With American Heritage Foundation
description: J. Edward Shugrue, former national director of the American Heritage Foundation, sponsors of the American Freedom Train in the 1940's, died Tuesday in Pearl River, N. Y., hospital after a long illness. He was 71 years old and lived in Briarcliff Manor. N. Y.

title: Books of The Times
description: MOST of the characters in Blood Tie are expatriates not the wideeyed, excited expatriate of the 20's, but the culture dropout of the 70's, someone who puts an ocean between himself and his past, who visits a foreign country and as a crasher enters a party. Traveling light, unburdened by a social role, this expatriate is a voyeur. He sees the life of the natives as theater or burlesque.

title: The Law Above All
description: For the past 20 years of my life have been a man of the law. For the next four years, if I am chosen by the people of New York to lead this city, I will be a mayor of the law. This not so much because I want it to be that way: It's because the hard realities require it.

title: India Said to Pick Envoy to U.S.
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 17 (AP)The Government has chosen new ambassadors for Washington and London to replace those who served former Prime Minister India Gandhi, the national news agency Samachar reported today. Samachar said that a noted industrialist lawyer, N.A. Palkhiwala, would succeed Kewal Singh in Washington and that the Socialist Party leader ,Narayan G. Goray, would replace B.K. Nehru in London.

title: Duran to Fight Viruet Sept. 17
description: Roberto Duran of Panama, the World Boxing Association lightweight champion, will defend his title Sept. 17 against Edwin Viruet of New York. Paddy Flood, Viruet's manager, said the 15round bout would be held either in Miami or Las Vegas under the promotion of Don King.

title: Carter And the Liberals
description: Suppose, a year ago, liberal voters had been told that Jimmy Carter would be elected and by this date in 1977 would have: canceled the B1 bomber, achieved a new treaty with Panama, taken steps toward normal relations with Cuba, allowed Vietnam to enter the United Nations, all but ended the practice of denying visitors visas to foreign Communists, signed a strip mining bill into law, started a great effort for energy conservation, called for the easing of marijuana laws, proposed a thoroughgoing and humane reform of the welfare system . . .

title: Cosmos Victors, 32, In Playoff Shootout
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Aug. 17After rallying to tie the game, the Cosmos defeated the Fort Lauderdale Strikers in a shootout tonight by a 32 score that put Pele and teammates in the semifinals of the North American Soccer League playoffs.

title: Proposed U.S. Letter of Apology
description: Following is the Department of Justice, proposed apology to plaintiffs whose mail had been opened by the Central Intelligence Agency in 195373 domestic project, as sent yesterday to Federal Judge Jack B. Weinstein in Brooklyn:

description: Abe Beame is tough. Bella Abzug is a fighter. Mario Cuomo is angry. Edward 7. Koch is competent. Three other Democratic mayoral candidates are financially strapped, so they have not so far been able to use television advertising to promote their personal and poltical assets.

title: National Front: British Threat?;
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, Aug. 17Britain's rightwing National Front, the focus of political violence here and in London during the last week, is 10 years old and growing.

description: Abe Beanie is tough. Bella Abzug is a fighter. Mario Cuomo is angry. Edward I. Koch is competent. Three other Democratic mayoral candidates are financially strapped, so they have not so far been able to use television advertising to promote their personal and poltical assets.

title: CANADA PLANS CURB ON CROWN CONCERNS
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 18The Canadian Government, in an action spurred by public criticism of several questionable deals abroad involving two of its own companies, moved today to tighten official controls on Crown corporations, as such concerns are called.

title: Antiques
description: FOR ALMOST 50 years, collectors of period American furniture have traveled frequently to Ridgefield, Conn., to check the stock of Florene Maine, the dynamic dealer long known for a sharp tongue and colorful style of selling.

title: MitchellLama Abatements Voted As Beame Chairs Estimate Board
description: By CHARLES KAISER The politically powerful tenants of 75 MitchellLama middleincome apartment buildings were voted generous tax abatements yesterday at the last meeting of the Board of Estimate before the Sept. 8 mayoral primary.

title: Hostages Are Rescued In Japanese Abduction
description: TOKYO, Friday, Aug. 19 (AP) Policemen overpowered an armed 1convict early today and rescued five women he had held hostage for 57 hours in the locker room of a securities concern in the city of Kochi.

title: 3 Senate Opponents Of Canal Agreement Leaving for Panama
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18 (Reuters) Three Senate opponents of the proposed new Panama Canal treaties were leaving for talks in Panama today, but it was uncertain whether they would meet Government officials there.

title: Stage: Chelsea Sings
description: DEPENDING on one's point of view, Children of Adam, which opened Wednesday at the Chelsea Westside Cabaret Theater, is either an allmusic musicalas it is billedor a nobook musical. Count on this upbeat little show to be resolutely affirmative. The fact is that this is a skein of songs, innocent and amiable, but stretched porously thin as an evening's entertainment.

title: NEW FLOOR PLAN FOR THE AMEX: A scale model the trading floor being inspected by Steve Williams, right, American Stock Exchange vice president in charge of planning, and architect Robert Cook. The expansion
description: plan, approved by Board of Governors, will add about 3,500 square feet and cost about $2. 5 million. Communications booths will be suspended story above main floor; trading booths will have triangular display structures.

title: Tibor Dery, Author Jailed for Backing Hungarian Revolt
description: BUDAPEST, Aug 18 (Reuters)Tibor Dery, a Hungarian writer and a leading figure in the intellectual movement that preceded the 1956 Hungarian uprising, died early today. He was 82 years old.

title: Hnurilings
description: IBELSKYJoseph. A monument will be unveiled at Knollwood Park Cemetery. Section L, Cynruss Hills, Queens. Sunday, Aug. 21, at 11:00 A. M., In memory of Joseph Belsky. beloved husband. father, brother, grandfather and 1grandfather.

title: Three Manhattan Tours Are Afoot on Sunday
description: Walking buffs will have a chance to explore New York City on foot with an informed guide this Sunday. Three threehour tours sponsored by the Municipal Art Society will all begin at 2 P. M. but at different points.

title: Bond Prices Climb on Fed Report Of Sharp Drop in Supply of Money
description: The Federal Reserve reported yesterday afternoon that the nation's money supply dropped fairly sharply in the week ended Aug. 10, and bond prices climbed smartly in response to the news.

title: Landmark Status Asked for Rocket Site of the 1940's
description: FRANKLIN LAKESIn the 1930's and early 40's when most Americans regarded extraterrestrial travel as amusing science fiction, a team of young scientists began testing rockets and rocket engines they believed could one day hurtle people into space.

title: Rome's Chief Rabbi Casts Doubt On Official Version of Nazi Flight
description: ROME, Aug. 18 The Chief Rabbi of Rome today broke his silence on the escape of Herbert Happier to say that was futile to try to extradite the convicted war criminal, who fled from a Rome military hospital this week. Rabbi Elio Toaff called the episode farcical and cast doubt on the official version of events.

title: Moerken Completes A BreastStroke Double
description: JONKOPING. Sweden, Aug. 18 (AP) Gerald Moerken completed a double for West Germany in the men's breaststroke by winning the 200meter event in the European swimming championships today.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 18 A Superior Court judge in Los Angeles today refused to approve the payment to lawyers of about $700,000 for legal work and expenses claimed against the estate of the late industrialist Howard R. Hughes.

title: Around the Nation
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 18 (UPI) A Federal judge issued a temporary restraining order today, delaying construction of controversial gymnasium near the site of the 1970 Kent State University shootings.

title: Lance Says His Ability to Do Job Has Not Been Damaged by Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18  President Carter said today that an investigation into the former business practices of Bert Lance, director of the Office of Manage. ment and Budget, had reconfirmed my faith in the character and competence of Mr. Lance and that he would remain in office.

title: Why They're All Hurrying Up to Goodspeed
description: It's getting to be like those thoroughbred auctions where racehorse owners gather in hopes of finding a young colt with the potential to be another Seattle Slew. In much the same spirit, theatrical producers flom New York flock to the Goodspeed Opera House in East Haddam, Conn., for the opening of each new production, hoping to discover a show that has the potential to become a winner on Broadway.

title: Soybean Futures Up by 10c on Talk Of a Frost in Iowa
description: CHICAGO. Aug. 18(AP)Talk of possible overnight frost in Iowa lifted soybean futures prices more than 10 cents on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: Bullies Joins His Words to Music
description: Ed Bullins, a guiding star in the late 1960's for black playwrights hoping to raise the consciousness of their black audiences, has collaborated with white woman composer and written musical, Sepia Star, about a rhythmandblues singer.

title: Idzik Ruling With an Iron Hand As He Rebuilds the Jets Offense
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 18Sometimes the Jets actually work out for three or four minutes before John Idzik's voice shakes them up like a minor explosion.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: THERE ARE parts of the city that lead schizophrenic lives. At times they are crowded frantic centers of rush hour traffic. At others, they are empty expanses of tranquility.

title: U. S. Yachts Sail to Draw And Swedes to a Victory
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 18Now the time to come to Newport for the America's Cup competition, not in September for the cup races themselves, which are so often anticlimactic. The true yachting enthusiasts know this, and all of a sudden today the spectator fleet grew to impressive proportions as the big motor sailers and the cabin cruisers 70, 80 and 90 feet long appeared on the race course. The tonnage was considerable.

title: LaBelle's Miss Dash Is Singing A Solo
description: Those lyrics from the rocksoul trio LaBelle's last single recording question the breakup of two lovers, but they also apply to the recent disbanding of the 11old group. Several months ago, Patti LaBelle, Nona Hendry:: and Sarah Dash parted company (professionally) and ended a long alliance that, three years ago, rocketed the group to superstardom. In 1974, they became the first rock group to perform at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Carter and Bad Luck
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18Like all the rest of us, President Carter has his streaks of good and bad luck, and lately events seem to have been conspiring against his plans.

description: Archeologists are producing something new from a very old piece of 1its autobiography.

Ridge was considered the last major area for firefighters to stop blaze before it spread into the populated areas of the Carmel

title: U. S, ASSAILS ISRAELIS ON NEW SETTLEMENTS IN WEST BANK REGION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18  In the latest flareup between Israel and the United States, the Carter Administration denounced today the Begin Government's approval of the building of three additional settlements on the West Bank as illegal and as creating obstacles to constructive negotiations.

title: Striking Coal Miners Fear Return of Company Store
description: DRY BRANCH, W. Va., Aug. 18 The three generations of men who dig the soft coal out of. the mines in the foggy hollows here along the waters of Cabin Creek are talking as if the United States were a foreign country. not particulany inenaly, that surrounds them. The niners here at the center of the wildcat strikes that have spread from this area 35 miles south of Charleston to involve some 80,000 mine workers in four states, feet that just about everyone around thememployers, the leaders of their union (the United Mine Workers), their Governor, John D. Rockefeller 4th, and the people in Washingtonare standing by idly, if not maliciously,. while their way of fife is slipping back toward the days of endless debt to the company store and total reliance on the company doctor.

title: Books of The Times
description: JONATHAN YARDLEY wants us to like and admire Ring Lardner as much as he does. Ring is a heroic effort to help us get there, full of sympathy and qualms, evocations and damning deWU, some dismay and an appealing. protectiveness. It neither huffs nor puffs, in the psychoanalytic or any other mode. And it allows Scott Fitzgerald the last word: A great and good American is dead. Let us not Obscure hurt by the flowers, out walk up and look at that fine medallion, all torn with sorrows that perhaps we are not equipped to understand. Ring made no enemies, because he was kind, and to millions he gave release and delight.

title: Bridge
description: A popular figure was lost to the New York bridge scene last week when Eddie Pinner died after a long battle with illness. Exactly a month earlier, he scored his third victory, setting a record, in the prestigious Von Zedtwitz double knockout team championship.

title: British Report Says 500,000. Work For Less Than the Minimum Wage
description: LONDON, Aug. 18 (UPI)  About 500,000 of Britain's poorest workers, mainly in retail, catering and hairdressing, are being paid less than the legal minimum, according to a report published today by by the Independent Low Pay Unit.

title: 52,000 Phony Levis Are Seized in Europe
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Aug. 18 (AP)The police said today that they had cracked an international ring importing phony Levis from the Far East to sell to Europe's jeanscrazy youth.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18The followLing are the text of the letter sent today by John G. Heimann. the Comptroller of the Currency, to Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, chairman of the Senate Governmental Affairs Committee, and excerpts from the text of the Comptroller's report on an inquiry into the financial affairs of Bert Lance, director of the Office of Management and Budget:

title: The New York Tlmes/Gary Settle
description: MEMPHIS, Aug. 18Elvis Presley, the king of 11roll, was laid to rest today amid scenes that ranged from the serenity of a green Southern cemetery to hysteria by fans who tried to charge the gates of his home and the cemetery. Two women were killed and one was critically injured after a car plowed into the crowd of mourners outside Mr. Presley's home at 4 A. M. today. The driver was charged with two counts of seconddegree murder.

title: Bevacqua Given Jail Term
description: WAUKESHA, Wis., Aug. 18 (AP)Kurt Bevacqua, former Milwaukee Brewer infielder now with the Texas Rangers, has been sentenced to a 10day jail term to be served following the baseball season. Waukesha County Judge Harold J. Wollenzein sentenced Bevacqua to serve a 10day term on conviction last March 17 on a charge of drivinc without a license near his home in New Berlin. The judge also fined Bevacqua $160.

title: Peruvian Girl, Here Since 1973, Loses Bid for Resident Status
description: Isabel Carrasco, a 11old Peruvian who has lived since 1973 in Valley Stream, L. I., was turned down for permanentresident status yesterday but given a oneyear stay of deportation.
