title: BEANIE REPORTS CUTS DIDN'T CURB SERVICES
description: The New York City government provided about the same level of services in 197677 as in the previous fiscal year but, thanks to improved productivity, did with 12,000 fewer employees, the Beame administration said yesterday.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: David Mamet, he can even start his own theater; the St. Nicholas in Chicago, cofounded by Mamet; is a prime producer of his plays. Or he can gather actors and have a reading in his living room. Annually he can submit a play to the Eugene O'Neill Playwrights Conference in Waterford, Conn., and, if he is lucky, his play will be presented there in the summer. Frequently, the O'Neill ignites chain reaction, as do such other places as the New Dramatists Committee and the Ensemble Studio Theater.

title: A Nursery for Wildflowers
description: KENT HOLLOW IF EVER a man loved his work, it is Vincent Puskasa big, hearty, outgoing, secondgeneration Hungarian who runs a wildflower nursery in Kent Hollow, up here in northwestern Connecticut. You meet all nice people in this business, he said. 'The folks who come to buy, the folks who stop to look around.

title: THE UNFAVORED GIFTED FEW
description: Every day he would cry, shamed by a teacher who chided him for being different and ridiculed by classmates who tormented him for being peculiar.

title: Marist College Gets Grant to Train Handicapped for Science Careers
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y. Marist College, which has long specialized in training handicapped students, was one of 10 institutions to receive a grant from the National Science Foundation for projects designed to increase participation by tte physically handicapped in scientific careers.

title: Bilingual Japanese Program in Jeopardy
description: WHAT is believed to be the only bilingualbicultural Japanese program in the eastern United States is facing extinction because neither New York State nor the Eastchester School District, which started it, is willing to put up the money to save it.

title: 3 Key Arab Countries Link Signing Of Israel Treaty to Overall Accord
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Egypt. Syria and Jordan have informed the United States that they would sign peace treaties with Israel as part of an overall Middle East settlement. In addition Egypt and Jordan said they would consider a further American proposal that they also take up diplomatic relations with Israel.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Taking good photographs of children can be a very rewarding photographic experience for any parentphotographereven though the parent may lack the ex pertise of a professional studio photographer.

title: Spirit of the Clown Displayed in Hopewell
description: HoPEWELL CIRCUS clowns are one of the glittering joys of all of our lives, whether we are young or old. Through their theatrical exaggerations, their madcap gestures and antics, their rubber acrobatics and their mimes, they create a magic world at once filled with captivating innocence as well as with the essences of which life is made. They can reach through our pretensions and postures, bare our masquerades through theirs and, all told, touch souls.

title: Humphrey Up Early
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 20 (UPI)Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, arose at 6 A. M. today and watched television cartoons, a Saturday custom he began with his grandchildren. His doctor said his recovery from intestinal surgery was absolutely remarkable.

title: Alexander's Elects Yonkers
description: ALEXANDER FARKAS, the president of Alexander's, the highly successful department store chain, likes to tell a story about his grandfather, who immigrated to the United States from Hungary in the early 1900's.

title: Clashes Reported in Mauritania
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, Aug, 20 (AgenceFrance Presse) A total of 18 Mauritanian troops and 30 Algerianbacked guerrillas have been killed during two fierce clashes in the past 48 hours, authoritative sources in the Mauritanian capital here said today. In the first clash at a security post 7 miles from the town of Quadane, 14 Mauritanian soldiers and 13 guerrillas were killed. The other casualties occurred when a 40vehicle guerrilla column attacked a security post 12 miles from Zouerate. The guerrillas are waging a campaign to force morocco and Mauritania to relinquish their control of the Western Sahara.

title: CARTER'S NAME BOOED AT CANAL ZONE RALLY
description: BALBOA, Canal Zone, Aug. 20 (AP)About 2,000 residents of this United Statescontrolled zone, many of them opposed to the new Panama Canal treaty. booed the names of President Carter and American treaty negotiators at a rally here:

title: Susan Scruggs Wed To Michael Rudkin In Charlotte, N. C.
description: Susan Anderson Scruggs, daughter of Mrs. Hugh A. Cathey of Charlotte. N. C.. and the late William Marvin Scruggs Jr., was married yesterday to Michael Pickering Rudkin, son of Mr. and Mrs. William L. Rudkin of Southport, Conn.

title: Women Hard Hats? The Government Says to Get Ready
description: Although women account for more than onethird of the nation's work force, most of them are still toiling at traditionally female jobsoften as teachers. secretaries or waitresses. Women have not been welcomed to the betterpaying, predominately male occupations such as the skilled construction trades.

title: The Transition Man
description: WASHINGTONIt was well into his second year as Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation that Clarence M. Kelley began to realize that while the desk and the office belonged to him, the bureau in many ways still belonged to J. Edgar Hoover.

title: Acorns Must Fall
description: In the living quarters of Muhammad Ali's training camp in Deer Lake, Pa., the champion fits a cassette into the television set, sits back and watches Earnie Shavers box 10 rounds with Tiger Roy Williams. Ali delivers his own commentary on the performance of Shavers, who means to detach him from the heavyweight. championship or the world Sept. 29 in Madison Square Garden. Look at that. He comes at you like Joe Frazier but not with Frazier's motion& There he is, you can hit him& That's a pretty good punch of his. & He might punch harder'n Sonny Liston Might punch harder'n George Foreman&. Might punch harder'n Joe Frazier! The voice takes on a doomsday note. The eyes bug out.

title: The RentaCar Game How to Thread the Maze
description: In the rentacar world the business traveler is king. He provides Hertz, Avis et at with more than 80 percent of their gross income, which for Hertz, the biggest in the field, reached a record $1. 6 billion last year. But the pattern is changing; this year, as never before, the companies are wooing the pleasure traveler with advertising promotions and special packages that induce weekend, weekly or monthly rental or that ccrnbine car rental with a plane flight or hotel accommodations or both. The companies objective is to keep their cars rolling  and reap extra revenuewhen business travel is slack, as well as to exploit the lucrative rental market in resort areas among vacationers who like the freedom of getting around at will. These special offerings are presented as bargains, and often they are, but as is true of the carrental field in general, they bear looking into.

title: GARDENING
description: PLANTS, too, have their black sheep; they come from respectable families, but behave quite differently. Some of them are nuisances, and have been relegated to the unrespectable designation of weed.

title: New Horizons in New Canaan
description: NEW CANAAN IN THE distance, the horizon can be seen. Margaret Brown, Sara Westcott, Sue Kelly, Lynn McNaught, Pepe Sandrelli, Will Speers and Jomelle Jones have been doing everything in their power this summer to make that view a little brighter for Yesid Ramirez, Sudha Tiwari, Elizabeth Davis, Veronica Adams, Gabriel Etienne, Judy Eng, Sandy Foster and about 133 other innercity students from 6 to 16 years old who have been coming to the New Canaan Country School for sixweek program that combines academic study with greenery, nature walks, swimming and relaxation.

title: Jets and. Giants Both Lose,
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Aug. 20A loss is a loss, except when it doesn't count, and it didn't really matter that the Jets dropped a preseason game tonight to the powerful Pittsburgh Steelers by 2613.

title: 20% OF VOTERS FOUND AFFILIATED TO G. O. P.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Only one American voter in five wants to be labeled a Republican, the Gallup Poll reported today. But spokesmen for the party took issue with the suggestion that Republicans faced new adversity.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: Yuba City Paper Purchased
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., Aug. 20 (AP)The publishing firm that owns the Sacramento Union has purchased the Yuba City Daily Independent Herald for an undisclosed price, Mr. and Mrs. Henry R. Tweith, publishers of the 6,700circulation Yuba City paper since 1959, announced yesterday. The new owner, the Sierra Publishing, Company, will take over Sept. 1. The Sierra firm is a subsidiary of Sacramento Publishing Company, one of several publishing organizations owned by John P. MeGoff.

title: REPORTS OF 77 BOMBINGS DOWN FROM YEAR EARLIER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP)There were 683 bombing incidents in the United States and Puerto Rico in the first half of this year, a decline from the 774 incidents reported in the same period a year ago, according to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: New York Metropolitan Region Is Still Favored as Some Companies Move Their Corporate Headquarters
description: When Maurice Chevalier was asked, as he frequently was in his last years, how he felt about life as an octogenarian, his stock reply was, Well, when I think of the alternative.  The same kind of reply is heard these days when business and political leaders are asked how they feel about the continuing movement of New York City companies to Long Island, New Jersey. Westchester Comity and Connecticdc.

title: Catch22 in Turkey
description: ANKARAThe late Arnold Toynbee must have been thinking of the United States when he wrote, more than 50 years ago: Western sentiment about the Greeks and the Turks is for the most part illinformed, violently expressed and dangerously influential.

title: MINE UNION OFFICIAL PREDICTS STRIKE END
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 20 (UPI) A United Mine Workers official representing the union's most militant district predicted today that striking coal miners would return to work after the international executive board meets on Monday.

title: Elvis Presley Is Dead
description: They called him the King of Rock 'n Roll. Twenty years ago, Elvis Presley exploded on the music scene, with a style that oozed adolescent sexuality and songs that were a synthesis of southern roots: white country music and black rhythm and blues. Youngsters were spellbound, adults scandalized. He cut one millionselling record after another, and the size of his following far exceeding the preceding adolescent idol, Frank Sinatra. As the rock scene thrived, Mr. Presley became more icon than rebel. He starred in banal movies and made a succession of record albums. More recently he has been active on the concert circuit and had released a new album that was doing well. But, last week, in his Memphis mansion, he suddenly collapsed and died, victim of cardiac arrhythmia, which is a severely irregular and ineffective heartbeat. He was 42.

title: Severe Flooding in South Africa Causes Evacuation of 3 Hospitals
description: CAPE TOWN, Aug. 20 (AP)Severe flooding caused by several days of torrential rain on the Cape Peninsula has forced evacuation of three hospitals and inundated parts of suburbs about 10 miles from Cape Town.

title: Two Leftist Groups Claim Role In Bomb AtteMpt Against King
description: MADRID, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Two separate extreme leftist groups have said they were responsible for a bombing attempt three days ago against King Juan Carlos and Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez, newspapers said today.

title: Elizabeth Barker Moody Wed to Thornton D. Ring
description: Elizabeth Mathilde Barker Moody, widow of William Henry Moody, and daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomp, son Barker of South Freeport, Me.,  formerly of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Thornton Den. nison Ring, son of Mr. and Mrs. Elmer Lothrop Ring, also of South Freeport.

title: In Summary
description: President Carter has begun orchestrating a bipartisan lobbying campaign to secure ratification of the proposed Panama Canal Treaty, but criticism of the treaty last week by members of Congress demonstrated what had been fearedthat serious difficulties for the Administration lay ahead.

J., was married yesterday to George Sparks Milnor 2d, son of Mr.. and Mrs. Ryrie Milnor of Alton, Ill, The ceremony was performed in the Chapel of the Immaculate Conception of Seton Hall University in South Orange, N. J., by the Rev. Hamlet Accorsi.

title: New Jersey/ This Week
description: THEATER

title: THE PRESS, PRIVACY AND THE CONSTITUTION
description: Aswift move jostles wouldbe assassin's arm. The shot misses President Gerald Ford. Sara Jane Moore receives life sentence. But what of Oliver Sipple, the exMarine who deflected her aim? He becomes an instant hero, but national publicity also reveals that he is a member of San Francisco's gay community. Now, almost two years after the assassination attempt, Sipple's suit against several newspapers for invading his privacy proceeds through the California courts.

title: ARTHUR HENRY GROSS
description: krthur Henry Gros. C. who quit school at 114 ??? of 14 to manage his father's hat i. hop and built it into a chain of millinery stpres. died Friday in his native Trenton. He was 69 years old.

title: F. C. C. Says Criminal Sanctions Best Enforcement for Cbers
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (UPI). A Federal Communications Commission study has found criminal sanctions are the best way to enforce citizen's band radio rules.

title: Margaret Evers Wed to Capt. D. D. Hostler
description: The marriage of Margaret Frances Evers and Capt. Dorsey David Hostler of the Army, alumni of the Wake Forest University School of Law, took place in Spring Lake, N. J., yesterday. Msgr. Joseph R. Brestel performed the ceremony in St. Catherine's Roman Catholic Church and concelebrated the nuptial mass with Msgr. John E. Grimes and the Rev. James J. Driscoll.

title: James Tierney: Monitor of Foreign Affairs
description: JAMES J. TIERNEY has spent most of his professional life in education dealing with international affairs. Last May, the Scarsdale resident was appointed executive director of the Fund for Peace, 10yearold watchdog agency, and now that organization, too, is likely to be looking abroad more often.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Who Gets Open Tickets?
description: To the Sports Editor: How does one get tickets to the United States Open finals or semifinals at Forest Hills?

title: Lawrence, Foster Exemplary Leading All Mozart
description: The Mostly Mozart Festival at the mew Avery Fisher Hall is one of Lincoln Center's classier offerings, and Friday's allMozart concert under Lawrence Foster's direction was one of the classier programs on the series. When Mr. Foster used to conduct in Los Angeles several years ago, he had his immaturities as an interpreter and a technician; either he's blossomed as a conductor or this reporter has blossomed as a listener. In any event Mr. Foster's work on Friday was exemplary.

title: GEORGE OKELL, LEGISLATOR AND MIAMI CITY ATTORNEY
description: MIAMI. Aug. 20 (AP)George S. Okell, who led legist active crusades to establish the University of Miami Medical School and the Dade Port Authority. died Thursday after suffering an apparent heart att. :Ick. He was 71 years old.

title: Moralists and the Real Issue
description: THE closing of the Treat Theater on Orange Street in Newark was a victory for the city's morals watchers. But it was an empty victory that reflected the shallow pride of a Don Quixotelike complex that keeps this city and this society tilting at the windmills of a past, grander age.

title: BRIDGE
description: Theoretically speaking, the biggest possible hand at the bridge table is one containing 37 highcard points: all the aces, kings and queens, together with one of the jacks. Some 40 years ago, Culbertson offered a handsome cash prize to a fully attested case of a player holding such hand. He was on safe ground and was never called on to pay up.

title: He's in Pursuit of Africa's Heart
description: LAWRENCE GUSSMAN doesn't just collect African art; he considers it an integral part of his life, a source of beauty and joy. One need only take a brief tour of his Scarsdale home, filled with centuryold ancestor and reliquary figures, ceremonial masks, tapestries, and assorted other artifacts, to realize his devotion to African culture.

title: Famine Conditions Are Denied
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 20A special adviser to Ghana's leader, who is here on a trip to explain conditions in and to seek assistance for his West African country, has complained about a report that people were dying of famine in the north of the country.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayKnoll Farms, Suffolk Avenue. Brentwood. L. I. Green, special, amateurowner, nonthoroughbred, young, junior and children's working hunters; novice, intermediate and junior jumpers; ponies, equitation. 8:30 A. M.

title: Auto Owners Face New Property Tax
description: CONNECTICUT residents who bought cars between Oct. 1, 1976, and June 30, 1977, can expect to pay an additional property tax on the vehicle this January. Depending on the local mill rate, the amount may vary from $75 in Greenwich, for example, to $246 in Hartford, on a car assessed at $3.000.

title: Miscellany
description: AMATEUR ASTRONOMERSNight Under the Stars.  Hayden Planetarium front, 81st St. and Central Park W. Tues.. 7:30.

title: The Rise and Fall And RiseOf Julie Andrews
description: Not since Luise Rainer went from winning two Oscars to oblivion in three short years, has any motion picture star risen so fast or fallen so far as Julie An drews. In the tormented 1960's, Miss Andrews's pleasant escapist musicals Mary Poppins and The Sound of Music earned enormous sums of money at the box office; but the fatal succession of Star!, Darling Lili and The Tamarind Seed wiped her out as a superstar. In recent months, however, she has begun to fight her way back to the top as a solo performer, with hugely successful performances at the London Palladium, and at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas;where she played for a whopping $250,000 a week. On Wednesday, she will begin a fiveday engagement at the Westchester Premiere Theater, mingling medleys from her hit movies with a selection of more contemporary songs.

title: A Family Affair
description: As tour director of the Annual Trip, I chose upstate New York. None of us had seen the Mall at Albany, and the descriptions I had read of Cohoes and Cazenovia, two small communities that offer visual delight, sounded too good to miss. We could do it easily in two days; what's three square inches on a map? Close to 600 miles, as it turned out. I made reservations at the Lincklaen Rouse in Cazenovia. and we were off.

title: Gold Digger
description: IF asked, after the manner of I. Q. tests, to find the inappropriate name in the following listNapoleon, Kaiser Wilhelm, Bismarck, Abraham Lincoln, Schliemann, Stalinfew would hesitate. What is an archeologist, Heinrich Schliemann, doing in the company of men who ruled nations and influenced world affairs? Yet he, like the others, was the subject of a biography by Emil Ludwig, the most popular and successful practitioner of the genre our century. No other archeologist could conceivably have joined that select circle, or have continued attract such (perhaps dubious) attention so long after his death in 1890.

title: GEORGE SAFFORD TORREY
description: George Safford Torrey, retired professor of botany at the University of Connecticut in Storrs, died at his home there Friday. He was 86 years old.

title: Jean Leventis Becomes Bride
description: Jean Inge Leventis of New York, widow of Christopher A. Leventis of Columbia, S. C., was married yesterday afternoon to Archibald Cox Jr. of New York, a managing director of Morgan Stanley & Company and son of Mr. and Mrs. Cox of Wayland, Mass.

title: In Summary
description: Until last week, New Jersey public school students who did not wish to participate in the daily pledge of allegiance to the United States flag were required by law to at least stand at attention. They may now be seated; a Federal judge has ruled that standing is symbolic speech, and to require it violates the freespeech guarantee of the First Amendment. The case was brought by Deborah Lipp, a 1yearold Mountain Lakes High School student who said her refusal to stand was less a protest than an assertion of her own right to choose.

title: The Standings
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: NewLook Playground in a Day
description: RIDGEFIELD THE RECIPE requires about 275 used tires, and chains, bolts, sand, gravel, a backhoe and an architect's blueprint. Add a large group of enthusiastic adults and children, combine under sunny skies, and 12 hours laterpresto! a handsome playgound ready to serve an entire ele, mentary school.

title: Sunday Observer
description: A Washington woman suggests that the C. I. A. 's mantle of secrecyor is it a shroud?may be passing to the Postal Service. At a time when the national spy agency is conducting much of its business on page 1. she points out, the mail business appears to be going underground.

title: DESIGNED BY LINDA ALLARD
description: DESIGNED BY LINDA ALLARD; Elen ???; The New York Times Magazine/August 21, 1977

title: Scientists Cite Behavior of Ducks As Giving Clues to Gene Theories
description: Male mallards who see other males attempting to rape their mates often respond by vigorously attacking the assailant, biting him on the neck and beating him with the wings.

title: Brookhaven's Marriage of Art and Science
description: UPTON IMAGINE a chemical testing procedure that would assist archeologists in tracing the trade routes of ancient cultures through scientific scrutiny of objects they had left behind.

title: Baseball Owners Ponder Solutions to Top Problems
description: Major league baseball officials scattered last Thursday after a perfunctory oneday summer meeting in Kansas City in an atmosphere of good feeling that one of them described as the calm before the storm.  Almost without. exception, they reel ma. the baseball map is unstable, and that the logjam has to break in some way this fall. in the meantime, they are awaiting developments, discussing possible solutions and alternate plans, without any firm idea about which alternative will really come about, or how, or exactiy when.

title: TOMAN ENDS LATIN TOUR BY VISITING RIO FOR REST
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 207Terence A. Tadmati; the: Assistant. Secretary of Stet! for InterAmerican Affairs, arrived here lost night'aild. conferred today with the United. States ambassador and two of Ills. chief counselors.

title: What Is It About Being A President's Confidant?
description: WASHINGTONThere is something about the modern White House that compels the President, irrespective of party, competence or character, draw close around him his friend's or confidants from prePresidential days. Some have been clowns, some persons of enormous ability. Yet despite their diversity, they have often embarrassed the President once they established intimacy with or authority under him. Bert Lance, the embattled director of the Office of Management and Budget, is the latest in a long sequence of Presidents cronies whose activities have set off a public controversy.

title: SHOW PEOPLE MOURN THE DEATH OF MARX
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 20Hollywood mourned today Groucho Marx, one of America's most creative and most enduring comedians, who died last night at the age of 86.

title: W. T. T. Playoffs
description: SEMIFINAL ROUND New York vs. Boston.

title: A Year of T&E: Does It Work?
description: THE Public School Education Act became law in 1975. It was moribund for nearly a year until the legislature enacted a financing package. That package, which included an income tax, enabled the state to finally implement this landmark education act.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Several speakers will present original research related to the overall theme of Southern Numismatics at the Educational Forum of the American Numismatics Association Convention on Thursday in the Patio Room of the Marriott Hotel in Atlanta, Ga.

title: LETTERS
description: John Darnton's article (Nigeria's Dissident Superstar, July 24) on the burning of Fela's KalaKuta Republic should be thoughtprovoking to many Nigerians abroad in terms of how not to dance to the tune of reform when they get back home.

title: California's Major Charity Group Is Sued as a Monopoly by Rival
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 20The United Way, California's major charity fund drive, has become the focus of a heated controversy that has produced a lawsuit and an investigation by a private citizens group.

title: THE ROAR OF PRO GOLF'S YOUNG LIONS
description: Ask the average golf fan to tick off the names of touring professionals by free association and, predictably, he gives you Arnold Palmer, Jack Nicklaus, Lee Trevino, Tom Weiskopf, Tom Watson, Ben Crenshaw, Hubert Green, Johnny Miller, Ray Floyd names like those. But something has been happening: We have come into the Year of the Nobody. stream of anonyms, nearly all of them younger than 25, has shaken the veterans domination of the $9. 7 million Professional Golfers Association tour.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: Massmarket paperbacks are sof tcover books sold at newsstands, variety stores, supermarkets, as well as in bookstores. This analysis is based on reports from representative wholesalers and chains with more than 10,000 outlets in the United States.

description: Galleries Uptown

title: Bagehot: Economist for All Seasons
description: If the father of this nation's Fede. ral Reserve System was Woodrow Wilson, its grandfather was Walter Bagehot, British economist and journalist. As editor of The Economist from 1860 until his death in 1877, Bagehot (pronounced BADGEit) displayed a brilliant, innovative mind through his clear, direct and often witty writing.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: BEFORE President Carter announced his decision to stop construction plans for the B1 bomber, he called in six Senators and six Representatives to hear their views.

title: What's Doing in CORNWALL, ENGLAND
description: EDGE OF ENGLAND  Excuse me, do you speak English? asked one nervous visitor in the heart of London. As hordes of overseas guests throng Britain's capital, the tourist may well wonder where the natives have fled. One answer: the county of Cornwall, in the southwest of England, where many Britons take their vacations, and where you can see them on their most relaxed and least reserved behavior. In addition there are lonely moors, secluded river creeks amid deep woods, crowded beaches, the narrow streets of fishing villages, gaunt headlands and the raging surf of the Atlantic Ocean. Cornwall's history and its sights go back at least to its indigenous Old Stone Age mennearly 14,000 years ago; later Neolithic colonizers came from Europe, 5,000 years back. Ever since, there has been a cavalcade of Celts, Romans, saints and pirates, missionaries and motorists foolish enough to drive there on a summer Saturday.

title: Eastern League
description: Bristol 4, West Haven 2. Holyoke 4, Waterbury 2. Reading 14, Jersey City 6. Three Rivers 3, Quebec City 2 (1st). Quebec City 2, Mae Rivers 1 (2d).

title: SELECTION
description: OW that I am hack East and my uncle and aunt live in Cedarhurst, Long Island, I respond by phone to a letter from my father and invite my parents to stay in my apartment rather than at a hotel when they come down for their annual winter visit. The two rooms on West Seventyfifth Street are not actually mine but, through an ad in the Times, have been sublet, furnished, from a young actor who has gone to try.

title: Weddings
description: Mrs Jack Greene of Hartsdale announces the marriage of her daughter Candice to John Peter Gutierrez, son of Mr. & Mrs. Juan C. Gutierrez of Wantaugh on Saturday, Aug. 20 at Our Lady of Perpetual Help Churon In Ardsier.

title: There Is Much to Lose in the Primary, Too
description: For several candidates in New York City's Democratic mayoral primary next month, the vote may well mean the end of a political career. Many of the seven in the field are very likely making their final attempt for elective office.

title: To Write Is to Share An Idea With
description: WHEN Barry Neil Kaufman was growing up in Little Neck, he said the other day, There were two things that I really wanted to be because they seemed beautiful. I said I really wanted to be a writer. That seemed a beautiful way to express and share ideas. The other thing I said I wanted to be was somewhere in the area of psychology and Psychiatry.

title: New York City Is Important to Any Real Future for Concorde
description: It has become a matter of deep conviction with the British and French partners in the project that, as New York goes, so goes the fidure of their Concorde supersonic airliner. They were therefore greatly encouraged by last week's Federal District Court decision in Manhattan to lift the ban on flights to Kennedy International Airport.

title: U. S. FACES CHALLENGE ON PUERTO RICO IN U. N.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Carter Administration unexpectedly finds itself facing a more difficult and embarrassing problem than usual about the political status of Puerto Rico at the United Nations next month.

title: U. S. Daily in Rome Ending Publication After Three Decades
description: ROME, Aug. 20 (UPI)Rome's Englishlanguage newspaper, The Daily American, is going out of business after 31 years of publication, its publisher told the staff today.

title: A Fanfare of Black Composers by the Philharmonic
description: A week from tomorrow night, the New York Philharmonic will begin a weeklong Celebration of Black Composers. There will be five concertsone by the full ensemble, two by portions of it and one recital each of piano and vocal music. The latter two events will be given in the Lincoln Center Library Auditorium and will will be free. The others are set for Avery Fisher Hall.

title: New Products for Home and Workshop
description: An exceptionally compact and lightweight take with you television antenna that comes preassembled with its own rotor drive and amplifier is available from the Special Products.

title: Mixed Statistics
description: The economy continues on its indeterminate path, with economic reports for July showing a mixture of strengths and weaknesses.

title: SHOP TALK
description: SUMMERTIME. And the living is easy. The folks are partyingon a boat, in a garden, the front porch, the backyard. The fixings are charcoaled, marinated, mayonlaised. And the serving is On paper or plasticcolorful and disposable.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: The American theater is being revitalized by a prolific band of adventurous new young playwrights. Away from the spotlight, working Off Off Broadway and regional and institutional theaters, they have been sharpening their talents and expanding their possibilities. Late last season, four new playwrightsMichael Cristofer, David Mamet, Albert Innaurato and Christopher Durangmade an impact on the public consciousness. Cristofer's The snaaow Box won the Pulitzer Prize and the Tony Award as Best Play. Mamet's American Buffalo was named Best American Play of the Year by the New York Drama Critics. Innaurato had two plays produced commercially, The Transfiguration of Benno Blimpie and Gemini.  Durang's A History of the American Film had three consecutive, different productions in major regional theaters.

title: Best Sellers
description: FICTION.

title: Libraries Geared for Troubled Children
description: WHEN Dale Jeske inspected the Long Lane School's library in Middletown last October, she was appalled by what she found. The dusty volumes that cluttered the shelves were primarily religious texts and condensed books, circa 1950. Moreover these dated books were not allowed to be checked out by the teenage criminal offenders who live at the school's limitedsecurity facility.

title: Inspirations and Stumbles
description: GREAT NECK's newest steak house, Garrison's, is a sleekly handsome place. Cool beiges and deep browns, high ceilings, thick carpeting, panels of smoked glass, large contemporary paintings and tapestries bespeak taste and comfort in the contemporary idiom. The lighting and sounds are graciously subdued, the dignified hush broken only by the conversation at your own table or the pleasant piano music coming from the bar.

title: Soldier Killed in Crash
description: OURAY, Colo., Aug. 20 (AP)A soldier was killed and nine others injured early today when an Army troop carrier rolled down a cliff near this mining town in southwestern Colorado, the officials said. The identity of the dead man was withheld pending notification of relatives. The nine injured soldiers, most suffering cuts and. bruises, were taken to hospitals Montrose and Grand Junction, Colo., the authorities said. Another soldier escapee injury. All were listed as stationed at Fort Carson, south of Colorado Springs.

title: Of Special Interest
description: Four major summer music festivals will be winding down this week; so if you've been wanting to spend an evening at Mostly Mozart or lying on a lawn listening to Joplin or Dvorak, this is the week to do it.

title: Chile Reports Gains in Reducing Hunger Among Children of Its Poor.
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 20An ambitious national program appears to be reducing hunger and infant mortality among the children of Chile's poorer families.

title: Counties Sift Plan To Purify Water
description: FACED with one of the state's most serious waterquality problems, residents and officials of 35 municipalities in Central New Jersey will soon be given the option of deciding to solve the problem, of letting it continue or of allowing it to get worse.

title: Riegelman, Turning 85, Recalls Unsuccessful 1953 Bid for Mayor
description: There can be compensations is losing a race for Mayor. While still regretting his defeat, Harold Riegelman, who was the 1953 Republican candidate for New York City's chief executive, says that victory would have gotten him so absorbed in problems, I am not sure would have survived to attain my 85th meridian.

title: THE LITERARY VIEW
description: WELL, well. So Prof. Harold Bloom, the prolific Yale savant who has given us The Anxiety of Influence, A Map of Misreading and numerous other works of supererogatory obfuscation, has finally gone and done it. He has delivered himself of a clear and concise statement. He has put his overweight language on a diet, denied himself his customary overindulgence in gluttonous verbiage (does it portend, perhaps, a new criticism minceur?), and said something straight out. Contributing to a symposium on overrated and under rated writers in the August number of Esquirea new forum, I believe, for this normally readerproof explicator of the literary mysterieshe has offered up the following paragraph (I quote it in its entirety) for edification:opens! What feats of mind it promises! It may make hash of civilized discourse, but it is undeniably a great stimulusin New Haven at least(o the writing of books about literatwo.

title: Charity Will Benefit From Long Island Road Rally
description: The primary purpose of a road rally is to determine which drivernavigator team is best at following instructions so that it arrives at Point B from Point A as close to the prescribed time as possible. That purpose will he secondary, however, in a rally About that will be staged Sunday, Motor Sept. 11, by the Long Island Center MG Car Club. Sports Its main goal will be to raise money for the Nassau and Suffolk County chapters of the March of Dimes.

title: As a Floral Stylist, She Bloomed Early
description: YONKERS WHEN Sandra LaVista goes to the wholesale flower market in Manhattan, where she is one of the few women buyers and probably the youngest, she frequently must walk past appreciative whistles.

description: Includes games of August 19

title: New Gunboat for Yugoslav Navy
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Aug. 20 (Reuters)A Yugoslav shipyard has launched a new gunboat, first of a series for the Yugoslav Navy, armed with shiptoship missiles and described by officials as one of the best of its etc in the world.

title: INVESTING
description: Even Midas would have marveled at the American appetite in the early 1970's for investing in vintage gold, silver and copper coins. It all started when the dollar's devaluation at a time of surging bullion values ignited investors interest in artifacts. The rush for rare coins was on, and prices soared. Then, true to the speculativebubble tradition, they collapsed.

title: Haskell Handicap Chart
description: Copyright 1977 by Daily Racing Form, Inc.

title: Some Tips for WouldBe Renters
description: Despite everything the major car rental companies say they're doing to improve service, consumers continue to complain. They complain about dirty cars, cigarette butts in ashtrays, failure of headlights and windshield wipers, bald spare tires and delays at rental counters.

title: 345,000 Volts Under the Sound
description: IN a trailer office on the shore of Long Island Sound one wet and sloppy day, three construction engineers leaned back in their seats and gazed at a map showing an electric cable snaking its way four miles across the bottom of the Sound.

title: INTERVIEW
description: WASHINGTON IN AN EARLIER, perhaps less cynical time, he could have fit the description of Tom Swift or Jack Armstrong, the AllAmerican Boy. But since such evocations of a longago America may be suspect these days, let it be said that they call him Young Fritz, possibly out of some fancied resemblance to Vice. President Walter (Fritz) Mondale. The he in this case is 24yearold Daniel William Reese, sturdy, handsome, strawhaired fellow with piercing eyes and a new job of importance to the people of Connecticut.

title: Jazz Is Alive At the Shore
description: JAZZ on the Jersey Shore, which has been a sometime thing in recent years, has suddenly blossomed this summer. This does not mean that there are jazz bands swinging behind every sand dune. But between Red Bank and Point Pleasant, tour judiciously spaced clubs have been presenting jazz from five to seven nights a week. And none of them was in operation last summer.

title: Music
description: Opera

title: New York State Consumer Unit Deciphers Codes on Food Dating
description: The New York State Consumer Protection Board will begin this week to distribute keys to many of the complex food manufacturer's codes that prevent shoppers from determining how long food items have been on the grocer's shelf.

title: Quite the Contrary
description: NEW DELHIFor months now, they have been constantly hounding me. How much longer can they keep at it? Sanjay Gandhi, the scn of India's former Prime Minister, complained to an interviewer recently. The answer is that theythe Janata Party Government that defeated Indira Gandhi last March and would like to keep her from returning to powermay keep at it for scme time. Last week, the Government arrested four top aides of Mrs. Gandhi who had also been members of the Congress Party caucus headed by her son. And Mr. Gandhi, once considered the heir apparent, is now the object of several criminal investigations.

title: News Summary
description: China's Communist Party elected a new central committee and restored tough disciplinary measures for party members at the first congress since the death of. Mao Tsetung last year. The meeting, the party's 11th congress, was held in Peking. It now appears that. power in Peking is shared by a triumvirate of Hua Kuofeng, the party chairman; Yeh Chienying, the Defense Minister, and Teng Hsiaoping, the recently rehabilitated Deputy,Prime Minister. Page 1, Column i. 1

title: Rules for Sharp Edges on Toys Proposed by Consumer Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP) Guidelines for sharp edges on toys were proposed yesterday by the Consumer Product Safety Commission.

title: IN AMERICA
description: NEW YORK. Having done his bit to elect a President, Jerry Rafshoon thought it might be fun to elect a mayor. Now, slouching shirtless on a sofa in his Manhattan hotel suite, the President's ad man is asking whatever put that crazy idea in his head. A moment ago he was told by a campaign aide to Mario Cuomo that the candidate would have to break an appointment to tape his television commercials for the final weeks of the primary campaign. It's the second time in two days that this has happened, and cancellation fees are mounting. Cuomo is home nursing fever. He's also nursing doubts about the scripts for the commercials, which lay down themes he has previously approved. On top of that, he's fretting over Rafshoon's bills. Compared with this, Rafshoon says, electing Jimmy Carter was easy.

title: GARDENING
description: PLANTS, too, have their black sheep; they come from respectable families, but behave quite differently. Some of them are nuisances, and have been relegated to the unrespectable designation of weed.

title: VW Bug Being Phased Out in U. S.
description: DETROIT, Aug. 20If lions come in a pride and geese in a gaggle, what do Volkswagens come in? A chuffle, someone suggested. A scurry, said someone else.

title: J. C. Weber Weds Marianna Houston
description: Marianna Hayne Houston, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. L Hayne Houston of New Canaan, Conn., was married yesterday to Jeffrey Caldwell Weber, son of Dr. and Mrs. Frederick Weber of Fayettesville, N. Y.

title: Strike Spreads in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 20 (AP)A strike by gasoline delivery truck drivers awns Argentine subsidiaries of the F. xxoe s nd Shell oil companies shut down 1,000more service stations in four cities toda4 industry spokesmen reported. The strike, which began a week ago, has closed 3,014 service stations in Buenos Aires, threequarters of the stations in the capital city, and has spread to Argentina's secone and third largest cities. Cordoba. and Rosario, spokesmen said.

description: THIS COUNTRY'S real gross national product was revised downward by the Commerce Department to an annual growth rate of 6. 1 percent from the original estimate of 6. 4 percent last month&. Corporate profits after taxes for the second quarter rose 7. 1 percent from the firstquarter level to $104. 1 billionthe first time the $100 billion mark has been crossed&. The Commerce Department also reported that business inventories in June increased seventenths of 1 percent to a seasonally adjusted $315. 29 billion while business sales rose a modest twotenths of 1 nercent to $214. 28.

title: Arthur C. Dore, 69, Former Official With Greek Orthodox Archdiocese
description: Arthur C. Dore, former director of the public information office of the Greek Orthodox Archdiocese of North and South Amerida, died Friday. He was 69 years old.

description: HARRISON, N. Y., Aug. 20With chance to score his greatest golf victory, will Andy North choke?

title: Weekend Curfew Imposed On All of Sri Lanka in Bid To End Communal Strife
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Aug 20 (Reuters) The Government of Prime Minister J. R. jayewardene imposed a nationwide curfew on Sri Lanka today amid spreading violence directed mainly against the Tamil minority.

title: Bowling Clinic
description: While it may be that upper echelon bowlers tinker with a variety of hand positions and finger placements, most of the radical adjustments the ordinary bowler is called upon to make are out on the lane, or behind the foul line, not in finger or hand placement.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor Since Henderson Industries is one of the 100 top black businesses, your article Care of the Black Entrepreneur (July 31) was of prime interest to me. It's encouraging to see black business gross incomes increasing, but there are far too few of the businesses really in manufacturing. There are only one or two manufacturers and only one capital equipment manufacturer (Henderson Industries) in the top 100.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: The article Old Saw Reckons 25% of Income on Housing  It Isn't That Simple, [July 29], correctly attacks the conventional wisdom of spending 25 percent of one's income for housing. However, it failed to mention that the proponents of this standard reached the height of idiocy when they applied it to families receiving public assistance.

title: Picture Credits
description: ITHE NEW YORK TIMES/FRED CONRAD.

title: Author's Query
description: I oil writing a biography of Sylvia Beach's Shakespeare and Company bookshop (Paris,19191941) and wish to hear from those who had personal or business associations with the bookshop and Miss Beach.

title: Adjusting to Life in America
description: LOS ANGELESTakeo Mukasa and his family have been living in the United States for seven years. Except for a brief period of residence in New York City, that time has been spent in the Los Angeles area. Mr. Mukasa is West Coast regional manager for the Leader Instruments Corporation, a Tokyobased electronics concern.

title: Electronic Campaigning
description: LISTEN to Fran Purcell, he speaks your language is the common theme of four radio commercialswith code words straight out of the 60'sthat seek to capitalize on the fears of some Nassau County residents of school busing across county lines and lowincome housing.

title: Cold Comfort First in $126,000 Zweig Trot
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 20Cold Comfort, driven by Peter Haughton, withstood a late rally by a stablemate, Green Speed, reined by Haughton's father, Billy, and won the $126,000 Harry M. Zweig Memorial Trot today by a nose.

title: FISHING
description: TRADITIONALLY, there tends to be a midAugust lull in fishing. But this is not a traditional year. Along the North Jersey coast, the lull came weeks ago and stayed, while to the south super bluefishing continues unabated.

title: liiruturiat eruires
description: HALLHelen, beloved friend and teacher, passed away Tuesday, Aug. 16. Memorial Service will be hold Monday, Aug. 22, at 1 P. M., at the Actors Temple, 339 West 47th St.,

title: Truck Kills Priest on Bicycle
description: KENOSHA, Wis., Aug. 20 (UPI)A Roman Catholic priest who journeyed from Esopus, N. to Wisconsin by bicycle and bus to attend a religious gathering was killed by a truck yesterday as he pedaled along a road in Paris, Wis., the police said. The victim was the Rev. Thomas L. Curley, 33 years old, a member of the Redemptorist Order. He was on his way to Holy Redeemer College in Waterford, Wis.

title: U. S. Scullers All Advance in Title Rowing
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, Aug. 20The American scullers rowing in the opening races of the lightweight men's and women's category of competition here at the world rowing championships gave their supporters cause to cheer today as they all advanced to either the semifinal or final rounds of the regatta. Depending on the number of entries in each event, the winners either advanced to the finals or semifinals of these championships. With only 12 entries in the women's single sculls, Joan Lind, America's silver medalist in Montreal, won her heat confidently in the time of 3 minutes 48. 78 seconds and advanced to next Saturday's final. All the women's races are rowed at 1.000meter distances, as opposed to the men's 2.000meter races. Today the Soviet sculler, Leonora Kuminfyate, tried in vain to overtake Miss Lind in the final strokes of their race, but failed. Miss Lind triumphed after leading her Soviet rival by 2. 40 seconds at the 500meter mark.

title: Farms Decline as Revenues Rise
description: ACONTINUING decline in the number of commercial farms in Connecticut is reported in new national census of agriculture, just released. In the five years from 1969 to 1979, the number of farms in the state that sold more than $2,500 of products annually dropped 15. 3 percent, from 2,903 to 2,360. In the same period the number of acres in farms fell 11 percent, from 924,000 to 376,000 acres.

title: Including Woody Allen
description: THIS anthology, covering the past 17 years, is billed as a collection of humor pieces by youngish writers, in which the question whatever happened to literate humor? is, perhaps, answered.  Perhaps, perhaps not.

title: Toronto Townhouse: A YearRound Garden
description: The quaint Victorian row houses in downtown Toronto have a lively new neighbor. It's the home of architect Barton Myers (whose firm is known for some of Canada's most innovative public projects) and his family. Mr. Myers bought a vacant city lot, 25 feet wide by 125 feet long, and toyed with ways to bring light inside his modern but typically skinny town house. His solution: to cover the entire midsection with a prefabricated greenhouse structure. Winter stalks Canada, the architect explained. We needed a winter garden for psychological lift.  His is a twostoryhigh indoor courtyard, full of light and ready for greenery. Mr. Myers also believes that industrial materials, of which the house is primarily built, are inherently elegant. So he left the steel trusses and parts of the house's mechanical systems artfully exposed to provide functional as well as decorative meaning.

title: Mary Chapman Wed to Brian MacDonald
description: Mary Prentiss Chapman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Lansing Chapman Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday in Christ Episcopal Church to Brian Paul MacDonald, Eon of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon Chalmers MacDonald also of Greenwich. The Rev. Samuel Walker performed the ceremony.

title: Nancy Vaughan and Hobart Van Deusen, Banker at Chemical, Celebrate Nuptials
description: Nancy M. Vaughan and Hobart Doremus Van Deusen, who are with the Chemical Bank in New York, were married yesterday. The Rev. Howard G. Teusink of the Marble Collegiate Church performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's Manhattan home,

title: Majestic Light Equals Mark In 8Length Monmouth Romp
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. 20Ogden Phipps's Majestic Light, clearly a horse that enjoys the casual atmosphere of bucolic Monmouth Park, scored an impressive eightlength victory today in the 11th running of the $109,450 Amory L. Haskell Handicap. And he did it before the track's largest crowd of the year, a sundrenched gathering of 22,761.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: Ayear ago, in an Aug. 31 speech to the A. F. L. C. I. O. Presidential candidate Jimmy Carter promised that the focus of his efforts to reduce unemployment would be on the creation of jobs in private enterprise, where 80 percent of all jobs exist.

title: Mathias Bauler, 87
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 20 (AP)Mathias (Paddy) Bauler, an oldtime saloonkeeper and alderman and an outspoken advocate of machine politics in Chicago, died today. He was 87 years old.

title: Carolyn Kerr De Witt Married
description: Carolyn Kerr De Witt, managing editor of The National Petroleum News, a McGrawHill publication, was married yesterday to Robert Frances Koenig, an industrial engineer who heads his own consulting concern in New York. The ceremony was performed in St. John's Episcopal Church in Kingston, N. Y.,. by the Rev. Mark S. Sisk. The bride is a daughter of Mildred G. De Witt of Kingston. and the late John Warren De Witt. Mr. Koenig's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Frank C. Koenig of Jackson, Miss.

title: The Opposition Is Making So Many Waves That a Fish Farm Planned for East Hampton Is Foundering
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I. Plans to establish the first saltwater fin fish farm in New York State are foundering in a sea of opposition from local baymen who fear the operation could damage natural fish nurseries in the area and from residents who object to having the aquaculture project in their neighborhoods.

title: Marilyn Home to Sing Tancredi in Houston
description: Marilyn Home will sing the title role in Rossini's Tancredi in a Houston Gand Opera production to be presented next October. Tancredi, which dates from 1813, was given in New York in the 182526 season, but may not have been presented in this country since then. It was revived in Italy in 1952 at the Maggio Musicale Fiorentino and was given in concert form with piano accompaniment in Wigmore Hall, London, in 1959.

title: CRIME
description: Crime novels with a background of sports do not turn . up very often; and when they do, they are seldom as absorbing as THE FINALISTS by Russell Braddon (Atheneum, $7. 95). The book is set against a background of international tennis, a subject about which this British author knows a great deal. A skilled writer, he gets inside the minds of his touring professionals, and anybody reading this book will come away with insights about the way those heroes of the racquet think and live.

title: SURFER, 52, RECALLS HIS GREATEST RIDE
description: It was a onceinalifetime surf, building bit by bit, a summer storm's bequest. Seventeenyearold Bill Sampson, like every other surfer, had kept his fingers crossed when the storm hit, praying that all the pieces would tall into place.

title: Civilians Are Beginning to Question the Absolute Rule of Geisel and the Military
description: RIO DE JANEIROWhen the Carter Administration first made public its policy of emphasizing human rights dealings with foreign governments, it was often criticized for needlessly antagonizing the military regimes in Latin America. But in the last two weeks, Washington officials visiting Latin America report a lessening of repression and that many of the military regimes are making plans to turn their governments over to civilians. Brazil was of the more hostile targets of the Carter Administration strictures early in the year, and it too is showing signs of change.

title: Their Rallies Falling Short
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 20Larry Csonka returned for the first time since knee surgery Nov. 30, played longer than expected and there were even other bright spots for the Giants tonight.

title: FISHING
description: FROM sand porgies to giant tuna, the Island's waters are offering a virtual menu full of fish now. A large school of giant tunathe same one that produced a recordshattering 1,031pounder last weekis hovering off Block Island. Porgies are abundant along the North Shore from Hart Island out to Montauk.

title: Beastly Behavior
description: A Scar. 7h for a Natural History of Human Knowledge. By Konrad Lorenz. INSPIRED by the example of the pioneering ethologist Konrad Lorenz, students of animal and human behavior have fashioned ethograms: detailed descriptions of behaviors that are displayed by all members of a species. Most fascinating are fixed action patternscomplex sequences of acts that appear almost from birth in fully developed form, provided only that a stimulus of certain type has been perceived, usually during a critical period of the creature's development.

title: Deborah Davis Becomes Bride Of D. M. Curtiss
description: At St. Mark's Episcopal Church in New Britain, Conn.. yesterday afternoon Deborah Mansfield Davis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Walter Davis of New Britain and Chilmark, Mass.. was married to Douglas Mann Curtiss, son of Mr. and Mrs. W. Perry Curtiss Jr. of Branford, Conn. The Rev. Thomas Fletcher performed the ceremony.

title: How Real Are the Bunkers?
description: The United States Commission on Civil Rights, a body with a worthy history, has produced a report that is misconceived, muddled and potentially pernicious. Window Dressing on the Set: Women and Minorities in Television is a heated indictment of the hiring and programming practices of networks and local stations. its recommendations were put into effect, they would turn the Federal Communications Commission into censor.

title: Educator Assays New Post
description: THE state's new Chancellor of Higher Education, T. Edward Hollander, feels that during the next decade, there will be increased competition between public and private colleges for students and for programs to attract them.

title: DINING OUT
description: WESTPORT LA BIBLIOTHEQUE is not a bad restaurant, but it could be much better. It's expensive, attractive and apparently popular, centrally located on a quiet, winding street in Westport, a town that would happily support a firstrate, sophisticated dining place. Although much of the food on the Continental menu is reasonably good, the chef appears to be following the pattern set by other, similar restaurants rather than his own convictions about how good food should taste.

title: Lightning Bolt Strikes A Cathedral in Kremlin
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 20 (Reuters)A lightning bolt struck ong of the Kremlins cathedrals and traveled the length of the building before fizzling harmlessly in front of an icon screen, the newspaper Pravda reported today.

title: He's Woody Allen's 11Silent Partner
description: Marshall makes my game better, says Woody Allen. It's like playing tennis with a pro.  Woody Allen and Marshall Brickman wrote Annie Hall, Allen's most successful film to date, by walking up and down Lexington Avenue and across to Madison and talking and talking and talking. Sometimes they would stop for ice cream. Brickman describes the work as a highly stylized conversation.  On a recent day, the two men, wearing khaki pants, sneakers and sport shirts, were walking past Bloomingdale's. A car filled with teenagers stopped at a red light. Hey, Woody, Woody, they shouted, banging on the horn and the ensuing dialogue between Allen and Brickman went like this:

title: Therapy On Horseback
description: GLEN COVE WHEN 30 Icelandic horses arrived at the sevenacre estate of Geni and Josephine Laemmlin on Duck Pond Road here recently, the neighbors immediately began wondering what was going on. Was a circus moving in or were the Laemmlins building a race track?

title: Police of Spain and Portugal Hint For. Man Who Had Church'sGems
description: OVIEDO, Spain, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Policemen from two countries were searching today for a young man who fled after he was caught at a border check humsession of jewels and gold taken from the Oviedo cathedral.

title: GreggWollek Porsche Wins Endurance Race
description: MOSPORT, Ontario, Aug. 20 (UPI)Peter Gregg and Bob Wollek drove Porsche 935 to victory today in a sixhour endurance race that vaulted Gregg into the lead in the TransAm driving series and continued Porsche's domination of the World Championship of Makes Series.

title: Questions/Answers
description: There have been many letters with this question. The synthetic pyrethrin, resmethrin, an effective control for white fly, is not labeled for use on vegetable plants. We consulted Dr. Stuart Race, extension entomologist at Rutgers University, who recommended using maiathion, according to label directions, and adding some liquid detergent. The detergent acts as a wetting.

title: Ice Cream To Melt The Heart
description: 'I SCREAM, you scream, we all scream for ice cream, popular ditty of the 20's went. And, although the fox trot has long since gone the way of the rumble seat and the headache band, ice cream has kept its place in the nation's heart, right up there with baseball and mom's apple pie.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THE best way to perform a smooth job of handsanding on such flat surfaces as paneling, furniture, doors and wood trim is to use a wooden block as a backing pad and holder for the sandpaper. While there are commerciallymade sanding blocks or pads available, these are not part of everyone's tool kit, and all too often they are not quite the size desired.

title: 60 Begin Second Leg Of LondonSydney Race
description: LONDON, Aug. 20 (AP)Sixty competitors roared away from Athens, Greece, the original city of marathons, on the second lap of the LondontoSydney, Australia auto rally, it was reported today.

title: Tantalizing Tomatoes
description: We have long been haunted by an observation we read many years ago to the effect that onions would be prized above truffles and caviar if they were not quite so abundant. We can think of numerous foods that would attain luxury sdtus were they not, happily, so endlessly available. Chief among these, perhaps, we would place tomatoes. A kitchen without tomatoes would be unthinkable. Yet, for better or worse, tomatoes are not always possessed of the mouthwatering goodness that they have at this time of the year, red and ripe and freshly taken from the vine. So, let us count the blessings of August.

title: Breach in the Zoning Wall
description: THE waves of provincialism that have swept over the Island in past years have left in their wake an assortment of 64 incorporated villages in Nassau County and 28 in Suffolk. Most of them have come into existence because groups of residents living in what were sections of towns in the two counties saw incorporation as a sure way to take control of zoning and building.

title: West Poiot Aide Named
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Aug. 20 (UPI)Brig. Gen. Charles W. Bagnal, assistant division commander of the. 101st Airborne DivisiOn at Fort Campbell, Ky., has been named deputy superintendent of the United States Military Academy. General Bagnal, 43 years old, a 1956 West Point graduate, is the first deputy superintendent in the academy's history. The post was created recently to bolster administrative functions.

title: Hicks Takes Off for Georgia
description: WHITE PLAINS DAVID V. HICKS, the young college teacher who seemed destined for a leading role in Westchester Republican politics after his hardfought campaign last year against Representative Richard L. Ottinger, one of the Democrats most effective vote getters, has left the county. He thinks it is unlikely that he will return.

title: Recent Hard Times
description: It was a checkered 31year history for Rome's Daily American, with periods: of optimism and hard struggle amid a bewildering state of flux in the paper's staff and management. But to visitors to Rome. it was evident in recent years that the paper had fallen on hard times, with important stories from home often missed because its morning editions had gone to press well before the end of the business day in the United States.

title: Spilling the Beans on the $32 Tomato
description: MY FRIEND, Green Thumb, the Manhasset Hills backyard agronomist, has been spilling the beans to me again, furtively. We met in back of the house, shrouded in a humid mistiness and standing in ankledeep wet grass. Purely precautionary. Green Thumb, who is a fighter for justice for weekend homeowning farmers, values his anonymity, just as Zorro did.

title: On the Town
description: EAST ISLIP IT is highly unusual for a town to sponsor an art gallery, and yet that is exactly what the Town of Islip does. For the last four years it has provided the Islip Town Art Gallery with a building on the Brookwood estate; paid the salary of the director, Elizabeth Vaughan, an assistant and secretary; furnished its grounds for special events and underwritten maintenance costs.

title: LUTHERANS WANT TO DROP HYMN REFERRING TO JEWS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20. (UPI) The leadership of the American Lutheran Church is asking that the minister's edition of the proposed interLutheran Book of Worship delete the ancient hymn called Reproaches from Good Friday services.

title: Panama Gives The Senate Its Big Chance
description: WASHINGTONAside from a few participating hearings in the capital, the members of the United States Senate are away touring tobacco auctions or senior citizens centers or visiting Cuba. But in September it will be the Senate's turn to reassert itself in a city that has become unusually fascinated with the House and its Speaker, Thomas P. O'Neill Jr.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20  HispanicAmericans are thrusting themselves toward the mainstream of the Roman Catholic Church after what they consider to be centuries of neglect.

Nor would he have turned, as he has, into a vigilante. Having managed to get through a rather tough winter without putting too much insulation into his house walls, Jerry and his family were looking forward to uneventful. auiet and easy summer.

description: The North Atlantic airfare war heated up last week as the competitive fire started by Freddie Laker, the British charter operator, spread to the scheduled airlines.

description: CANTON, Sunday, Aug. 21The Chinese Communist Party has elected a new ruling Politburo, it was announced this morning, reflecting the country's move away from the policies of the late Mao Tsetung and toward a stress on order and economic growth.

title: Chary Penner Married
description: Chary Dee Penner, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter H. Penner of New York and Fort Lauderdale, Fla., was married yesterday evening to Michael Scott Blechman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gil Vert D. Blechman of Lincolnwood, Ill. Rabbi Arnold Kalman performed the ceremony at the Ritz Carlton Hotel in Chicaan.

title: NEW YORK CITY FACES SHARP MEASLES RISE
description: The number of measles cases reported in New York City this year is already 56 percent higher than those reported last year, and will probably go even higher, according to figures mleased last week by the City Department of Health.

title: Corbett Rider Takes Reins of Pa. Show
description: He's been around for more than a quarter of a century. Yet he feels like a newcomer  and in many ways he is.

title: Drought and Corruption Reported to Cause Famine in Northern Ghana
description: LONDON, Aug. 20 (AP)A famime has overwhelmed villages in northern Ghana, where food supplies are scarce because of drought and of gross irregularities among local officials, a British relief organization says.

title: Thousands of Fans Are Somber in Visits To Tomb of Presley
description: MEMPHIS, Aug. 20 (UPI)Thousands of somber fans filed quietly past Elvis Presley's tomb today.

title: 500 Homosexuals March to the U. N.  Ina Rights Protest
description: Five hundred homosexual men and women yesterday marched on United Nations headquarters in New York to alert the world that gay men and women are still denied basic civil and human rights.

title: Washington Is Thinking Over the Regulatory Agencies
description: ASHINGTON  In 1970, the Federal Register, in which all new Government rules and regulations must be published, contained 20,000 pages. In 1975, there were more than 60,000. If anything, the trend has accelerated since. In almost every case, a new regulation a response to a national consensus on desirable social or economic goals. Increasingly, however, economists, both conservative and liberal and politicians both parties have been questioning whether the regulator37 process as is now applied is really the most efficient and most economic way of reaching the goals of, say, worker safety or clean air or fair prices. So next month, Congress will be considering measures that would give domestic airlines some freedom to raise and lower their rates on their own.

title: Rolein Inmates Protest Brings Liddy's Transfer To HighSecurity Prison
description: ALLENWOOD, Pa., Aug. 20 (UPI)G. Gordon Liddy, mastermind of the Watergate breakin, was among 52 prisoners transferred today from the minimum securir Allenwood Prison to the nearby maximum security Lewisburg Penitentiary because of his participation in hunger strike.

title: Voyager Heads Toward Planets Despite Snags After Its Liftoff
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Aug. 20The first Voyager spacecraft, an automatic extension of the human mind and eye out into the interplanetary reaches, was launched here today and despite a plague of early malfunctions, was cruising away from the Earth on course to Jupiter, Saturn and possibly Uranus.

description: THE best way to perform a smooth job of handsanding on such flat surfaces as paneling, furniture, doors and wood trim is to use a wooden block as a backing pad and holder for the sandpaper. title: U. S. Group Ends Argentina Visit
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Eight members of the United States House of Representatives left here today for Brazil after a threeday visit to study human rights conditions in Argentina. Representative Gus Yatron, the Pennsylvania Democrat who led the gropp, said at a news conference last night that he believed Argentina had constructively addressed many of the criticisms regarding human rights leveled at the Government in recent months.

title: Visitors Crack 14 Hits and Rout Swan
description: George Foster did not hit a home run yesterday at Shea Stadium. But his big bat and imposing presence were in the thick of Cincinnati's 82, victory over the New York Mets.

title: Bergen Residents Save Historic House
description: NEW MILFORD THREE days of activities celebrating the saving of the CampbellChristie house, a preRevolutionary War Dutch Colonial brownstone home, end today with a Colonial crafts fair on a field behind the Borough Hall. An encampment by the East Artillery, a costumed group of riflemen from Oradell, a skirmish by the flintlockcarrying East Artillery, and a parade also helped to celebrate the appropriation of $150,000 by the Bergen County Board of Freeholders to move the CampbellChristie house to River Edge.

title: ART VIEW
description: This is Rubens Year, all over Belgium. The Belgians are both a tireless and an extremely conscientious people. Rubens himself did an immense amount of work, and his example warmed everyone around him and made them more imaginative and more energetic than they would have been otherwise. If you put your mind to it in Belgium you can almost pick Rubens out of the air: above all in his own city Antwerp, but hardly less so in Brussels, in Ghent, in Malines and in many a small country town.

title: Josef Sgmmer Returns To Shadow Box lin Lead
description: Josef Sommer, who played the Interviewer in Michael Cristofer's The Shadow Box, when it opened at the Morosco last March, has returned to the show to replace Laurence Luckinbill in the leading role of Brian. Other cast changes in the play, which won Pulitzer Prize and a Tony Award this year, include Mary Carver replacing Geraldine Fitzgerald, Thomas Hill for Clifton James, Gwyda Don Howe for Patricia Elliott, Maria Tucci for Rose Gregorio, Timothy Crowe for Stephen Keep and David Rasche for Mandy Patinkin. Of the original cast, Joyce Ebert and Vincent Stewart remain.

title: Miss Weaver, J. J. Miesowitz Are Married
description: The marriage of Christina Elisabeth Weaver and John Jeffrey Miesowitz. seniors at the Seton Hall University Law Center, took place in Rahway, N. J., last evening. The Rev. Eugene W. Foote performed the ceremony in the Second Presbyterian Church. A reception followed at the Merchants and Drovers Inn, which dates to 1746 and is headquarters for the Rahway Historical Society.

title: The World's Most Splendid Existing Classical Theater
description: Japan's Kabuki is by knowledgeable consensus the world's most splendid classical theater still existing in more or less pristine authenticity. The golden dramas of ancient Greece, Sanskrit India and even Elizabethan Shakespeare have been preserved as texts, but staging methods have vanished into history. For example, men no longer perform women's roles legitimately. Original accompanying music and dances, masks and costumes have pretty much disappeared into conjecture or reconstruction. And theater devices once used are inappropriate to modern times. In Japan, however, the hanamichi passageway, the revolving stage, the trap doors and lifts, and a score of other ingenious stage tricks that Kabuki invented on its own and in isolation from the rest of the world centuries ago are still integral to today's performances. After 1954 when Sol Hurok presented an allgirl troupe of Japanese dancers under the spurious guise of Azuma Kabuki, true Kabuki has since visited America at almost decennial intervals 1960, 1969 and now 1977. The inbetween time lapses have been just long enough for the uninitiated to forget what Kabuki is, for devotees to chafe for its return and for a new generation of curiosity seekers to develop.

title: Godspell for Howard Johnson, Shenandoah for Col. Sanders?
description: STAMFORD WRILE IT IS standard policy of this column only to report on professional theater in Westchester and Conecticut, history in the makingmaybe cannot be ignored.

title: TV VIEW
description: Eleven o'clock at night. Let me find out what has happened in the world. I am turning on the news. Soon I will be a betterinformed citizen my& Wait a minute& That man in the blazer& Why is he staring at me that way? He has his head cocked down, so that his eyes seem bulge prominently. His eyebrows are enormous, and from this position they seem to be growing across the middle of his face. The urgent, relentless tone of voice suggests that a vehicle from outer space has just crashed into the Empire State Building. Perhaps he is saying something important. But cannot tell. All I can perceive are his eyes, staring at me from beneath those enormous growths of hair& staring me& staring at me& staring&.

title: Lake Balaton: A Hungarian Mixture With a Maritime Flavor
description: In the landlocked heart of Central Europe, where machines make waves in swimming pools to simulate the sea, the largest lake  and a principal playground  is Hungary's 46milelong Lake Balaton. Its 118 miles of shoreline, 54 miles southwest of Budapest (at the closest point) and 196 miles southeast of Vienna, are studded with resorts from sedate, manicured spas to rustic motels to informal campgrounds.

title: When Rules Work, When They Don't
description: ASHINGTON  Congress is presently considering /egisiation that would substantially restrict the authority of the Civil Aeronautics Board to set air _fares and would open up the industry for the first time in 40 years to new domestic carriers. Even though the legisla tion would reduce the power and prominence of the C. A. B., it is supported by the board's new chairman, Alfred E. Kahn. Mr. Kahn, an economist who formerly headed the New York State Public Service Commission, discussed his views on regulation with Ernest Holsendolph of The New York Times Washington bureau. Excerpts from the interview follow.

title: At Least 10 Killed In Philippine Floods
description: MANILA, Sunday, Aug. 21 (Reuters) At least 10 people have been listed dead and about 4,300 people evacuated to higher grounds in Manila following two days of strong rains in the Philippines, the National Red Cross said today.

title: Budget in Pennsylvania Won by an Absentee's Vote

title: TV Can Be Made Into an Ally

I am convinced that it is vital that both the public and professionals who work with children begin to realize that television's appeal to children goes beyond the content of what is presented. Rather, television combines sight, sound, movement andfrequentlycolor to hold the attention of children.

description: JAMESTOWN, R. I., Aug. 20 (AP)Another 1,500 pounds of marijuana, believed part of a large shipment seized earlier this week in Rhode Island, has been found in a wooded area of Jamestown, the authorities said. The Jamestown police said markings on the plastic bags protecting the marijuana matched markings on the bags containing five and a half tons of marijuana seized last Wednesday in Warwick.

title: Food for Therapy: A Little Challah
description: SOUTH ORANGE WHEN Ruth Sagner the wife of Alan Sagner, the newly named chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New confronts a crisis, she meets it headon. She retires to her handsomely appointed kitchen and bakes a challahbraided, browned and irresistible.

title: Putting a Price Tag on Your Past
description: GLORIA YOUNGER has been running tag sales in New Rochelle, Scarsdale and neighboring towns for eight years, and she is well aware that not every home is bursting with antiques. But there are plenty of them with antiques and other collectible and useful items to keep her busy the year round. Mostsales are in the summer and fall, she said, but business was good right through the winter and this year looks even better.

title: Linda Anne Pizzitola Bride of Edward Ruby
description: Linda Anne Pizzitola, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank J. Pizzitola of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Edward Henry Ruby, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard G. Ruby of South Dartmouth, Mass. The Rev. Eugene J. Prior, assistant headmaster of the Loyola School, performed the ceremony in St. Vincent Ferrer's Roman Catholic Church.
