Cuomo traded accusations yesterday over Mr. Beame's charge of possible conflict of interest by a Securities and Exchange Commission lawyer overseeing a commission study of the city's fiscal crisis.

title: U.S. to Allow Peruvian Girl on L.I. to Visit Sick Father
description: The District Director of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service said yesterday that he would be happy to grant a Peruvian girl living in Valley Stream, LI., a 30day leave during which she could return home to visit her sick father. Last week a judge turned down a Long Island couple's long effort to obtain permanentresident status for the girl.

title: Zachry Tops Astros, 21, For Mets
description: While Torn Seaver was riding off into the sunset after his triumphal return home, the New York Mets turned back to less emotional pursuits last night and ended a fivegame losing slide by edging the Houston Astros, 21.

title: School Integration In Rockville Centre Is Put Off for Year
description: MINEOLA, LI., Aug. 22The state's new Commissioner of Education today extended by one year the time that the Rockville Centre school district has to begin integrating its six elementary schools. The order, which affects 4,000 students, overruled one issued by former Commissioner Ewald B. Nyquist as he left office last June.

title: COURT PUTS FARBER BACK ON THE BALLOT
description: A justice of New York State Supreme Court yesterday rejected a challenge to the nominating petitions of Barry Farber, thus setting up a mayoral primary in the Republican Party. The challenge had been mounted by Roy M. Goodman, the organization Republcan candidate.

title: BOND CREDIT RATING FOR ISSUE BY RAC. RAISED BY AGENCIES
description: In a step that speeds New York City toward the day it can issue its own securities to the public, the two major creditrating agencies yesterday awarded longsought investmentgrade ratings to a forthcoming $200 million offering of new bonds by the Municipal Assistance Corporation.

title: Endowment for Humanities Is Groping to Define Itself
description: WASHINGTONA dancer dances, musician plays and an artist paints or sculpts. But pity the poor humanist in America. Few people seem quite sure what he's supposed to do, or what it means once he's done it.

title: Women Swimmers in U.S. Still Lagging
description: MISSION VIEJO, Calif., Aug. 22Sometimes, you can't tell the winners from the losers, even when the game is over.

title: ILLINOIS LEADER REJECTS PROPERTY TAX MEASURE
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22Gov. James R. Thompson of Illinois today rejected a demand for a special legislative session to deal with the issue of property tax increases of 40 to 300 percent that have been imposed on many home owners in the northern section of Cook County.

title: The Law Against The Order
description: When a group of (mostly) New York liberals gathered in a good cause at East Hampton last week, not surprisingly one of the dominant subjects of conversation was President Carter's nomination of Judge Frank M. Johnson Jr. to be the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. What was surprising was that so much doubtshort of hostility  was expressed about the nomination.

title: Quality of Draftees In the Soviet Union Worries a General
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 22 (AP)A Soviet general has expressed concern about the quality of some draftees entering the armed forces from the Soviet Union's large military training program for schoolage youths.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Biggest Accounting Merger Joins Touche Ross With J. K. Lasser
description: Touche Ross & Company and J. K. Lasser & Company announced yesterday they had merged their practices, creating one of the largest accounting partnerships in the country.

title: New Sale Schedule Issued by U.S. For Offshore Oil and Gas Leases
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)Interior Secretary Cecil D. Andrus issued a new schedule today for the sale of offshore oil and gas leases for the years 1979 through 1981. The schedule calls for five sales in 1979, four in 1980 and six in 1981. The sales include five outer con tinental shelf tracts along the Atlantic Coast, two off California, three in the Gulf of Mexico and five off Alaska.

title: VOYAGER 1 EXAMINED FOR CLUE TO ITS TWIN
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Aug. 22Working with the care of watchmakers, engineers removed the protective shroud from the Voyager 1 spacecraft today and began a detailed search for clues to what might have caused its twin to get off to such an uncertain start Saturday on its journey to the outer planets.

title: State Dept. Presses Search for Missing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)The State Department is going to court Wednesday to ask permission to search some 200 packing crates left behind by Richard M. Nixon for valuable gifts presented to the former President and his family by foreign dignitaries.

title: 10 in Mexico Die in Shootout After Troops Halt Hijacked Bus
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 22 (UPI)Modcan troops and policemen blocked the path of a hijacked passenger bus early today and 10 persons were killed in shootout and the explosion of a grenade held by one of the two hijackers. Ten persons were wounded.

title: Carey Backs Carter On Welfare Plans; Cites Own Record
description: Governor Carey announced his support for President Carter's welfare revision proposals yesterday and used the occasion to. do a little pointing with pride at his own record on welfare.

title: Dr. Oscar Bodansky, Renowned In Medical Research, Dies at 76
description: Dr. Oscar Bodansky, a pioneer in the use of biochemistry for the detection of serious diseases, especially cancer, died Sunday at New York Hospital on his 76th birthday. He lived in Manhattan.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Aug. 22The Venezuelan Government has announced the discovery of a major deposit of highquality bauxite.

title: SPLIT IN SHIPPING GROUPS STALLS PIER LABOR TALKS
description: The New York Shipping Association has threatened to withdraw from the Council of North Atlantic Shipping.Association if the council is unable to negotiate a new agreement with the International Longshoremen's Association.

title: Ingram Racers
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 22 (AP)Ron Ingram, former coach of the nowdefunct San Diego Mariners, was named today coach of the World Hockey Association's Indianapolis Racers. The appointment was announced by Nelson Skalbania, new majority owner of the team.

title: 8WEEK COAL STRIKE APPARENTLY ENDING
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 22 A wildcat strike by union coal miners, begun eight weeks ago to protest cutbacks in medical benefits provided by the United Mine Workers Health and Retirement Fund, appeared to have collapsed here today after a tumultuous meeting that involved miners and the union's international executive board.

title: Italian Wholesale Prices Up 16%
description: ROME, Aug. 22 (UPI)The Italian statistics bureau, ISTAT, said today Cie wholesale prices in Italy jumped 16.3 percent in June from June 1976. The price index rose threetenths of 1 percent horn May 1977, according to final figures. The rate of increase per month has been slowing down this year. The relath,e rates of increase: January, 1.5 percent; February, 1.6 percent; March and April. eighttenths of 1 percent; May, sixtenths of 1 percent and June, threetenths of 1 percent.

title: Giants Hint Golsteyn Is No. 1 Passer
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 22Jerry Golsteyn, who has never played a National Football League regularseason game, will be the Giants starting quarterback on opening day, it was NOT announced today.

title: Stock Tables Explained
description: PIE refers to priceearnings silo, the number of. limes the company's latest tzmonth earnings can be divided Into the stock's closing twice. All prices are In dollars, The letter ustands for new annual high and dIndlcates new low..

title: Montana Emergency Declared
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (Reuters)President Carter today declared an emergency in droughtstricken Montana. The declaration permits the use of Federal funds for relief and recovery efforts in designated areas. It will also provide assistance for livestock feed to help producers to maintain their herds.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Associated Press

title: People and Business
description: Robert P. Tyler Jr., the president and chief operating officer of the Simmons Company, a large diversified home furnishing producer, has been discharged. the company announced yesterday in Atlanta, its home base.

title: Two Slain in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 22 (AP)Ar army lieutenant kidnapped Saturday night was found shot to death and a retired police officer was slain as he walked along a street in a Buenos Aires suburb, officials reported today. Leftist terrorists were blamed for both killings

title: 8WEEK COAL STRIKE APPARENTLY ENDING
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 22 A wildcat strike by union coal miners, begun eight weeks ago to protest cutbacks in medical benefits provided by the United Mine Workers Health and Retirement Fund, appeared to have collapsed here today after a tumultuous meeting that involved miners and the union's international executive board.

title: F. T. C. IS STUDYING BLOOMINGDALE LINKS
description: Influencing of Suppliers in Effort to Fix Prices Is Focus of Inquiry

title: Air Controllers in Britain Vote to Strike Thursday
description: LONDON, Aug. 22Britain's assistant airtraffic controllers who for several days have disrupted air traffic with work slowdown, voted overwhelmingly today to begin a fourday allout strike midnight Thursday that could affect more than one million travelers.

title: Services Held for Two TeenAgers Killed Mourning Death of Presley
description: MONROE, La., Aug. 22 (UPI)Funeral services were held Saturday for two teenage girls who drove more than 200 miles to Memphis, Tenn., to mourn the death of Elvis Presley and were killed by a car outside the late singer's mansion.

title: Consumer Unit Hears Testimony on Safety Proposals for Insulation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22Consumers in the market for home insulation have no protection against unscrupulous or inexperienced merchants who may sell them flammable insulation or who may install it improperly, the Consumer Product Safety Commission was told today.

title: Men and Nature Cloud Aged Couple's Dream of Island Cottage
description: COVENTRY, Conn., Aug. 21An elderly couple intent on fixing up and moving into a cottage on a tiny island they own on Lake Wanbumbaug is in serious conflict with this community over the tightening of zoning and sanitary codes, and because of the rising level of the lake.

title: U.S. Women Qualify in Rowing Repechage
description: AMSTERDAM, Aug. 22Lisa Hansen and Liz Hills of Long Beach, Calif., won their repechage, or secondchance heat, today to qualify for Thursday's double sculls semifinals for women at the world rowing championships.

title: Soviet Improves Military Forces, But at a Price, U.S. Agency Finds
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)The Soviet Union has continued to improve Its military forces in the last year, but at increasing expense, the Defense Intelligence Agency says.

title: Israel Said to Use U.S. Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (Reute.rs)Israel has used Americansupplied military equipment to support Christian forces involved in the conflict in Lebanon, the State Department said today.

title: Around the Nation
description: OCEAN CITY, Md., Aug. 22 (UPI)Oil from a major spill yesterday smeared this resort city's beaches. Cleanup operations were under way today and the Coast Guard sought to determine the source of the oil.

title: SaccoVanzetti Case Evoking Passions 50 Years After Deaths
description: Today is the 50th anniversary of the execution in Boston of Sacco and Vanzetti, but passions endure and doubts persist. Was their murder conviction, which stirred demonstrations, strikes riots and even bombings in many countries, justice or injustice? Were they criminals or martyrs?

title: South Africa PowerSharing Plan Meeting With a Mixed Reception
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 22The South African Government's plan to offer share of national political power to minority racial groups, but not to the black majority, has met a mixed reception.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CAMERA CROP Midtown watchers who keep tabs on the rewarding displays at the Kodak Photo Gallery, the free showcase at 43d Street and the Avenue of the Americas, have a new treat in storemore than 300 samples by prizewinning junior and seniorhigh school photographers in the annual Scholastic/Kodak national contest.

title: Strong Steps to Insure Rights Urged at a Law Parley
description: MANILA, Aug. 23Stronger international action to protect individual rights was endorsed today at a session here of an international legal conference that was marked by heated exchanges.

title: Clinging to a Life Where One Belongs
description: LONDON

title: The Case for Roy Goodman
description: The New York State Supreme Court has found enough valid signatures on Barry Farber's election petitions to justify his appearance, after all, on the ballot as a Republican candidate for Mayor. Unless overruled by a still higher court, this means that Senator Roy Goodman will face a primary election campaign between now and Sept. 8.

title: Linton Elected Drexel Chief
description: Robert E. Linton has been elected president and chief executive officer of Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc., a brokerage house, it was announced yesterday. He succeeds Mark N. Kaplan, who has resigned. Mr. Linton joined Drexel in 1946 and was most recently its senior executive vice president and a member of the executive committee.

title: Vance to Meet Teng, Rehabilitated Deputy Premier, in Peking Today to Discuss Taiwan
description: TERING, Aug. 23Teng Hsiaoping, China's thirdranking leader, will join the Chinese delegation tomorrow for talks with Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, a. State Department spokesman said tonight, and the subject is scheduled to be the critical issue of Taiwan.

title: How the Poll Was Taken
description: The New York TimesChannel 2 News (WCBSTV) survey was based on telephone interviews with 2,171 adult men and women in New York City, including 1,327 registered Democrats. The interviews were conducted from Aug. 13 to 20.

title: New Constitution Offers More Discussion Inside the Chinese Party
description: PEKING, Aug. 23 (Reuters)China published a new Communist Party constitution today. It heavily stresses discipline hut, offers more discussion within the party.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Beame, Mrs. Abzug Lead in Poll; Cuomo, Koch in Striking Distance
description: With the Democratic mayoral primary only two weeks away, Mayor Beanie and Bella S. Abzug are running neck and neck for the lead, but two other candidates, Mario M. Cuomo and Representative Edward I. Koch, are in a strong enough position to catch up with either or both, according to the New York Times/Channel 2 News (WCBSTV) survey of registered and likely Democratic voters.

title: Mary Martin Gives Somersaults
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23For the actor. m music is quite as sweet as the steady, rousing beat of a standing ovation. And Mary Martin heard the sweet sound of that kind of music as she returned to the stage last night. after a lengthy absence, to costar with Anthony Quayle in Aleksei Arbuzov's twocharacter comedy, Do You Turn Somersaults? at the Eisenhower Theater in Washington's John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

title: Mets'
description: For the second straight day, the New York Mets came to life in the late innings against the Houston Astros yesterday, and for the second straight day, they beat the Astros by 21tying them on a pinchhit double by Ed Kranepool in the eighth and defeating them cn a single by Lenny Randle in the ninth.

title: Coordinated Drive to End Arms and Economic Help For South Africa Is Urged
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 22 (UPI)Prime Minister Odvar Nordli of Norway called today for a halt to all military and economic support for South Africa in a concerted international move against its apartheid policies of racial segregation.

title: Careers
description: Steady, men.

title: MAC. 15YEAR BONDS PRICED TO YIELD 71To
description: In a day of extremely heavy financing activity, investment bankers priced the Municipal Assistance Corporation's $200 million issue of 15year bonds to yield 71/2 percent.

title: Coal Miners
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 23 (UPI)Roving pickets, some from neighboring Kentucky, kept about half of West Virginia's coal miners away from the pits today as the miners were to have ended an eightweek wildcat strike.

title: Angolan Off on Cuba Visit
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 23 (AP)President Agostinho Neto of Angola left Luanda today for a private visit to Cuba, Radio Angola reported. It gave no reason for the trip. About 18,000 Cuban troops backed Mr. Neto in. the Angolan civil war that erupted in November 1975 after Portugal surrendered control of its largest Colony in Africa.

title: Stone of U.S. Gains Sculls Semifinal
description: AMSTERDAM, Aug. 23The rain stopped, the sun shone, and the racing conditions on the Bosbaan course were ideal for the men's elite repechage heats of the 1977 world rowing championships.

title: Metropolitan Dairy
description: ANNETTE BIERINGER and a friend were the Brooklyn Academy of Music not long ago when Mrs. Bieringer's friehd encountered difficulty in operating a new pair opera glasses.

title: Soviet Teachers, In Buffalo Visit, Are Impressive And Learn, Too
description: BUFFALOA group of 37 Soviet teachers just completed a twomonth summer training session at the State University here and by most counts it was a most successful invasion. The teachers returned to the Soviet Union this week.

title: Good Ratings Help Sell M.A.C. Bonds at 7% Interest
description: Bolstered by its new investmentgrade ratings, the Municipal Assistance Corportion yesterday swiftly sold out its offering of $200 million in bonds at 7.5 percenta rate corporation officials and underwriters deemed a vote of investor confidence in the security of the M.A.C.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Ashland Oil Inc. said yesterday it had asked the Commonwealth Oil Refining Company and certain other parties for an extension of the Sept. 1 deadline of its option to purchase $50 million of new Commonwealth preferred stock. Ashland asked for an extension to Oct. 1.

title: Cordero, Cauthen Duel for Honors at Spa
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 23 Steve Cauthen rode two winners today and gained slightly on Angel Cordero in their battle for jockey honors at the Saratoga meeting.

title: Graig Nettles and Some Other Guys
description: This is a letter from Jack Orr, who used to be a newspaperman, himself: Bill Gallo had a neat cartoon the other day boasting on Graig Nettles, and in the middle he had Basement Bertha ask: Has there ever been a better Yankee third basman? Well, let's see, Nettles is a lifetime .248 hitter, this year .230, and though fielding at third base is often a subjective matter [unless the man is Brooks Robinson or Billy Cox or Pie Traynor], I can think of a few guys from my baseball days I'd just as soon have on my club. For one, how about Joey Sewell, just inducted into the Hall of Fame, who hit 302, .272 and .273 in his three years with the Yankees, the last seasons in a 14year career in the majors where his lifetime average was .312? One summer with the Yankees, in 503 times at bat, Sewell struck out only three times. Nettles can do that in one series against the Angels.

title: Film and TV Unions Bend Rules for Jobs
description: No industry is more enmeshed in a thicket of union work rules than film and television production. But as befits the business of entertainment and illusion, the image is one thing; the reality, _ something else.

title: Head of S.E.C. Accuses Beame Of Subterfuge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23The chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, Harold M. Williams, accused Mayor Beame today of unfounded attacks reflecting on the commission's integrity in order to further the Mayor's campaign for reelection. He said that the Mayor, for partisan political purposes, was trying to misconstrue a meaningful effort by the commission to investigate impartially the city's financial difficulties.

title: Jules Glaenzer, 93, ExChairman Of Cartier Sold Famous Gems
description: Jules Glaenzer, former chairman of the board of Cartier Inc., died at the New York Hospital on Aug. 16. He was 93 years old and lived at 131 East 69th Street.

title: Nurses at Brookdale Hospital Strike as Talks Fail
description: Hundreds of nurses at the Brookdale Medical Center in Brooklyn walked off their jobs early yesterday as contract negotiations between their union and the hospital's management broke down. It was the first strike by nurses at a major voluntary hospital in the city, according to the New York State Nurses Association.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHILE this seems to be, in my lay opinion, quite good book on how to be Gestalt therapist, I don't know that many general readers will be prepared for this subject, and so want to approach Joseph Zinker's Creative Process in Gestalt Therapy from a point of view that includes everybody.

title: Dow Closes at 865.56, Down 1.73, As Rally Fails in Heavier Trading
description: The stock market's modest rally on Monday lost its impetus yesterday as prices finished slightly lower in accelerated trading.

title: High Ethiopian Casualties Reported
description: NALROBI, Kenya, Aug. 23 (Reuters)Somali guerrillas said today they had killed nearly 1,000 Ethiopian soldiers and wounded many others in a battle for two governmentheld strongholds in mountains 150 miles southeast of Addis Ababa.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: FRAUD IS REPORTED IN PROCESSSERVING
description: A routine check of Civil Court records of licensed process servers has uncovered 65 apparently forged signatures on affidavits of service that could invalidate judgments already granted by the court, the city's Department of Consumer Affairs disclosed yesterday.

description: ENTRIES
