title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Pop: Dramatic and Charming Ronstadt
description: TEN YEARS HAVE PASSED since Linda Ronstadt, then a member of the Stone Poneys, released her first album, and during that interval she has learned a tremendous amount about how to make records. Under the tutelage of the producer Peter Asher, Miss Ronstadt has evolved from a raw and rambunctious performers into a more polished and highly commercial one.

title: In Boston, SaccoVanzetti Anniversary Is Quiet
description: BOSTON, Aug. 23Today, the 50th anniversary of the execution here of Nicola Sacco and Bartolomeo Vanzetti, was a time for the men and women of the heavily Italian North End section to recollect an event, not a cause, and then only if someone reminded them.

title: Rosalyn Tureck Schedules Six Bach Concerts
description: Rosalyri Tureck will celebrate the 40th anniversary of her first series of six Bach concerts in New York with a series of six to be given this season at Carnegie Hall and the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Alex Segal, Pioneering TV Drama Director
description: Alex Segal, a pioneering director of live television drama and former chairman of the drama department of the University of Southern California, died Monday at a hospital in Los Angeles. He was 62 years old and lived in Pacific Palisades.

title: Smith to See Vorster Saturday; African Leaders Will Also Meet
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Aug. 23 (AP) Prime Minister Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia will meet here Saturday with Prime Minister John Vorster, South African officials announced today. Their meeting coincides with a gathering of the five socalled frontline African presidents in Zambia, and raised speculation about new diplomatic efforts to reach a peaceful settlement in Rhodesia,

title: RABBIS REPORT IMPASSE IN TALKS ON CONVERSION
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 23 (Reuters)Leaders of Israeli Orthodox Judaism and representatives of American Conservative and Reform Jewish communities have failed in talks here to reach agreement on the question of how does a nonJew become a Jew.

title: New Bond Issues
PedalDriven Plane Is Flown for 1.4 Miles
description: SHAFTER, Calif., Aug. 23 (AP)Bryan Allen. 24 years old, flew a pedaldriven plane over a 1.4mile course here today and claimed an $85,000 prize offered by the London Royal Aeronautic Society for the first sustained manpowered flight. The flight. believed to be the first ever accomplished over the stipulated distance, was certified by William Richardson of the Kern County Aviation Department.

title: Muddying the Welfare Water
description: In the early 1970's, Senator Russell Long of Louisiana devised a plan that would give subsidies to the poor who work and nothing to the poor who do not work. The scheme, given the unwieldy title of earned income tax credit, became law in 1975 and since then has paid modest amounts to workers with family incomes under $8,000. The Administration's new welfare reform proposal gives new prominence to Senator Long's idea. The president has proposed expanding the tax subsidy to benefit middleclass workers; some critics now deride the proposal as a welfare program for the welltodo. The entire discussion could better have been avoided.

title: A. H. Raskin
description: The Carter Administration is taking its first steps toward using the leverage supplied by billions of dollars of Federal spending to encourage labormanagement cooperation in fighting inflation and stabilizing jobs. The initial focus is the depressed construction industry, and Secretary of Labor Ray Marshall is using as model a pilot project started in Chicago under the Nixon Adminis

title: The Best Steamed Crabs and Crab Cakes
description: BALTIMORE

title: Bridge:
description: In the earliest days of bridge, New Jersey was the headquarters of the game, with the Summer Nationals played in Asbury Park for 12 straight years. With the passage of Lime the Asbury Park Convention Hall became too small even for a regional championship.

title: Ruidoso Downs Strike Settled
description: RUIDOSO DOWNS, N. M., Aug. 23 (AP)  Officials at Ruidoso Downs quarterhorse track said today racing would resume tomorrow following settlement of a jockey walkout. A spokesman, Rick Shapiro, said the settlement came at a meeting last night involving the State Racing Commission chairman,. jockeys, the track's general manager and about 50 horsemen. Sunday's program was called off when jockeys decided not to ride, saying they felt the track was not safe at the first turn.

title: Collective Bargaining Board Backs Deferral of 6% Police Pay Rise in 76
description: The New York City Board of Collective Bargaining ruled yesterday that an arbitrator's recommendation for deferral of a 6 percent pay increase for the city's 18,000 police officers last year was proper and consistent with wage policy for all city employees.

title: 60 Minute Gourmet
description: COOKING well, like almost any profession or hobby, is to a great degree psychological. It has to do with aptitude, which implies a feeling security in what you are about. Many people are terrified of cooking because they have a mistaken notion that it is an impossibly exact science. They're afraid, so to speak, of fitting a round hole with a square peg. One of the best chicken dishes in the French repertoire is called poulet Vallee d'Auge, chicken in cream sauce, a celebrated dish of Normandy made with cutup chicken and vegetables and flavored with Calvados, the famed applejack of the region.

title: NADJARI IS RESTORED TO BALLOT IN QUEENS
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the controversial former special state prosecutor, was restored to the ballot as the Republican candidate for Queeas District Attorney by an appellate court yesterday.

title: Building of New Housing Units Rose 30% in the Second Quarter
description: Construction of new housing units in the second quarter of this year was up 30 percent from the comparable period last year, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported.

title: The Standings
description: Wednesday, August 24, 1977

title: Coast Colt Sold for $325,000
description: DEL MAR, Calif., Aug. 23 (UPI)A son of Shore was purchased yesterday for $325,000, more than three times the price paid for a yearling last year, at the annual sale held by the California Thoroughbred Breeders Association. The yearling was consigned by Albert Yank for Charles Wacker, a breeder. The colt was acquired for an Irish syndicate headed by Robert Sangster, who has bought the topselling yearlings at four sales this year.

title: Gardner Quits Rockefeller Fund, Citing Special Status
description: John W. Gardner has resigned as trustee of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund, citing deepening disagreements about the special status of the four senior Rockefeller brothers over other trustees lin deciding how the $209 million philanthropy distributes its funds.

title: Hugh A. Moran, 96, Minister and Author, Was Civic Leader
description: The Rev. Dr. Hugh A. Moran, a retired Presbyterian minister and author, died Monday at a nursing home in Wenatchee, Wash. He was 96 years old and a resident of Wenatchee.

title: Two Airlines Assail Bill for Deregulation
description: The chairmen of two of the nation's airlines strongly attacked yesterday a bill pending in Congress that would fundamentally alter the Government's regulation of the air carrier industry.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Around the Nation
description: CINCINNATI. Aug. 23 (AP)A judge's order for busing of an additional 900 black students in 28 elementary schools in Jefferson County, Ky., was upheld today by the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit.

title: Stockton, Tanner, Lutz U.S: Pro Tennis Winners
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 23 (UPI)Dick Stockton and Roscoe Tanner rolled to straightset victories today in firstround matches at the $125,000 United States Pro tennis championships at the Longwood Cricket Club.

title: U,S.BR1EF TO SUPPORT MINORITY ADMISSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23After extensive debate, the Carter Administration has decided to support the principle of affirmative action in education in a case before the Supreme Court that is expected to result in a landmark ruling.

title: Child's World
description: SUMMER is waning and the. first day of school is uncomfortably close. And there are one's offspring looking Like members of a particularly scruffy rock band The word haircut comes up frequently at the dinner table, with the usual But I like it this way reply.

title: Cosmos Rely On Chinaglia to Foil Lancers
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Aug. 23There is the saying in soccer that center forwards are paid to score goalsand Giorgio Chinaglia of the Cosmos certainly has earned his salary in the North American Soccer League playoffs.

title: Paper Bars HardCore Movie Ads
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 23 (AP)The Los Angeles Times announced today that it would no longer accept advertising for hardcore pornographic movies because the product was indefensible. The Times also began publication of a Family Film Guide, aimed at providing more assistance in film selection than is available in the industry's rating system.

title: Private Lives
description: THE CITY was behaviiig itself, as one hopes it will when a young woman is being shown around. The young woman had lived all of her 18 years in the boondocks. The city owed her something bagels. anectdotes, verticality, a zap to the synaptic cleft. With perfect composure, she rode a subway. Bloomingdale's did whatever Bloomingdale's does. So did the Village, that boutique of the counterculture. If, at a Mexican restaurant, the guitars were demented, at least there were no accordions. She was stunned by 'For Colored Girls Who Have Considered Suicide When the Rainbow Is Enuf. Had she not been, we would have mailed her home.

title: Oil and Gas Producers Charge Delays on Schedule of Leases
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (UPI)Associations of Oil and Natural Gas Producers charged today that the Interior Department delayed development of offshore resources with a new schedule of lease sales proposed for 197981.

title: Technology
description: Consolidated Edison is nearing completion of a $115 million upgrading of its New York power transmission network to make it more compact. The project includes an indoor substation and advanced techniques for insulating and cooling the transmission equipment. Page D5.

title: 40,319to1 Shot Clicks
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Aug. 23 (AP)The second race at Monticello Raceway went by the numbers tonight, thus beating mathematical odds of 40,319 to 1 against eight horses finishing as they were listed in the program.

title: About Real Estate
description: William Torres is to be found these days at a desk at the rear of the Washington Heights Sewing Center on St. Nicholas Avenue, a block from the humming West 181st Street shopping huh.

title: Pentagon Shipping Changes Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 23 (Reuters)An auditing agency called today for an overhaul of Defense Department billing practices to recover millions of dollars in costs of shipping military supplies to foreign governments. The General Accounting Office said in a report to Congress that the United States loses millions of dollars by not recovering the full costs of crating and delivering supplies ranging from Army boots to sophisticated F5 aircraft under the foreign military sales program.

title: Concert: Firkusny A Master of Mozart
description: RUDOLF FIRKUSNY is an OldWorld craftsman of a pianist. The Czechborn artist does not try to astonish with his scales and arpeggios, although his technique is of an extremely high order. He plays meticulously and his approach to the piano is that of a master who respects his tools. He doei not bang away or strike attitudes. He simply plays as well as he can, and that is very well indeed.

title: GIGANTE IS SUBJECT OF A STATE INQUIRY
description: The Rev. Louis R. Gigante, who represents the South Bronx and East Harlem on the New York City Council, has been called to testify before a special grand jury about his relationship with a reputed Mafia figure, James V. Napoli Sr.

title: People in Sports
description: Bobby Locke, a South African who won the British Open four times, was one of four men inducted yesterday into the World Golf Hall of Fame. The others honored were the late John Ball, a turn of the century British player; the late Donald Ross, a golfcourse architect, and Herb Graffis, a journalist, bringing the Hall of Fame member hip to 30. Locke, 60 years old, and Graffis, 84, were present at the induction ceremonies at Pinehurst, N.C. Ball, considered to be England's finest amateur, became the first nonprofessional to win the British Open in 1890. He won the British Amateur a record eight times between 1888 and 1912.

title: CANADIAN DEFENSE OF GULF DISCOUNTED BY REP. MOSS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (AP)The Canadian Government's defense of the Gulf Oil Corporation's participation in uranium pricefixing cartel fails to take Gulf off the hook or its actions, the chairman of a House investigating panel said today:

title: SOUTH AFRICA TELLS U.S. IT DOESN'T PLAN ANY NUCLEAR TESTING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23  President Carter said today that South Africa had informed the United States that it had no nuclear weapons and did not intend to conduct any nuclear tests now or in the future.

title: ES,BRIEF TO SUPPORT MINORITY ADMISSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23After extensive debate, the Carter Administration has decided to support the principle of affirmative action in education in a case before the Supreme Cc.rt that is expected to result in a landmark ruling.

title: RCA Introduces Video Cassette Recorder For $300 Less Than Sony Competitor
description: The RCA Corporation unveiled yesterday a $1,000 consumer video cassette recorder, thus coming in with a price $300 below that of its main competitor.

title: Why They Mourned For Elvis Presley
description: MEMPHIS

title: Between Xenophon and Schlesinger
description: VAN, Turkey  Turkey's equivalent of James Schlesinger, newest United States cabinet secretary, is Kamran Inan, 47yearold Minister of Energy and rising star of Prime Minister Suleyman Demirel's Justice Party which dominates the present government.

title: FUROR ABOUT EXNAZI IS PUZZLING GERMANS
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 23When the news came last week that 70yearold Herbert Kappler, the onetime Nazi police chief of Rome. had vanished from an Italian military hospital, many West Germans asked. Herbert who?

title: Events Today
COAST GUARD SEEKINV SHIP THAT SPILLED OIL
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 23Samples 0 the fuel oil that washed up here and e; Briganine Beach have been caren111. stowed under lock and key and Coi! Guard boarding parties are combing Eas ern ports and refinery docks in search o the vessel that discharged the fuel.

title: Ailey Dancers to Open at City Center Nov. 30
description: The Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater will appear in a threeweek season at the City Center 55th Street Theater from Nov. 30 through Dec. 18. The season will be its 20th since the original company of seven dancers, formed in 1958 when Mr. Ailey was appearing in the Broadway musical Jamaica, gave a single performance at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. Now a company of 26 dancers, the Ailey troupe recently completed a world tour.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: State police are investigating charges that members of the New Jersey Racing Commission have accepted special favors and kickbacks in connection with their jobs. Charles Carella, commission chairman, confirmed that the inquiry was launched about a year ago.

title: Letter &
description: To the Editor:

title: A Chief Gandhi Adviser Arrested On Charge of Misusing Party Cash
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 23Indira Gandhi's defense minister, who was one of the two or three most important people in her government, was arrested today on charges of having misappropriated political party funds.

title: IDS REALTY TRUST GETS RESCUE PLAN
description: Investors Diversified Services Inc. offered a plan yesterday to bolster the finances of the troubled IDS Realty Trust through a tender offer for some of IDS Realty Trust's subordinated debentures

title: Notes on People
description: T. HE LAST of the Watergate burglars still in jail, G. Gordon Liddy, has been moved from a Federal prison in Pennsylvania to one in Connecticut because of his part in a cafeteria boycott last week, and his scheduled Sept. 6 parole may be in eopardy. Mr. Liddy had been at the prison farm in Allenwood, Pa., for a year, and Saturday, when the sixday food boycott ended, he was moved to the nearby maximum security Lewisburg prison. Late Monday, he was transferred by car with five other leaders of the boycott, to the medium security prison at Danbury, Conn. The six are suspected of intimidating others during the boycott, said L. R. Allen superintendent Allenwood. report on Mr. Liddy's involvement will be sent to the Federal Parole Board, which fixed his release date in July and which could hold up his parole under terms of the Federal crime code.

title: CensusReform Bill Is Endorsed by Camden's Mayor
description: CAMDEN, Aug. 23Mayor Angelo J. Errichetti said today that the proposed censusreform act, introduced in the House of Representatives on Aug. 5 and scheduled for hearings in Washington on Sept. 12, was a vindication of this city's continuing battle with the Census Bureau.

title: Internal Audit of New York City Government Units Finds That Fiscal Gimmicks Are Still Being Used
description: An internal New York City audit has found that despite efforts to tighten budgeting and accounting procedures, city agencies are still using fiscal gimmicks to protect their appropriations by overstating the amount of money they actually spend.

title: CARTER AGAIN BACKS LANCE BUT QUESTIONS SOME BANKING RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23  President Caner reiterated today his ardent endorsement of his old friend, Bert Lance, director of the Office of Management and Budget, who he said had handled his business affairs consistent with common banking practices. But the President also questioned the propriety of traditional banking practices and the efficacy of curnent banking regulations.

title: I.T.U. Head Won't Run in 78
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 23A. Sandy Bevis, president of the International Typographical Union since 1974, announced today that he would not be a candidate for reelection in 1978. He made the announcement at the union's annual convention, which is being held here. He attributed his decision to personal reasons. He is member of Local 226 in Vancouver, B.C.

title: Speech by Carter Expected by British
description: LONDON, Aug. 23A draft of a speech that President Carter is expected to deliver on the Northern Ireland problem in the next few days has been seen by British officials, a Foreign Office spokesman said tonight.

title: 10 Killed on Bus in Sao Paulo
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Aug 23 (Reuters)A train crashed into a commuter bus at a level crossing on the outskirts of this city today, killing 18 persons and injuring 10, the police said. All the victims were on the bus, which was carrying office workers and university students.

title: Zambia Sues 17 Big Oil Companies
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Aug. 23 (AP)The Zambian Government yesterday issued summonses against 17 Western oil companies it is suing for nearly $6.4 billion damages for allegedly supplying Rhodesia with oil in defiance of United Nations sanctions and to the detriment of Zambia.

title: Personal Health
description: WHILE millions of Americans toss and turn and desperately try to sleep each night, countless others face just the opposi e problemthey are unable to wake up and stay awake through a normal day. Many of us enjoy a refreshing catnap now and then, but for these people frequent daytime lapses into unconsciousness are an unavoidable plague that causes them intense embarrassment and can virtually destroy their lives.

title: Mary Kine Coolidge Toerge, Cousin Of President Calvin Coolidge, 44
description: Mary King Coolidge Toerge, a cousin of former President Calvin Coolidge, died of a heart attack on Friday at her home in Hilton Head, S.C. She was 44 years old and lived in Hilton Head.

title: Displaced Maronites in Israel Yearn to Return Home
description: GUSHHALAV, IsraelAyoub Mtanes, his family and friends laughed with embarrassment when they were asked the first thing they would do if Prime Minister Menaham Begin went through with his plan to fulfill their hopes of 29 years.

title: Jazz: Tex Allen Rides Tall
description: WHEN THE JAZZ quintet that Tex Allen brought into Sweet Basil, Seventh Avenue at Bleecker Street, on Monday evening, settled doirn to business, it turned up the kind of driving, posthop elation that one associates with Horace Silver. The front line of Mr. Allen on trumpet and Charles Davis ontenor saxophone joined in crisp, cutting, Silver voicings while an unusually strong rhythm sectionBob Sardo, pianist; Walter Booker, bassist, and Mike Carbin, drummerboiled and bristled behind them.

title: Against Cravenly Yielding to Peking; If we gained little from pushing Taiwan overboard, what would we lose? Well, selfrespect, for one thing.
description: Were Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance to agree in Peking that the United States would break relations with the Nationalist Government in Taiwan in return for de jure relations with the People's Republic, he would make nonsense of the Carter Administration's commitment to morality in foreign policy. Yet some academic Chinawatchers, amateurs of realpolitik, now advocate that cynical course on the ground that the normalization of relations with Peking (which involves the denormalization of relations with Taiwan) is necessary to sustain a PekingWashington counter to Soviet expansionism.

title: Soviet Zco
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 23 (AP)The official press agency, Tass, said today that a Soviet biological satellite packed with test animals had returned to earth. The satellite, described as a zoo in orbit, was launched Aug. 3 on a flight designed to study methods of protecting humans from adverse effects of prolonged space flight, the agency said.

title: BombRich Uranium Reported Lost
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (AP)The Energy Research and Development Administration has disclosed that enough uranium for at least 10 nuclear weapons was lost', in the early 1960's, The Washington Star said today.

title: Hardholders East Capture HighPower Rifle Crown
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 23 (UPI) The Hardholders East captured the team championship at the national highpower rifle championship today by setting a national championship record.

title: McDermott Tops Own Offer In Bid to'Acquire Babcock
description: The battle between J. Ray McDermott & Company Inc. and the United Technologies Corporation for control of Babcock & Wilcox Inc. escalated again yesterday.

title: SOUTH AFRICA TELLS U.S IT DOESN'T PLAN ANY NUCLEAR TESTING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23  President Carter said today that South Africa had informed the United States that it had no nuclear weapons and did not intend to conduct any nuclear tests now or in the future.

title: Aeros Are Not Satisfied With Offer for Howes
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 23 (UPI)  The Houston Aeros of the World Hockey Association said today that the New England Whalers offers of compensation for Gordie, Mark and Marty Howe would not suffice.

title: GOV. MANDEL GUILTY ON CHARGES OF FRAUD AND RACKETEERING
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 23Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland and five of his wealthy business friends were convicted today of 18 counts each of mail fraud and racketeering after what experts said was one of the longest Federal jurj deliberations in history.

title: N. C.A.A. Olympic Move?
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn, Aug. 23The National Collegiate Athletic Association has called a news conference for tomorrow morning amid speculation that it will rejoin the United States Olympic Committee.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: In a surprise announcement at a City Hall ceremony yesterday to proclaim Harlem Day, the Carter Administration presented the community with two economic development grants totaling $7 million. Of this amount, $5 million is to be used for renovating Harlem Hospital.

title: Lebanese Christians and Moslems Join in Effort to Bar New Fighting
description: BEIRUT. Lebanon, Aug. 23  A joint ChristianMoslem committee was formed today in an attempt to prevent a recurrence of fighting between the two communities in a mountain district southeast of here.

title: North Is Replaced At Enterprise Helm
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 23The ax fell on Lowell North today at the America's Cup trials. The 47yearold sailmaker from San Diego was replaced as the skipper of Enterprise, the new American yacht that has been so disappointing against the other candidates for defense of yachting's premier prize.

title: Those Who Stayed Help Taos Mellow
description: TAOS, N.M.

title: Major League Box Scores
Andrews Captures Hurdles, Anchors U.S. Rela y Victory
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Aug. 23 (AP)Tom Andrews of Los Angeles, performing both as a hurdler and a runner, won two gold medals for the United States tonight in the World University Games.

title: About Education
description: A 14year decline in the Scholastic Aptitude Test scores is largely a result of an increasing number of minorities, poor, women and academically inferior students applying for college entrance and the inability of American schools to handle the special needs of these students, according to a study panel appointed by the College Entrance Examination Board.

title: SMALL AIRLINES CITE T.W.A. ON DISCOUNTS
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 23A House subcommittee looking into the deregulation of airlines heard testimony yesterday that Trans World Airlines adopted its version of Supersaver discount fares in an effort to diffuse competition from charter operators, even if it meant operating under the new fares at a financial loss.

title: $10 Million in Marijuana Burned
description: NEWPORT. R.I., Aug. 23 (UPI)Workers began today throwing nearly six tons of highgrade Colombian marijuana, worth an estimated $10 million, into Navy incinerator as four policemen stood nearby with submachine guns. The marijuana was found last week in a police raid on a Warwick house.

title: Carter, Panama And China
description: It is clear from President Carter's latest press conference that he still doesn't get the point of so many people who wish him well but still criticize some of his recent actions.

title: U.S IS SEEKING WAYS TO ASSIST IN ULSTER
description: DUBLINThe United States is quietly looking for ways in which it might help to end the carnage in Northern Ireland. Btit in doing so it has touched off an astonishing series of rumors and raised hopes that American officials consider foolish.

title: Peking These Days Is Like a Vast Rose Bowl Parade With Firecrackers
description: PEKING, Aug. 23In Peking, politics and parades start when the rooster crows, at 5:30 A.M.

title: Mike Fishbach's Racquet in Class by Itself
description: Mike Fishbach is back from the $215,000 American Express satellite circuit with a weird racquet. It has loose, dangling strings that seem to catch the ball and hurl it across the net like a slingshot with tremendous spin.

title: Latin Bloc Approves Coffee Cartel Plan
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug, 23 (AP)Eleven Latin American coffeeproducing nations, including Brazil, the world's largest grower, have approved a Mexican plan to establish a cartel to regulate the world price of coffee.

title: FramptonThe Nice Guy of Rock?
description: PETER FRAMPTON's nage recent success and his general lack of critical support are generally taken by his admirers e the irrelevance of critics. Perhaps o. but success in itself hardly constitutes a certification of Mr. Framoton's own relevance, except in the most ::mited sociological terms. Still, 3ritish rocker's soldout appearance a: Madison Square Garden Monday night. the first of three there. indicrea that he may be finding a more realistic, longerlasting niche in the popmusic hierarchy than the absurdly inflated Sales success of his Frampton Comes Alive double album suggested.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Letters
description: On the Moped Industry

title: Yanks Win, 83
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 23Five singles by Mickey Rivers, a threerun homer by Graig Nettles and the seventh straight completegame victory pitched by Mike Torrez brought the New York Yankees an 83 decision over the Chicago White Sox tonight and sent them flying home in first place in the American League's Eastern Division by half a game.

title: Queens District Attorney Urges Board Turn Down Parole of Alice Crimmins
description: The Queens District Attorney. John J. Santucci, yesterday asked the New York State Parole Board to reject Alice Crimmins's request for parole and also to remove her from the workrelease program in which she is not confined on weekends.

title: PACIFIC EXCHANGE AND BIG BOARD AGREE ON A TRADING LINK
description: The New York Stock Exchange and the Pacific Stock Exchange said yesterday that they had tentatively agreed to an electronic link between their trading floors that would enable members of either exchange to shop both markets simultaneously for the best prevailing price.

title: Best Buys
description: HIGHER prices for meats and grains sent the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City to a record level last week, according to the City Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: World News Briefs
description: COLOMBO. Sri Lanka, Aug. 23 (UPI) More than 500 people have been arrested in communal fighting that has killed scores of people in the last week, the police said today.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 24, 1977

title: Militant Moslems on Trial in Cairo
description: CAIRO, Aug. 234 group of Moslem exteremists pleaded not guilty today to the kidnapping and. murder of a former cabinet minister as well as other terrorist acts and accused security authorities of mistreatment and torture.

title: The Daily American, Rome Paper Founded After World War, Closes
description: ROME, Aug. 23 (Reuters)The Daily American, an Englishlanguage newspaper founded by three G.I.'s after World War II, closed today after strikes and law suits had prevented its publication for more than a month.

title: A Teaser on Tea, With a Footnote on Bags
description: Tea. For you and me. Because God, in His infinite wisdom. saw fit to raise up coffee to the heavens. To price for the pocketbook of the celestial spender. To take it away from cigarette smokers. Whoever it was He meant to punish, it's surely a theological question now, and I don't want to get into it.

title: Money
description: Tuesday, August 23, 1977

title: Head of S.E.C. Accuses Beame Of Subterfuge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23The chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, Harold M. Williams, accused Mayor .Beame today of unfounded attacks reflecting on the commission's integrity in order to further the Mayor's campaign for reelection. He said that the Mayor, for partisan political purposes, was trying to misconstrue a meaningful effort by the commission to investigate impartially the city's financial difficulties.

title: 4 EPISCOPAL PARISHES BREAK FROM CHURCH
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 23Dissent over the ordination of women priests has caused four parishes here to break from the Episcopal Church, and the Episcopal Diocese of Los Angeles has responded by deposing five priests and suing the parishes for the return of church property.

title: Hicks Stumbling Block on Giants
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 23Coach John McVay was lecturing about overachievers and underachievers today at the Giants camp because John Hicks's name was mentioned.

title: A Chief Gandhi Adviser Arrested On Charge of Misusing Party Cash
description: NEW DELHI,Aug. 23Indira Gandhi's defense minister, who was one of the two or three most important people in her government, was arrested today on charges of having misappropriated political party funds.

title: Deere Earnings Increase by 1.6% On 13.7% Sales Rise in 3d Quarter
description: Deere & Company, a leading manufac turer of farm and industrial machinery showed a 1.6 percent earnings gain in the third fiscal quarter ended July 31 on a sales jump of 13.7 percent.

title: California Team Prevails In Little League Game
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 23 (AP)John Osborne hit a homer run, fired a threehitter and struck out 15 today powering El Cajon, Calif., to a 31 victory over Hattiesburg, Miss., in the opening round of the Little League world series.

title: Consumer Group and Labor Union Urge Federal Curbs on a Pesticide
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 23  Use of chemical pesticide widely employed in !both household gardening and farming was attacked today by a labor union and a consumers group because of reports linking the compound to sterility in men and cancer and birth defects in animals.

title: Crab: Bounty From the Deep
description: CRISFIELD, MD.

title: Advertising
description: The most recent survey of cocktail mixes by the National Retail Tracking Index shows that Holland House has the largest supermarket distribution in the category. But there is still more than enough room to enlarge the company's salesand that's what its new agency, Levine, Huntley, Schmidt, Plapler & Beaver Inc., has in mind with a fall print ad campaign.

title: Text of Letter to Beame by S.E.C. Chairman
description: This is in response to your letter, date. Aug. 20, 1977, which states that the participation of a member of the commission's staffRobert J. Haftin the commission's investigation of transactions in securities issued by the City of New York clouds [the staff's investigative] report in the pall of local partisan politics. Although your letter states that you do not wish to impugn Mr. Haft's personal integrity ... your comments at a subsequent press conference go well beyond the statements in your letter, reflecting not only on his integrity, but on the commission's well.

title: Complex in Cobble Hill Will Be Restored
description: Time and vandalism have eaten away at the intricate wrought iron gates, ornate brick corbeling and masonry archways that were once the glory of the Cobble Hill section of Brooklyn, making the 100yearold complex an albatross in this landmark district.

title: Beanie, Mrs. Abzug Lead in Poll; Cuomo, Koch in Striking Distance
description: With the Democratic mayoral primary only two weeks away, Mayor Beanie and Bella S. Abzug are running neck and neck for the lead, but two other candidates, Mario M. Cuomo and Representative Edward I. Koch, are in a strong enough position to catch up with either or both, according to the New York Times/Channel 2 News (WCBSTV) survey of registered and likely Democratic voters.

title: The Yawns Of August
description: WEST TISBURY, Mass.Andrew L. is a Blueberry/Blackberry/Huckleberry Bore. When guests come to dinned, he says, It took me 20 minutes to pick each mouthful of berries you eat! He wants company on his picking expeditions in the wild. When 7yearold came along and her interest faded after 10 minutes, he said, Just tell me a story. He said that for two hours.

title: F.P.C. to Allow Rise For Some Gas Imports
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (Reuters)The Federal Power Commission today confirmed that on July 27 it allowed sharp increases in the price three gas companies may pay for liquefied natural as imported from Algeria.

title: Displaced Maronites in Israel Yearn to Return Home
description: GUSHHALAV, IsraelAyoub Mtanes, his family and friends laughed with embarrassment when they were asked the first thing they would do if Prime Minister Menaham Begin went through with his plan fulfill their hopes of 29 years.

title: Worst Fires in West in Years Bring Wartime Urgency to Idaho Center
description: BOISE, Idaho, Aug. 23A visitor to the Federal Interagency Fire Center here might easily think he had wandered into a military staging area close to the front lines of a raging battle, and he would not be far from wrong. This is the place from which the Government is directing its war against the forest fires that have ravaged the western United States and Alaska this summer.

title: Salvatore Latorre, 58, the Warden Of the Queens House of Detention
description: Salvatore Latorre, warden of the Queens House of Detention for Men in Kew Gardens since 1974, died Monday night of leukemia in the SloanKettering Memorial Hospital. He was 58 years old and lived in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Average G . M. Car To Cost 5.7% More
description: DETROIT, Aug. 23  The General Motors Corporation announced today that the average retail price of a 1978model passenger car, including optional equipment typically purchased by consumers, would rise by 5.7 percent, or $387 a car.

title: FIRE DEPARTMENT NAMES WOMAN TO HEAD BUREAU
description: Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan yesterday selected a woman to head the department's new Bureau of Personnel. She is Anne Pol, a department management Specialist, whose appointment as acting director of personnel marks the first time a woman has been named to so high a Fire Department post.

title: Saratoga Racing
description: RESULTS

title: Carter Scored on Arts Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (UPI)Louis Harris, the publicopinion polltaker and chairman of the American Council for the Arts, urged the Carter Administration today to match its positive talk about supporting the arts with actionand listed six grievances by artists against the Government.

title: GOV. MANDEL GUILTY ON CHARGES OF FRAUD AND RACKETEERING
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 23Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland and five of his wealthy business friends were convicted today of some 18 counts each of mail fraud and racketeering after what experts said was one of the longest Federal jury deliberations in history.

title: BERKOWITZ CHARGED IN QUEENS MURDERS
description: David Richard Berkowitz, clad in hospitalgreen pajamas and a blue bathrobe, pleaded not guilty yesterday to two murders and seven attempted murders in Queens in his second arraignment in the last week.

title: Deaths
TV: Paying to Talk Back to the Cyclops
description: MR AND MRS. COLUMBUS sit on the sofa weighing the decision of what to watch. On the wife's lap is a sleek black unit resembling an oversize pocket calculator that contains 30 white buttons for 30 channel choices.

title: Rock: Heart Rises To Gala Occasion
description: THE fates haven't been entirely kind to Heart in the last year. The rock band from Seattle has, admittedly, been propelled into the front rank on the basis of two top10 albums. But the rush of success and the grind of touring have led to some strain within the hand and problems without, above all a nasty legal battle as the group switched record labels.

title: CARDIAC PACEMAKERS SUED BY MEDTRONIC
description: Medtronic Inc., the world's largest producer of heart pacemakers, yesterday took legal action in Minneapolis to keep its trade secrets from a smaller rival.

title: Wine Talk
description: POMONA, CALIF.

title: United Airlines Sets $7 Million Ad Drive
description: United Airlines, whose friendly skies has long been the airline industry's bestknown slogan, will begin a $7millionplus fourmonth advertising campaign immediately after Labor Day. We're going to give the friendly skies a new dimension in size and stature, said Fred W. Heckel!! the company's vice presidentadvertising promotion.

title: Primary Roundup
description: Representative Edward I. Koch has received the endorsement of The Daily News as, Democratic mayoral candidate wo can do most for the city, giving him the backing of two of the three major newspapers in the city.

title: Cabaret: Billy Daniels
description: BILLY DANIELS concedes that he has been doing this sort of foolishnesshis slightly tongueincheek, sly, rhythmic and highly theatrical approach to singingfor 44 years. But at Hopper's, Avenue of the Americas at 11th Street, where he is appearing this week and next, he seems ageless despite his selfdeprecating comments on his declining romantic prowess, his listing by age and occupation of a startlingly long list of children and grandchildren and the use of a silvergray toupee.

title: Brazilian Students Clash With Police In Several Cities
description: SAO PAULO. Brazil, Aug. 3 (AP)Thousands of policemen using dogs and tear gas battled thousands of students shouting Down with the military regime today in San Paulo's downtown area.

title: SCHOOL GROUPS PROTEST PLANS TO OPEN ON SEPT. 8
description: Several officials of the Community School Boards Association have called on Governor Carey to investigate what they say is a deal to have classes in New York City public schools start on Sept. 8 instead of Sept. 15.

title: Sovit Teachers, In Buffalo Visit, Are Impressive And Learn, Too
description: BUFFALOA group of 37 Soviet teachers just completed a twomonth summer training session at the State University here and by most counts it was a most successful invasion. The teachers returned to the Soviet Union this week.

title: U.S..Expected to Fight Disclosure Of F.B.I. Data in ExAgent's Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23Justice Department lawyers are expected to ask Federal judge in New York to modify or dissolve a sweeping order that would require the Government to produce records of all warrantless wiretaps, mail openings and breakins by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents between 1947 and 1972, sources said today.

title: Electrical Failure On L.I.R.R. Delays Several Thousand
description: Several thousand passengers were stranded up to 2 hours at Pennsyvania Station last night and early today after a Long Island Rail Road train, scheduled to leave at 10:32 P.M. for Babylon broke down in a tunnel under First Avenue.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, AUGUST 23, 1977

title: Companies Issue Earnings Reports
West Berlin Mayor Says Carter Gave Pledge on Factory
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23  Dietrich Stobbe, the new Mayor of West Berlin, says he has found a friend in President Carter, who has promised him help in getting a big American automotive plant for the isolated city.

title: Typhoon Kills Two in Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 23 (Reuters)Two people have died and another is missing after a typhoon struck southern Taiwan yesterday, the police reported today. The storm, designated Amy, the second typhoon in a month to hit southern Taiwan, faded out after passing the Kaohsiung area.

title: Wright, Ulozas Share Met. Open Lead
description: JERICHO, Li, Aug. 23A charm of golf is that the player is the referee of his own game in all but the relatively few major tournaments. It is the player who must call rulings against himself when no official is easily at hand, as is the case in most tournaments throughout the world.

title: Dollar Is Mixed in Europe Trading
description: The dollar meandered in slow trading on foreign exchange markets yesterday as traders awaited tomorrow's announcement of United States trade figures for July, which are expected to be poor, The Associated Press reported.

title: Kitchen Space: Two Inventive Solutions
description: The current movement to reinstate the kitchen as a focal point of the home and a room in which one would welcome, and even serve, guests is a trend New Yorkers find difficult to follow. Since World War H, developers in the city have looked to the kitchen as a place to conserve space, resulting in perplexing, challenging layouts. An eatin kitchen is still a boon.

title: TEST SEEKS TO EASE ASBESTOS EFFECTS
description: LYNDHURST, Aug. 23  Workmen dressed in special protective clothing started encasing parts of three New Jersey schools in plastic sheeting today in the first stage of a test program to remove or seal ceilings covered with potentially hazardous asbestos.

title: United Press International
description: WHISTLING A FOREIGN TOOT: The American Freedom Train, which logged over 25,000 miles in a 21month Bicentennial tour of the U.S., pulling out of Cameron Station in Alexandria, Va., to become the property

title: A Personal Rebirth of Sorts
description: EVER SINCE that Star Is Born pietime, said Kris Kristofferson's manager, on the morning when an unidentified flying fan very nearly forced her way into the singer and actor's bedroom at 10:30 A.M. At midafternoon, in their motel near,a turnpike near Philadelphia. the performer and his wife of four years, Rita Coolidge, were still fuming over the incident.

title: Bateman Makes Bid for Support Deep in Territory of. Democrats
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 23State Senator Raymond H. Bateman of Somerville, the Republican candidate for Governor, met today with the Mayors of Hudson County's two largest municipalities in an effort to garner their support in this predominantly Democratic area.

title: Rumors, Not Bombs in South Africa
description: Fox a while, over the past several days, it seemed as if the South African government would add the heat of nuclear threats to the racial tinderbox in its part of the world. So it was welcome news indeed that President Carter brought to his news conference yesterdaySouth Africa had assured him it would not develop nuclear explosives for any purpose.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 23Following is a transcript of President Carter's news conference this afternoon as recorded by The. New York Times through the facilities of ABC News:

title: Key Variable in Polls Is Who's in 2d Place
description: Polls as a weaponto lure contributons, to persuade supporters of other candidates to defect, to give an illusion of momentum  have emerged from time to time in the Democratic mayoral politicking.

title: Technology
description: A virtually invisible upgrading of the Consolidated Edison Company's power transmission network beneath the streets of New York, at a cost of $115 million. is nearing completion.

title: Average G. M. Car. To Cost 5.7% More
description: DETROIT, Aug. 23  The General Motors Corporation announced today that the average retail price of a 1978model passenger car, including optional equipment typically purchased by consumers, would rise by 5.7 percent, or $387 a car.

title: CARTER AGAIN BACKS LANCE BUT QUESTIONS SOME BANKING RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23  President Carter reiterated today his ardent endorsement of his old friend, Bert Lance, director of the Office of Management and Budget, who he said had handled his business affairs consistent with common banking practices. But the President also questioned the propriety of traditional banking practices and the efficacy of current banking regulations.

title: Market Place
description: Where is that selling climax Wall Street is looking for? According to a widely accepted theory, the stock market cannot recover its bearings and begin a major advance until there is heavy selling and rapidly declining prices capped by a dramatic recovery all in the same day.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Elementary, My Dear

title: Chess:
description: MONTILLA BAY, Spain, Aug. 20Afier four rounds of the Torneo del Vino here in the Don Gonzalo Hotel, International Master Michael Stean of England held the lead with 31i; points.

title: Brock's 889th Stolen Base Features Cards
description: Lou Brock stole the 889th base and collected the 2,800th hit of his career in pacing the St. Louis Cardinals to a 21 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers last night in Busch Stadium.

title: News Sunimary
description: International

title: Public Advocate Calls for Reforms In Electric Utilities
description: TRENTON, Aug. 23Public hearings on an energy master plan for New Jersey opened today, with the state's Public Advocate proposing drastic reforms of electricity rates and an end to the practice by utilities of automatically adding fuel costs to consumer bills.

title: Hagler Knocks Out Monroe
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 23 (AP)Marvin Hagler of Brockton, Mass., scored a secondround knockout over Willie (the Worm) Monroe of Philadelphia tonight in a scheduled 12round middleweight fight at the Spectrum.

title: SEBASTIAN CABOT, 59; A CHARACTER ACTOR
description: Sebastian Cabot, an actor known for his courtly English manner, full beard and rotund figure, died yesterday after having suffered a stroke at his home near Victoria, British Columbia. He was 59 years old and also had a home in Los Angeles.

title: Reagan Vows to Defeat Canal Pact If Carter's View Is Unconvincing
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 23Ronald Reagan vowed today to do everything I can to defeat a new Panama Canal treaty unless the Carter Administration convinces him that the pact would prevent a sudden Panamanian takeover of the canal.

title: Naum Gabo, Sculptor, Dies at 87
description: Naum Gabo, the Russianborn sculptor who pioneered the Constructivist moveb ent in art, died of cancer yesterday in Waterbury (Conn.) Hospital. He was 87 years old and had been an American citizen since 1952.

title: Recipes to Put Crab on the Table
description: Broiled Maryland Crab Cakes

title: Police Deny Making A Pornographic Film
description: A Police Department official denied yesterday that the department had produced a motion picture portraying explicit sexual acts in an effort to infiltrate the pornographic film industry.

title: SOYBEANS ADVANCE 41N LATE SPECULATION
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 23 (AP)A late spurt of speculative buying lifted soybean fu tures abaft 5 cents on the Chicago Board ! of Trade, finishing a session of stagnant Drices.

title: Suit by S.E.C. Charges Toichin Filed False Financial Statements
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission began action yesterday against Tolchin Instruments Inc. and two officers of the company for allegedly filing false financial statements with the S.E.C. for the years 196975.

title: In Memoriam
description: BROOKSLewis, M.D. August 24, 1969. You are with me always. May you rest In peace, dear son. Mother. MINTZHarry. In loving memory of our devoted father.

title: Books: Joy Of Reading Wilde's Wit
description: OSCAR WILDE was one of that rare breed who write as well as they talkwhich in Wilde's case was very brilliantly indeed. In his biography of the Irishborn writer, a volume in Little. Brown's Library of World Biography, Louis Kronenberger ranks Wilde with Samuel Johnson as the two greatest exponents of the art of conversation in the Englishspeaking worldand Wilde was surely the wittier.

title: Define the Needs, Then Do Design
description: Defining the needs of the Individual is primary, according to Florence Perchuk, a certified kitchen designer with SVP Kitchen and Bath Designers Inc. of New York. She said she believed the foundation of a wellfunctioning and pleasing kitchen depends on:

title: Sears Net Is Up 51.1%,Reflecting Allstate's Gains
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company, the world's largest retailer of general merchandise, reported yesterday a 51.1 percent increase in secondquarter net income, reflecting primarily sharp gains of its Allstate Insurance subsidiary.

title: Vorster Unequivocally Denies Nuclear Arms Program
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 23  Prime Minister John Vorster denied tonight that South Africa was planning to develop nuclear weapons, saying that he can't help smiling when such allegations were made by people who only a few years ago doubted that South African scientists were capable of enriching uranium.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Negotiators for Brookdale Medical Center in Brooklyn and for hundreds of nurses striking the facility reached tentative settlement on a new contract last night, after an allday bargaining session.

title: CBS Radio to Scan 50 Years
description: ON SEPT. 18, 1927, the second of the national radio networks went on the air, broadcasting to 16 stations reaching as far west as St. Louis. Owned by United Independent Broadcasters Inc., it was a frail competitor to the first of the networks, NBC, and went on the air as the Columbia Phonograph Broadcasting System.

title: Article 6  No Title
Heck Takes 5,000 Race
description: Paul Heck, a recent graduate of Columbia University, won the Manufac turers Hanover 5,000meter (3mile) race in Central Park last night with a time of 16 minutes 56 seconds.

title: Hiram Walker's Whisky Hunt
description: For 10 years, Hiram Walker Inc. has been burying cases of its Canadian Club whisky as part of a continuing adventure series campaign. With the 12th burial having taken place recently in the Thousand Islands region, ads prepared by McCaffrey & McCall will be placed in 13 national magazines during September and October giving instructions on how to retrieve the case.

title: Washington &
description: WASHINGTON  Few Government agencies this side of the K.G.B. have stirred images more forbidding than the small (less than $200 million a year in budget), new (operational in 1971), Federal entity with the long name (Occupational Safety and Health, Administration) and familiar acronym (OSHA).

title: Promises, Promises in Manila
description: A year ago, just before bankers and officials of 131 countries gathered in Manila for the annual conference of the International Monetary Fund, President Marcos announced plans for the election of a Philippine national legislature by March 1977. That election is still awaited, as oneman rule under martial law approaches its fifth anniversary. But now Mr. Marcos has offered a new promisean elected assembly for I978this time just as lawyers and judges from more than 100 countries assembled for the eighth World Peace Through Law Conference.

title: Yankees Trounce Twins, 111, With a Barrage of 4 Homers
description: As Gene Mauch watched a heavy rain pelt the blue tarpaulin covering the Yankee Stadium infield before last night's game with the Yankees, he noted that his Minnesota Twins had not been rained out in 126 games this season.

title: Westchester Opens Arts Project
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Aug. 24The ceremony could have been a scene from the Great Depression of the 1930's, but the W.P.A. doing the hiring today in the public library here was called Westchester's Partners in the Artsnot the Works Progress Administration.

title: Beer a Day May Keep Heart Attacks Away
description: BOSTON, Aug. 24 (AP)A new study has found that deaths from heart disease are almost twice as common among teetotalers as among men who down one or two beers a day. The report also found no link between coffee drinking and heart disease.

title: Acid Thrown on Rubens Work
description: DUSSELDORF, West Germany, Aug. 24 (Reuters)A vandal threw acid over a Rubens painting in the city art gallery here today, police officials said. The painting, a portrait of the Archduke Albrecht of Austria painted by the Flemish master in 1610, suffered damage estimated by the museum director at several hundred thousand dollars.

title: Events Today
description: Films

title: RABBI ABRAHAM SIMON
description: Araham Smon who retired two years ago as a rabbi at Congregation Rodfei Zedek in Chicago, died there at Michael Reese Hospital in Chicago. He was 67 yparg old.

title: The Garden's Mysterious Lone star
description: FIRE ISLAND. L. I.

title: National Stock Exchange Talks Will Be Extended in Chicago
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 24 (AP)Five regional stock exchanges agreed to continue discussions on establishing the first computerized national stock exchange after meeting in Chicago today.

title: Daily U.S. Auto Sates Rose 17.1% In MidAugust for Another Record
description: DETROIT, Aug. 24The pace of domestic newcar sales continued at record levels in midAugust as industry analysts continued to predict that 1977 would be among the best sales years of the decade.

title: In Memoriam
description: KAPLANIsidor. In our hearts forever. Ida, Norma, Georgia, Marianne.

title: Soybeans, Corn and Wheat Rise As Lumber and Pork Bellies Fall
description: Continued buying of soybeans by commercial interests, a group that includes exporters, attracted speculators to the bean pit yesterday. As a result, soybean futures rose 7 to 12 cents a bushel, with the near months strongest.

title: Letter From Home
description: NEW HAVEN

title: GOLDIN AUDITORS SCORE PURCHASES BY SCHOOLS
description: New York City auditors say that the Board of Education stockpiled a huge amount of new desks and chairs as well as a 40year supply of 8cent postcards while failing to order needed art and other supplies.

title: C.I.A. Tells Columbia, Princeton Of Secret Behavioral Research
description: The Central Intelligence Agency has informed Columbia and Princetown Universities that they are among 66 institutions where secret research is believed to have ben conducted in an attempt by the agency to develop ways to manipulate the behavior of human beings, spokesmen for the universities said yesterday.

title: Study Seeking Way to Guard Power Lines From Damage Caused by Lightning Storm
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 24 (UPI)Federal researchers announced today a new effort to find out why lightning knocks out power lines despite protective devices, blacking out cities and causing damage that increases electric bills.

title: AIRLIFT IN SRI LANKA AIDS AREA OF STRIFE
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka. Aug. 24 (AP)The Government began airlifting refugees to safety today from areas of clashes between minority Tamils and majority Sinhalese.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: THERE ARE THOSE who read mystery novels in a ferocious frame of mind. The puzzle, like a vertebra or the genetic code, must be cracked. (In my experience, these people also enjoy doublecrostics, astrology and other oppressions of the human spirit.) And then there are those who catch a mystery novel as though it were a bus, when the brain is tired: Let a detective do the thinking. (Like me. If I can crack the puzzle, I am disappointed. Since I'm not very good at cracking puzzles, I am easily pleased. I am not, however, a pushover.) And so to business.

title: Rotary Praised by Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Aug.24 (AP)President Carter praised the overseas work of the Rotary International today and said that the organization's student exchange program could not be a better contribution to world peace.

title: Red Sox Accelerating Slide From First Place
description: Will the Boston Red Sox follow the Chicago Cubs into oblivion as this 1977 season runs its erratic course?

title: Teng Appears Confident and Relaxed in Talks W ith U.S. Reporters
description: PEKING. Aug. 24As Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance arrived at the Great Hall of the People today and stood waiting to be introduced. Teng Hsiaoping strode forward and began shaking handswith the assembled American Journalists.
