description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Presidents Augusto Pinochet of Chile and Jorge Rafael Videla of Argentinatwo leaders frequently criticized for authoritarian practices in their countrieswill be among a score of Latin American heads of state attending the signing of two Panama Canal treaties here on Sept. 7, it was announced today.

title: Green Speed Easy Victor In Rich Trot
description: YONKERS, Aug. 27 Green Freee, a horse with a reputation for bad manners, won the $239,000 Yonkers Trot, the first leg of trotting's triple crown, tonight at Yonkers Raceway. With Billy Haughton driving, the 3yearold brown colt scored one of the easiest victories of his career, beating Sugarbowl Hanover by five lengths.

title: BERMUDA BERMUDA
Miss Fischer Plans Nuptials
description: Kathryn Dolores Fischer, who served two years as a Peace Corps volunteer teacher on the Fiji Islands, plans to be married next October to Dr. Sanders William Davis. associate professor of clinical rehabilitation medicine at the New York University Medical Center.

title: The Outs of the Cultural Revolution Are In; Maoism Is Out
description: PEKINGIn China these days, nearly every foreigner has a favorite story about the changes that have begun to affect the lives of the country's 900 million people since the death last year of Mao Tsetung and the arrest of his widow, Chiang Ching. The changes are subtle, for the Chinese have learned to be a cautious people. But they are gradually making China a more relaxed, comfortable country, one perhaps more comprehensible for the West.

title: Cowboys Win on Last Play
description: IRVING, Tex., Aug. 27 (UPI)Efren Herrera kicked a 33yard field goal on the last play of the game at Texas Stadium tonight, giving the Dallas Cowboys a 2321 victory over the Baltimore Colts.

title: Most G.O.P. Legislators From the City Straddle Fence on Goodman
description: State Senator Roy M. Goodman has the support of the Republican hierarchy, including the national chairman, the state chairman and the city's county leaders in his mayoral primary battle with Barry Farber. But the East Side Senator is not doing so well with his fellow Republican legislators. Of the 15 Republican State Senators and Assemblymen in the city, only two could be found who have endorsed Mr. Goodman. One is his running mate for City Council President, Assemblyman John A. Esposito of Queens, and the other is a very lukewarm endorser, State Senator John D. Calandra, who is also Bronx Republican chairman. He feels that he has to go along with the other county leaders in backing Mr. Goodman.

title: HONE CLINIC
description: ALTHOUGH few homes in this area have flat or shedtype roofs over the entire house, many do have this type of roof over an attached garage, family room or extra room that has been added. These flat roofs are usually covered with builtup or rolltype roofing, rather than shingles, and they may or may not have gravel on top.

title: Refugees Reach Philippines
description: MANILA, Aug. 27 (Reuters)A new group of Vietnamese refugees has sailed into Philippine waters, bringing to about 400 the number of Vietnamese arrivals here since February, military sources said today. The latest group of 21 persons, which includes five former soldiers, nine women, and six children, ended Its nineday voyage Wednesday, the sources said. The refugees said they had come from Qui Nhon, a Vietnamese coastal city.

title: THE MORE WE SPEND, THE LESS CHILDREN LEARN
description: A teacher in an affluent suburban school is asked what she thinks her students require, since there has been some question about the emphasis in her school on reading, math and history skills. She replies: To learn how to survive in this world of pollution, wars.

title: 3 Die in South African Mine Fire
description: WELKOM, South Africa, Aug. 27 (UPI) A fire broke out in the President Steyn gold mine last night, killing three miners, a spokesman for the mine said today. He also said 30 other winners had been taken to a hospital for treatment of suspected gas poisoning. Firemen went into the mine to try to contain the fire, which kept the morning shift from going to work.

title: Elizabeth Colao, Broker, Wed to Robert Nolan Jr.
description: Elizabeth C. Colao, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph John Colao of Lincroft, N. J., was married yesterday in St. James Roman Catholic Church in Red Bank, N. J., to Robert Bernard Nolan Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Nolan of Stamford, Conn. The bridegroom's greatuncle, retired Bishop George L. Leech of Harrisburg, Pa., performed the ceremony.

title: The Rabbi and the Law Students
description: EARLY next week, Aaron T. Twerski, interim dean of the Hofstra Law School, will ponder the intricacies and paradoxes of the law of torts with a class of firstyear students. By asking a battery of sequential questionsthe Socratic method of instructionhe will analyze a celebrated liability case in which a 5yearold is accused of pulling out the chair from beneath his aunt, who was in the process of sitting.

title: Monmouth
description: FIRST$6,500, cl., 3YO,6f.

title: INTERVIEW
description: HACKENSACK WHEN future histories of Bergen County are written, Joseph F. Job will probably be referred to as the Sheriff who closed the jail. The appellation wtal be apt because Sheriff Job last mbnth ended years of controversy about conditions in the county jailwhich he hap termed inhumaneby unilaterally shutting down the 67yearold structure and transferring the inmates to the jail annex, which was opened as a model county institution in 1967.

title: Choice Exhibits
description: Irving Penn, at Marlborough, Sept. 9.

title: Diane Brown, Peter Briggs Are Married
description: Diane Justine Brown, daughter of Mrs. Edward M. Bigler of Greenwich. Conn., and M. Barclay Brown Jr. of Hilton Head, S.C., was married yesterday to Peter Sheffield Briggs, son of Mr. and Mrs. John L. Briggs of Greenwich.

title: Chinese Aide to Visit Japan
description: TOKYO, Aug. 27 (Reuters)Liu Hsiwen, China's Deputy Minister of Foreign Trade, will visit Japan next month for talks with Japanese business leaders on a proposed longterm trade agreement between the two countries.

title: Paterson: A Real Farmer's Market
description: THERE are farmers' markets, and there are farmers' markets. What are called farmers' markets pop up, particularly at this time of the year and seemingly like eyes on potatoes, along the roads that take city people to the country. And they multiply into late summer. However, most of these are not farmers' markets, but rather simply roadside outlets for neighborhood vegetables and fruits.

title: Crew
description: AT AMSTERDAM

title: Street Corner Dj Vu
description: SOUTH PLAINFIELD IT is nearing midnight in this town, a suburban, middleclass community, the sort of town that is often characterized as typically American. On this warm midsummer night, a cooling breeze gently ruffles the leaves of the few remaining trees on the block. The others have long since been removed and replaced by sidewalks.

title: Red Smith
description: Bowie Kuhn's thermal underwear must be as threadbare as a sportswriter's vocabulary. What other reason could the high priest of baseball have for starting this year's postseason play early enough to get the boys out of the trenches by Thanksgiving? Surely he hasn't discovered at this late date that snow time ain't no time to sit outdoors and watch a World Series. That would be a retreat from his soutly defended position that in these latitudes late October nights are as benign as any golden June.

title: Picking Up Dinner Check For a Baseball Revelation
description: Mickey Mantle. Though the hair was thinner and the face older, I recognized him instantly. Seeing Mantle eating alone in a booth at a roadside diner stirred memories.

title: Aide to Vance Briefs Officials In Seoul on Meetings in Peking
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 27 (UPI)Assistant Secretary of State Richard Holbrooke today briefed senior South Korean officials on Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance's fourday visit to China.

title: Rev. James N. Jerge Weds Marie Charlotte Scharfe
description: Marie Charlotte Scharfe, who expects to graduate next year from the Lutheran Theological Seminary in Philadelphia, was married yesterday to the Rev. James N. Jerge, an alumnus of the seminary who is now minister of Grace Lutheran Church in Dunkirk, N. Y. The Rev. LeRoy H. Aden performed the ceremony in the bridegroom's church.

title: Elizabeth C. Amory Wed to Zenas Bliss, A Geology Student
description: Elizabeth Cole Amory and Zenas Fraser Bliss were married yesterday in St. Christopher's Episcopal Church in Chatham, Mass. Retired Bishop Nelson Burroughs of the Diocese of Ohio performed the ceremony.

title: Ideas & Trends/Continued
description: In recent years, women have made substantial gains in many traditionally male occupations. Not so in construction: Only 30,000, or 1 percent, of the nation's 3,000,000 experienced construction workers are female.

title: Couple Fights A Blinding Disease
description: PRINCETON GORDON GUND, the 38yearold chairman of the Gund Investment Corporation, was blinded in 1970 by retinitis pigmentosa, a degenerative, incurable eye disease. Seven years ago this fall he joined with Bernard Berman of Baltimore, who has two teenage daughters stricken by the same disease, and feended the National Retinitis Pigmen?? Foundation Inc.

title: CHESS
description: The West German grandmaster Robert Hubner had what was for him a hard time in the Bad Lauterberg International Tournament, sharing fifth to eighth places.

title: INVESTING
description: Rare books, those finely bound volumes often admired but seldom taken from the dusty shelves to be read, are getting back into circulation. They are sought by investors who want a hedge against inflation. And why not?

title: Karen Flachs Is Engaged To Wed Terrance Schulke
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Flachs of Kings Park, L.I., of the engagement of their daughter, Karen Flachs, to Terrance Schulke, son of Mr. and Mrs. C. Patrick Schulke of Fort Salonga, L.I.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THE telephone rang about 8 A.M. the other Sunday, and a cheerful voice asked if it was waking me. I snarled that indeed it was. The voice, fortunately, belonged to a good friend who explained that he was hoping my wife, the early riser, would answer because he wanted to know if there was a chance of getting me up to go to a lastminute midday outing.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: FISHING
description: THE season for blueclaw crabs is off to a crawl. Although there are some reports of spurts of activity along the New Jersey Coast, the crabs are at least a month late in making their appearance in the bays and rivers. The crabs, which burrow in the mud over the winter, apparently were killed by last winter's severe cold.

title: Saratoga Racing
description: Copyright 1977 by Dotty Racing Form. Inc.

title: Arab Youth Is injured in Blast In OpenAir Market in Gaza Strip
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 27 (AP)Two bombs went off in Israelioccupied territory today, and an Arab youth was seriously hurt in one of the explosions, officials and witnesses said.

title: Pele's Legacy: The Game and Man
description: The world's most famous soccer player, Edson Arantes do Nascimento, always says: My nickname means nothing Pel. It is just a word. But in American soccer now, Pel means everything. It is the word. Win or lose with the Cosmos in Soccer Bowl '77 at Portland, Ore., today, Pel legacy in America is assured. Most of the national television viewers won't really undergtand the nuances of what they're watching today, but they should be watching because Pete has made soccer important here. Babe Ruth did that for baseball, Jack Dempsey for boxing, Bobby Jones for golf. And now, half a century later, Pel has done it for soccer.

title: Virginia M. Fleming, William Marlow Wed
description: Virginia Marie Fleming, daughter of Mrs. John L. Fleming of Pittsburgh and the late Mr. Fleming, was married in Mount Lebanon, Pa., yesterday to William J. Marlow, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Marlow of Nanuet, N.Y., The Rev. George Wilt performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Bernard.

title: Barbara Goren, Architect, Is Bride of John Loughran
description: Barbara Beth Goren, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alvin D. Goren of Baltimore, was married there yesterday to John Michael Loughran, son of John Loughran, Ambassador to Somalia, and Mrs. Loughran of Mogadishu. Louis M. Butts, depty clerk for the Circuit Court of Baltimore County, performed the ceremony at Grey Rock.

title: G.O.P. Chief Says Rep. Murphy Withheld Cost. Data on Oil Cargoes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Bill Brock, the Republican National Chairman, accused Representative John M. Murphy, Democrat of Staten Island, today of withholding a controversial report on the cost of requiring imported oil to be carried on ships of United States registry, a measure that is supported by the Carter Administration.

title: Study Reports That Congressmen Are on an Exhausting Treadmill
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)  A House study group said today that Congressmen were overworked on a treadmill of committee assignments, floor debates, office work and social functions. It recommended creation of a Commit tee on Committee to study the problem.

title: A New Boss at NBC
description: Robert T. Howard, president of NBCTV since 1974, has been dismissed by the National Broadcasting Company, only two weeks before the new broadcasting season. His job has been taken over by Robert E. Mulholland. The timing of the change rather than the change itself was surprising. A managerial shakeup had been anticipated, but the network under Mr. Howard's guidance has finished behind ABC and CBS in the ratings the last two seasons.

title: Preseason Football
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Whither Baseball?
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Woodbury Wins Polo, 74
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Aug. 27Led by Harvey Rhein with four goals and Ted Shapiro with three, the Woodbury polo learn defeated Muttontown today by 74 at Hickox Field. Joe Schwartz paced Muttontown with three goals, while Bill Brennan added the final tally.

title: 2 U.S. Swimmers Set Records in East Berlin
description: EAST BERLIN, Aug. 27 (AP)Joe Bottom and Brian Goodell of the United States set world records today on the first day of a dual swimming meet against East Germany.

title: GARDENING
description: THE NEXT time you nibble on those delicious salted mixed nuts that came out of a can, remember that they grow on trees, and that it takes a dandy big grove of nut trees to fill all those cans on the store shelf, and that with some tender loving care and intelligent choices, some of those crunchy goodies can be grown in the backyard.

title: Huge Aftershock Jolts Quake Area
description: An earthquake that was termed a strong aftershock from a severe Aug. 19 quake in the same part of the world jolted an area between Australia and Indonesia yesterday, United Press International reported. The tremor was recorded at 7.1 on the openended Richter Scale, and was the seventh and the strongest of a series of aftershocks from the Aug. 19 quake, which was recorded at 8.5 on the scale.

title: Buses to Carry Bikes And Wheelchairs
description: WI?? PI?? If all goes according to schedule in fleet of advancedesign huses with special section t?? wheelchairs. bicycle, shopping carts and baby carriage, will appear on county roads next May.

title: Condition of F.B.I. Designate Called Excellent After Surgery
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 27 (AP)Frank M. Johnson Jr., directordesignate of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, was reported in excellent condition early today after abdominal surgery.

title: In Memoriam
description: BANDRachel and Samuel. Together again. Remembered with love. The family.

title: Editors' Choice
description: THE COLLECTED ESSAYS OF J. V. CUNNINGHAM, by J. V. Cunningham. (Swallow Press, $20.) Critical essays by the distinguished American poet.

title: Braves Beat Mets, 54, With Rally in 10th
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 27Manager Joe Torre thought he had fallen upon a stroke of managerial genius at Atlanta Stadium tonight, but his Mets nonetheless lost to the Braves in 10 innings, 54.

title: In the Offing for Dance Buffs
description: Grand Kabuki Theater at the Beacon Theater, Aug. 31Sept. 4; returning Sept. 1318.

title: Work: Therapy for the Disturbed
description: WHITE PLAINS DON'T worry about errors,  said the secretary to the young woman leaning over the electric typewriter. If you make a mistake you can always erase it, Hesitantly, the young woman stiffened her fingers and began to punch the keys.

title: Adella Menger To Wed Oct. 8
description: Mr. and Mrs. Carl Simone Menger of Mantoloking, N.J., and Palm Beach, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Adella Simone Menger, to Dennis Holstun Lopez. He is a son of Adrian Lopez of New York, Bay Head, N.J., and Waverly, Ala.

title: Hot Dog King Uncrowned
description: John Zervas, the peddler king of New York's Central Park, has lest his title. A fiveyear contract that gave Mr. Zervas the exclusive right to 60 pushcart locations in Central Park has been canceled. Mayor Beame took the action in anger following Mr. Zervas's arrest last week on charges of fighting with another vendor and with a police offender. Mr. Zervas won the contract last spring with a bid of $80,000. His iawyers said he would sue for breach of contract. They also said Mr. Beame was politically motivated in this election year because public (voter) sympathy was with the unlicensed vendors.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: Another Viewpoint On Subsidized Abortions

title: 2 Are Inside the Park, on Successive Pitches
description: The Yankees, who have been playing exciting and winning baseball for the past three weeks, created some unusual excitement yesterday, but they didn't win. The Texas Rangers did.

title: Polish Town's Homecoming
description: RIVERHEAD IF they weren't wearing saucersize Kiss me, I'm Polish buttons, their red and white Tshirts read Polish Power, or some variant. Some young people sprayed Polish eagle signs on their long, shiny hair. It was the third annual Polish Town Fair here, and families came from as far as, well, Staten Island, to affirm their ethnic heritage.

title: Card of Thanks
description: BERKOWITZLillian, Mrs. Blanche Raft Lehrman extends appreciation to many friends & relatives for their kind expressions of sympathy.

title: Getting Personal About Taxes
description: I HAVE just received a personalproperty tax bill from town hall, and it confuses me. Of course, I've heard of taxes on personal property before, but for some unknown reason, this is the first time I've actually been asked to pay one. Suddenly the town demands $30.72 of me. The bill says I may pay it all at once or in two installments of $15.36 each.

title: Behind the Best Sellers: Anais Nin
description: The patron who paid her a dollar a page for writing erotica told Anais Nin in 1940. Leave out the poetry. Concentrate on the sex. Nevertheless, she created a literary aphrodisiac. Almost by accident, 37 years later her collection of 15 stories appears as Delta of Venus and gains the immediate public that her more famous diaries achieved only after a long time.

description: E?? OP??Detroit 1. LOBCalifornia 7. Detroit 5 ?? HR ?? May?? SB5??, SFS??

title: Belmont Braces for Jersey Threat
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 27Enthusiastic over the success of their fourweek meeting, which produced records in handle and attendance. New York Racing Association officials were set for Monday's opening of a 42day meeting at Belmont Park.

title: U.S. Proposes Protecting FamilySize Farms by Enforcing Acreage Limits in 1902 Act
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27After a hiatus of 75 years, the Interior Department has proposed fully enforcing the provisions that Congress wrote in the Reclamation Act of 1902 in an effort to protect the familysize farm.

title: British Football Results
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE Division I

title: FOOD
description: WITH the delight of local corn and tomato crops, the cucumbers are sometimes overlooked or taken for granted. These summer refreshers deserve publicity because they are also better when fresh from the farm.

title: MEXICANS ARE VEXED BY U.S. MIGRANT PLAN
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 27The Mexican Government is deeply worried by President Carter's plan to curb illegal migration to the United States but is apparently unwilling to risk a crisis in relations by stirring up a controversy over the issue.

title: 10 Armed Men Steal Police Car In Ireland and Escape Into Ulster
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 27 (UPI)Ten men wearing combat jackets and carrying submachine guns beat up three policemen near the border, stole their patrol car and escaped into Northern Ireland, a police spokesman said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Teacher Federation Opens Its Rolls to Nonteachers
description: Faced with its first membership decline in 20 years, the American Federation of Teachers has decided to open its membership to workers outside of the schools, such as librarians, lawyers, mimes and parks employees.

title: World's Deserts Grow by 14 Million Acres a Year; Land Mismanagement Spurs Threat to Food Supply
description: The land is dying. Over vast reaches of every, continent the rainfall, soil fertility and vegetation necessary to most forms of life are diminishing or disappearing. The result is that the world's deserts are spreading and new deserts are appearing and growing.

title: For Diplomats, Home Is Where the Hearth Is
description: BE it ever so humble, Westchester is no place like Rio, Jakarta or even Canberra. But to the dozens of diplomats who live in the county, it is homeat least until their next assignment.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: This is the week during which some 60 American music critics will be in New York, looking into the City Opera and the New York Philharmonic's Black Composers series, attending meetings and symposia, and electing officers for their organizationthe Music Critics Association, Inc. It is a thriving organization, much to the surprise of those who remember what happened to some equivalent groups: the Music Critics Circle of New York, for instance, which slowly sank and disappeared without anybody taking any notice, much less mourning its demise.

title: U.S. Sues StarKist on Wastes
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27 (UPI)The Federal Government is suing StarKist Foods, Inc., for pumping wastes from its seafood canning plants into Los Angeles Harbor. The Environmental Protection Agency's suit, filed yesterday, said that StarKist refused to obey a July 1 deadline for discharging the wastes into the harbor. It asks a $100,000 fine for each day wases were dumped Into the harbor.

title: Elaine F. Shea Is Bride Of Antreas Ghazarossian
description: Elaine Florence Shea, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph L. Shea of Haworth, N.J., was married yesterday afternoon in Purchase, N.Y., to Antreas Edouard Ghazarossian, son of Mrs. Edouard H. Ghazarossian of Woodside, Queens, and the late Mr. Ghazarossian. The Rev. Thomas Blessin performed the Roman Catholic ceremony in the chapel at Manhattanville College.

title: Vacation Treat Watching Others Work
description: On a sweltering Saturday afternoon In August Mr. and Mrs. Douglas Henderson and their two sons sat entranced in the visitors bleachers at the Steuben glass factory in Corning, N.Y. Sweat forming on their brows, the visitors gazed intently as workers shared chunks of semimolten glass.

title: Matrimonial Advertising in India's Sunday Papers Adapts Itself to Changing Economics and Mores
description: NEW DELHI. Aug. 27 Every Sunday morning millions of Indians settle down with a cup of tea and the special weekend issues of their newspapers, just as Americans do. But here, with the marriage season approaching, many of them turn quickly to a Sunday feature that is particularly Indianthe columns and columns of matrimonial advertisements in which young people seek husbands and wives.

title: Since '94, Culture By the Sea
description: POINT O'WOODS IN MANY ways, this summertime haven east of the Fire Island lighthouse has remained unchanged since it was founded in 1899 by the Chautauqua Society. Although the oratory of William Jennings Bryan and Ralph Waldo Emerson no longer captivates audiences numbering in the thousands, the brownshingled cottages built around the turn of the century remain, along with a community dedication to cultural advancement.

title: Point O'Woods Has Something That Sets It Aparta Tall Fence
description: POINT O'WOODS L.I.A six or ??enfoot fence separtes this area team the Fire Island communities to the west, but it is more a symbol than a barrier Just about anyone can ask a Point O'Woods resident to unlock the gate near Ocen Bay Park and the resident more times than not will comply with the request.

title: Apples Win to Retain Title
description: PHOENIX, Aug. 27A spectacular 60 rout of Chris Evert by Virginia Wade in the second set led the New York Apples to a 2817 victory over the Phoenix Racquets tonight before a crowd of 11,294 at the Coliseum and gave the Apples their second straight World Team Tennis championship.

title: CARTER LAUDS VANCE ON HIS CHINA TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27  President Carter said today that Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance had achieved a major step toward the Administration's goal of normalizing relations with China during four dad's of discussions in Peking.

title: Future Events
description: Flair for Flare

title: Escaped Prisoner Recaptured
description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., Aug. 27 (UPI)The authorities early today captured Harold Jeffries, a federal prisoner who escaped Monday while he was at Wrigley Field in Chicago with 17 other prison. ers to see a baseball game. Mr. Jeffries, who was in the fourth year of a 15year sentence for bank robbery, would have been eligible for parole in a year. The prisoners had been taken to the game as a reward for good behavior.

title: LETTERS
description: CapitalGains Tax

title: Massachusetts High Court Defines End of Life as Death of the Brain
description: BOSTON, Aug. 27 (AP)The Massachusetts Supreme Court, saying that the definition of death as the cessation of the heart is erroneous, has adopted the concept of brain death for the purpose of determining the death of a homicide victim.

title: THE U.S.OPEN ACTION YOU NEVER SEE
description: They're after me. My number is up. They want me. They're not even satisfied with my rump in a sling. They want my soul, too.

title: Mary C. Murphy, Nurse, Bride of John C. Woody
description: St. Michael Roman Catholic Church in Greenwich, Conn., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Mary Cullene Murphy, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Cullen Murphy of Cos Cob, Conn., to John C. Woody, son of Mr. and Mrs. Amos A. Woody of Anaheim. Calif.

title: Harlem Holds Its Third Annual Dayand Shows the Proud Side
description: Heralding a second renaissance for Harlem, sponsors of the third annual Harlem Day yesterday climaxed a week of water ballets, tennis competitions, elderly citizen lunches, cocktail parties and soul food buffets with live jazz and other activities

title: Scientists Act to Use Germ Warfare Against Mosquitoes and Other Pests
description: EAST LANSING, Mich. (UPI)Scientists have taken steps to use germ warfare against mosquitoes and other diseasecarrying insects. Western Illinois University, said researchers for the World Health Organization had been sending cooperating researchers samples from around the world of insects that died from diseases. The researchers then tried to isolate the bacteria, viruses or other microorganisms that killed the insects to see if they would be suitable for pest control.

title: Film: Of Women and Vietnam
description: Hollywood, justly celebrated for sinking its head in the sand of escapism, appears to be undergoing an examination of conscience. At long last, it is coming conspicuously to grips with a couple of issues of burning significancewar and women. Scanning the list of films scheduled for release within the coming year, one surmises that not only will moviegoers have a chance to see the Vietnam War refought and rethought but even more wondrouswe will bear witness to the cinematic rebirth of the female segment of the nation.

title: Scientists Battle Gypsy Moth Menace
description: TRENTON IN TWO laboratories here, state scientists are busy hatching tiny flies to be released on a special mission in state forests and fields. Their mission: To destroy destructive farm insects and to keep the gypsy moth from becoming the bug that ate New Jersey.

title: Building With ReadyMix Concrete
description: Buying readymixed concrete and pouring it into a previously prepared form or excavation is probably the fastest way to add a new patio, driveway or walk to the outside of your homeat least in suburban or urban areas where readymix (also called transitmix) is available locally. The material is delivered, ready to pour, by large trucks that mix the ingredients while the vehicle is enroute.

title: The Elderly: A Need for Housing ...
description: WHILE the high cost and the inadequacy of housing appear to be the most pressing problems for the elderly in Westchester and other residential areas around New York City, there is another cause for concern: As the people grow older, many of them face the need to move to places where they can be cared for.

title: Charlotte P. Alling Is Married
description: The marriage of Charlotte Parsons Alling, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles B. Alling Jr. of Mount Kisco, N.Y., and Kennebunk, Me., to Anthony Judson Gooding took place yesterday afternoon in Kennebunkport, Me. The ceremony was performed in St. Ann's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Clarke K. Oler, godfather of the bride, and the Rev. Laman Bruner. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Judson Gooding of Bedford, N.Y.

title: What New Yorkers Think of City: Blacks Are the Least Pessimistic
description: New York City residents are deeply troubled about their city, and are generally far more pessimistic about its future than they were four years ago.

title: The Sun and the Wind Are Soft, Nuclear Power and Coal Are Hard
description: The House of Representatives earlier this month voted energy legislation to implement President Carter's comprehensive energy policy. Despite a sharp debate over deregulation of natural gas prices, the bills as passed give the Carter Administration nearly everything it asked for.

title: R. H. Tucker, ExBrooks Chairman
description: Russell Hatch Tucker, former chairman of Brooks Brothers. the retail clothing store, died Friday at Norwalk Hospital in Norwalk, Conn., as a result of an accident that occurred while he was golfing. He was 67 years old and lived in Westport, Conn.

title: Music: Rampal Leads All Mozart
description: Friday night's Mostly Mozart concert at Avery Fisher Hall, the final Mostly Mozart program of the season, was a scintillating affair led by JeanPierre Rampal. Mr Rampal, of course, is primarily known as a flutist. But over the last few summers he has been heard here as a conductor as well.

title: Revitalizing Effect of Renaissance Center Is Upgrading Detroiters' View of Their City
description: DETROIT, Aug. 27Halfway up the outside of the sparkling new 70story Detroit Plaza Hotel, the last visual obstruction fell away and passengers in a glasswalled elevator glimpsed the spectacle that awaited them at the top of the Renaissance Center.

title: Art: The Accent Is French
description: The fall season of 1977 is custombuilt for those who believe that French art between 1850 and 1950 was just about as good as it could be. Among the names most held in honor are those of Paul Czanne (the Museum of Modern Art), Georges Seurat (the Metropolitan Museum), Claude Monet (the Boston Museum of Fine Arts) and Henri Matisse (the National Gallery of Art, in Washington). The exhibitions in question seem to be admirably sharp in their focus andlikewise in evey casethey aim to tell us something that we need to know and could not have found out in other way.

title: The Times to Improve and Expand Its BestSeller List
description: A new computerized system for selecting expanded lists of bestselling books, as determined by the sales reports of 1,400 bookstores and 40 paperback distributors throughout the country, is being introduced by The New York Times.

title: Topics
description: Food Code Hats off to the sleuths at the New York State Consumer Protection Board who cracked the freshness codes used on many food items found on the grocery shelves. The board has successfully translated such gibberish as A003 and 7115 into the dates a food was packed. That may not rank with cracking the Japanese code during the Second World War, but it could provide useful information to consumers.

title: Rediscovering Andrew Young
description: There was a time, not so many weeks ago, when it was fashionable to pick on Andrew Young, the former preacher, civil rights worker and Georgia Congressman who now represents the United States at the United Nations. His offthecuff remarksabout racism in Sweden and in Queens, about racist former Presidents here, about Cuban troops in Africa being a stabilizing forceconstantly seemed to get him into trouble. He was, so said many a commentator, a freefloating, freespeaking zealot whose foot was constantly in his mouth and who had only the most remote connection with the foreign policy of the country.

title: ...And a New Look at the Rules That Banks Go By
description: WASHINGTONWhatever the outcome for him personally, the controversy over Budget Director Bert Lance's banking affairs has drawn the attention of Congress to the secretive fraternity of bankers. Phrases like compensating balances, correspondent accounts and fully collateralized are now being tossed about with assurance and even enthusiasm by the legislators.

title: Former Teacher Is Convicted
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 27 (AP)A former high school English teacher has been convicted for intending to corrupt the morals of students hired for nude photo sessions. Stephen Vavra Jr., 31 years old, who taught at Swissvale. High School, was found guilty on four of 12 charges involving the solicitation and hiring of five male students last year. T he boys, who were sophomores and juniors at the time of the incidents, had testified that Mr. Vavra hired them for $10 and $20 a session. The resulting photographs appeared in a Californiabased magazine for homosexuals.

title: Deborah Ann Hillman Sets Bridal on Oct. 29
description: Mr. and Mrs. Stanley E. G. Hillman of Lake Forest, Ill., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Deborah Ann Hillman. to Thomas Wightman Stewart Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Stewart of Lombard. III. The wedding is planned for Oct. 29 at the Episcopal Church of the Holy Spirit in Lake Forest.

title: Lisa Cole Lewis Married
description: Lisa Cole Lewis, daughter of Warren A. Lewis of Andover, Mass., and the late Mrs. Lewis, was married yesterday to Alexander Buel Hodges 3d, in the West Parish Church (United Church of Crist) in Andover. The bride is an alumna of Colby Junior College and the Pingree School in South Hamilton, Mass. Mr. Hodges, a graduate of Denver University, is an insurance broker in Chicago, where the couple will live. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles H. Hodges 3d, of Lake Forest,. Ill.

title: Miss Rhodes Wed To B. A. Blackburn
description: Sandra Lou Rhodes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Rhodes of Chesterfield, Mo., formerly of Sydney, Australia, was married yesterday to Bradley A. Blackburn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur H. Blackburn of Manhasset, L. I.

title: Study Links Stress Level To Weekends
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa. (UPI) Any working woman who has dragged herself home from a hard week to face another fulltime job as housekeeper knows the feeling, but now a professor at Pennsylvania State University has given it a name: weekend stress.

title: London Names Woman to Lead Drive on Smut
description: LONDON, Aug. 27The new chief of the antipornography squad at Scotland Yard is a woman.

title: Theater: Stars Are The Story
description: Broadway is bristling with activity. After a season of recordsetting grosses, producers and theaterowners are anticipating more of the same. Almost all of the theaters are either filled with holdovers or have at least one new play scheduled for the next season. Some have two, one right after the other; when there is a jam, almost any booking is desirable. Producers are reluctant to admit it, but they are waiting breathlessly for rivals to fold so that they can move into running position.

title: Denville Garden Provides Crops For Community
description: DENVILLETHINGS look good on Bean Boulevard, Celery Court and Nutmeg Notch. The plowing and planting are done and the crops ate coming up on schedule. We've already eaten lots of spinach, peas and corn, said Lance Incitti as he watered a 50by30foot plot on a recent sunny Saprday, and now we have corn. Nearby, his wife and two young daughters took a picnic basket and thermoses from the car

title: Karen Rueben Is Bride
description: Karen Rueben, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Rueben of North Woodmere, L.I., was married last evening to Alan Dorman. a member of the New York Stock Exchange. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Dorman of Hewlett, L.I. Rabbi Jay Rosenbaum, assisted by Cantor David Benedict, performed the ceremony at Temple Israel in Lawrence, L.I.

title: Great Swimsuit Battle Gets Hotter and Hotter
description: Speedo has an advisory board of 36 coaches and pays them up to $20,000 a year. For that money, the coaches advise on swimsuits, give an occasional clinic and make sure their swimmers wear Speedo suits in their races.

title: FROM CITY DESK TO CITY HALL: The Odyssey of an Erstwhile Journalist
description: Late on a dark December afternoon in 1946, 1 sat in the Dickensian city room of The Journal of Commerce in New York, just back from my very first professional reporting assignment. I had been to Newark, covering a conference on consumer credit  a big and heavy subject in those early postwar daysand the deadline was at hand.

title: Scandal Clouds Italian Quake Relief
description: ROME, Aug. 27Italy is being shaken by a corruption scandal involving reconstruction efforts in the Friuli region, which was severely damaged by an earthquake last year.

title: Beame Calls The Post A Sensationalist Rag
description: At his City Hall news conference yesterday, Mayor Beame lashed out at The New York Post and at its publisher. Rupert Murdoch.

title: Mao's War On Culture
description: CHINESE SHADOWS is a brilliant polemic that in 1974, as Ombres Chinoises. blew the whistle on French adulation of Mao and may have a similar effect here. Simon Leys is really Pierre Ryckmans, a Belgian art historian who has published several works of Sinologynotably Su Renshan: Rebel Painter and Madman in 19thCentury China, an anthology of tzu or poemes a chanter, and a French translation, with commentaries, of the classic Sun Tzu' s Art of War. He first visited China in 1955, penetrated Chinese life in the most efficacious way by marrying a Chinese woman (his book is dedicated to her) and lived for five years in Hong Kong. In 1971 he published Les Habits Neufs du President Mao, (Chairman Mao's New Clothes), one of the most caustic exposes by a Sinologist of the Cultural Revolution's basically antiintellectual attack on China's cultural heritage.

title: Edward J. McKenna, 75, ExMayor Of Irvington and ExAssemblyman
description: Edward J. McKenna, a former New Jersey Assemblyman and Mayor of Irvington from 1954 to 1958, died Thursday in Neptune, N. J., at the age of 75.

title: Track and Field's Brightest Stars to Clash in the First World Cup
description: The World Cup track meet, which begins Friday evening in Dusseldorf, West Germany, will have neither the flame nor the fanfare of the Olympic Games. But the threeday competition among national and continental teams from every part of the world is assured of being the most important nonOlympic meet of all.

title: Bloomingdale's and the F.T.C.
description: Dear Sir: The Federal Trade Commission is currently conducting an investigation of Bloomingdale's, 1000 Third Avenue, New York...to determine whether or not Bloomingdale's is in compliance with Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, which prohibits unfair methods of competition in or affecting commerce.

title: Support Needed for E.R.A.
description: THE Equal Rights Amendment, the proposal to amend the United States Constitution to abolish discrimination between the sexes, surprisingly is opposed by many women. Such discrimination has historically given the better and larger share of the loaf to men, so, logically, you would think that all women would be. in favor of E.R.A. That just shows, once again, how far off logic can be when emotions are involved.

title: Bruce Landis, Reporter, Anne Peirce, Have Bridal
description: Anne Peirce, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel F. Peirce of Noroton, Conn., was married there yesterday in the chapel of St. Luke's Episcopal Church, to Bruce Landis, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert P. Landis of Old Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. Frederick T. Bender performed the ceremony.

title: Miss Navratilova in Final
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Aug. 27 (UPI)Martina Navratilova continued to breeze through the $35,000 Ivey'sPepsi women's tennis tournament today, beating JoAnne Russell, 61, 62, in the semifinals. Miss Russell, who had trouble with her service, won the first game, then saw her rival run off 11 games in a row with her powerful hitting.

title: Council Unit Meetings Scheduled This Week
description: The following public meetings of New York City Council Committees will be held this week.

title: DINING OUT
description: Chester THERE ARE, I am told, close to 30 Chart House restaurants throughout the United States. with more in the offing. Three have opened in Connecticut within the last five years and another is planned for the spring. Chart House Enterprises, the company that controls this fastgrowing chain, uses a clever and apparently successful formula: strikingly original, oneofakind settings; attractive young waiters and waitresses, schooled in informality and friendliness (Hi, I'm Fred. Hello, I'm Pat.); and a limited, relatively inexpensive menu that varies only slightly from restaurant to restaurant.

title: In America
description: HOUSTON. A pious man, Leon Jaworski would probably regard as distasteful blasphemy any description of his return to Washington this month as a second coming. Yet, after he's done with the House of Representatives, there will be only one branch of government left that hasn't sought unction from his wellmanicured hands. Now that it has happened twice, it's not hard to see why he seems like a reasonable risk, if not a safe bet, to public men whose passion for truth is hardly to be assumed. His integrity is beyond question, but so is his tact. He won't compromise his own reputation but, because a reputation is to him a tangible value and reward, he won't be reckless with the reputation of others. The leaders of Congress who implored Jaworski to step into the breach on the Korea investigation when it seemed to be foundering may have remembered him, momentarily, not as the man who cashiered Richard Nixon but as the man who let Richard Kleindienst plead to a misdemeanor because he felt the case for a felony prosecution wasn't strong enough to warrant the humiliation of a former Attorney General.

title: INTEGRITY IS SLOGAN FOR MARYLAND RACE
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Aug. 27The demise of the twoterm administration of Gov. Marvin Mandel has given politicians an early start on the 1978 gubernatorial election, and the campaign openedon a predictably familiar noteintegrity in government.

title: A Correction
description: In last Sunday's Business and Finance section in Tax Loophole for Multinationals a statement that an Internal Revenue Service audit for 196467 led to additional assessments for the oil industry alone of $500 million was incorrectly attributed to Prof. M. A. Adelman of the Massachusett Institute of Technology. The figure was cited by Thomas F. Field, a former I.R.S. official, who is now executive director of Taxation with Representation, a publicinterest taxpayers' lobby. He made the statement before the Delaware State Legislature in May 1976.

title: Teachers' Skills Seen on Videotape
description: PRINCETON DOES the preponderance of teacher candidates and the dwindling number of vacancies keep both applicants and employers from getting a fair shake? One former educator, Dr. Joseph M. Smith, thinks so, and has established a business that he believes will help both the candidates and the administrators.

title: New Jersey/ This Week
description: ACTOR'S CAFE THEATER, 263 Central Avenue. East OrangeStalag 17. Thursday through Saturday. S:30 P.M. $3.50$4.50; students and the elderly, $2.50$3.90; group rates. (201) 6751881

title: City Hall Fete Will Recognize McDonnell Exit
description: After 14 years at the center of labormanagement disputes. Vincent D. McDonnell is preparing to leave his post as chairman of the New York State Mediation Board and join the law firm of Shea, Gould, Climenko, Kramer & Casey and also head the Graduate School of Industrial Relations at Pace University.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: EIGHT more days of public hearings are scheduled starting in September on an ambititious highway and masstransit bill proposed by Representative James J. Howard. Democrat of Wall Township.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: THEATER

title: BRIDGE
description: One of the most famous bridge personalities of an earlier era, the late Alphonse Moyse Jr.known to all as Sonnyis remembered for many reasons but one is unique. He is the only player in bridge history who is associated with a particular suit fit: four trumps opposite three. For 30 years in The Bridge World Magazine, which he edited with great distinction, he insisted forcefully on the virtues of this shaky trump holding.

title: The Worship of Equality
description: HARTFORD WHEN Alexis de Tocqueville visited the United States in 1831 he concluded that democracy ran the risk of sliding down one road to anarchy, or the other to servitude. With the disinterested eye of a French aristocrat, he concluded that servitude would be the Americans more likely fate, that the worship of equality in the country, at the expense of liberty, would put so much power in the hands of the central government that the people would be its slaves.

title: Red Sox 75 Winners On 4 Fenway Homers
description: The lull in Boston appears over, with the storm under way.

title: News from the Great Cosmetic Houses
description: At Revlon, the youngish butler places the coffee on the coffee table in the very large, walnutpaneled office way up high in the General Motors Building (nicknamed the General Odors Building because of the large number of cosmetic and fragrance houses that have their offices there) on Fifth Avenue. This is Paul Woolard's place, and he is senior executive vice president of Revlon Inc. Today, Woolard says, cosmetics follow women. Women dont follow cosmetics. They are far too sophisticated to be followers. Woolard goes on to observe: The multiple lives women lead mean that cosmetics must have multiple usages, shades and formulas.

title: Deaths
description: ADAMSMary Roberts, at Utica, N. Y., on Aug. 26, 1977, aver a brier Illness. The beloved wile of Howard C. Adams, devoted mother of Katharine A. Bouras and Peter R. Adams, grandmother of lan Bouras, daughter of Cora Roberts, sister of Martin Roberts. Memorial Service at Grace Church Lady, Chapel, Utica, N. Y., Aug. 29, 1977 at 11 A.M. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the Grosvenor Neighborhood House, 35 E. 72d St., N. Y. C. For information, contact Elwood T. Day Funeral Home, 1222 State St., Utica, N. Y.

title: Article 11  No Title
Automobile Prices in High Gear
description: Buyers of new cars can expect to see much higher price tags on the models of their choice this fall. The General Motors Corporation, which accounts for more than half of all automobiles sold in the United States, has announced that the average retail price of its 1978 passenger cars, including optional equipment, will rise about 5.7 percent, or $387 a vehicle.

title: After the verdict, a juror returns to the scene
description: Roughly, the figures break down this way: Every day of last year approximately 4.5 people were murdered in New York City. Of those 1,622 murders, one took place at 7 P.M. on the evening of Sept. 8, 1976, and was witnessed by more than 70 people. The case came to trial early this year. The evidence presented at the trial and the result of the trial itself were influenced by a number of factors, the truth apparently being only one of them.

title: Garage Turns Back Hand of Time
description: ARDSLEY TIME'S passing is well marked by gas stations. Model T's become compact models; one pump becomes eight. Cars, trucks, buses pick up speed on superhighways while their drivers accelerate demands for quick service and convenience. The gas station that sells bricabrac, ornaments and antiques fades from ready view.

title: Results of U.S.East Germany Meet
description: Men

title: . . .And Making Them Feel at Home
description: WITH car pools, music lessons, Little League and the various other accouterments of suburban life, we dont have much spare time. Or so we said. Until a day, two years ago, when we got a casual invitation from our rabbi to join a Sunday afternoon gathering of some elderly, poor people from New York's Lower East Side.

title: Taiwan Wins Little League World Title
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 27 (UPI) Chiang ChenJung pitched a fourhitter and had three hits today to lead Taipei of Taiwan to a 72 victory over El Cajon, Calif., in the championship game of the 31st Little League world series.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayCoppergate, Lyons Road, Basking Ridge, N.J. Open, Maiden, Novice and Amateur,Owner Jumpers; Regular, Limit, Nonthoroughbred, AmateurOwner, Novice and Adult Amateur Working Hunters: Pleasure Horses. Adult Horsemanship. 8 A.M.

title: T. H. White's Lost Book
description: TH. WHITE'S The Once and Future King, consists of four books, three which were published separately between 1938 and 1940; considerably reworked and with Book Four added, they were published as The Once and Future King in 1958. Walt Disney made a movie of the first, The Sword and the Stone, in 1963, and Lerner and Loewe's musical Camelot was also a considerable hit in 1960, with Richard Burton, Robert Goulet and Julie Andrews portraying the tragic triangle of Arthur, Lancelot and Guinevere on stage.

title: Beauty
description: Something new has been added to the American airwaves  and it's not just more pollution. Since 1973, one hundred and seventy six new fragrances have been introduced to American noses. Name perfumes used to have a 20year commercial lifespan, says Ronald Lauder, vice president of marketing and sales of Estee Lauder, whose famed Youth Dew fragrance does about $40 million worth of business annually. Today, he observes, the average life of a fragrance is three to five years. Most of the American fragrance people agree, and, they say, even though new fragrances have been sprayed forth with bewildering speed. still more are coming.

title: High Marks for Bureaus Helping Troubled Children
description: MY mommy asked me to call. Tim is yelling that he is going to kill her. I'm scared. Can you please help quick? The caller at the other end of the phone line was a 10yearold girl, her voice freighted with fear. Tito was the nickname of her 14yearold brother, the middle child of a Hispanic mother who had recently remarried. The children' older brother is mentally retarded.

title: Massachusetts High Court Defines End of Life as Death of the Brain
description: BOSTON, Aug. 27 (AP)The Massachusetts Supreme Court, saying that the definition of death as the cessation of the heart is erroneous, has adopted the concept of brain death for the purpose of determining the death of a homicide victim.

title: Charlotte Wilson Is Rewed
description: Charlotte Stanton Wilson of Bronxville, N.Y., widow of Donald Wilson, was married yesterday to James Orville Glen Drake 3d of Rye. N.Y. The ceremony was performed in the Rye Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Donald Poole. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.

title: Out Door Johnny First In Feature at Monmouth
description: OCEANPORT. N.J., Aug. 27 (AP)Juanda Stable's Out Door Johnny battied Seth Beller's favorite, Qui Native, to the wire and won the $44,550 Choice Handicap by a halflength at Monmouth Park today.

title: U. S. Routs Soviet Union To Take Basketball Gold
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Aug. 27 (UPI)Powered by the shooting of Freeman Williams of Portland State and Sid Moncrief of Arkansas, the United States national basketball team overran the Soviet Union, 8768, today and won the gold medal on the final day of the World University Games.

title: Steven Charles Lazar Jr. Marries Chaille C. Fox
description: In Our Lady of Lourdes Roman Catholic Church in Milltown, N.J., yesterday afternoon, Chaille Clare Fox, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph F. Fox of Milltown, became the bride of Steven Charles Lazar Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Lazar of Somerset, N.J.

title: Gourmets' Mecca In Montclair
description: MONTCLAIR THE STOCK POT at 20 Church Street in Montclair is ample proof that it is possible to improve on a good thing. Opened almost five years ago as a source of domestic and imported housewares and household accessories, the tiny, perfectly appointed shop has become s mecca for lunchtime gourmets since introduced a simple luncheon menu to accommodate Christmas shoppers a few seasons ago.

title: Salmonella Cases In Northeast States Laid to Roast Beef
description: Federal health officials reported yesterday that outbreaks of salmonellosis food. poisoning in four Northeastern states had been linked to consumption of contaminated precooked roasts of beef sold in delicatessens, restaurants and supermarkets.

title: Rhodesia Reports 1Hour Attack From Across Zambian Frontier
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 27 (Reuters)Three Rhodesian soldiers were wounded yesterday in a 90minute outbreak of rocket, mortar, machine gun and small arms fire from Zambia, the Rhodesian military headquarters announced today.

title: From Athens, With the Tourists: Shortchanging the Sites
description: An early summer cruise left us with a few extra days in Athens. After ascents of the Acropolis and Mount Lycabettus, carousings in the garish Make, shopping forays and museum tours, Debbie and I were eager to sample some of Greece's premier attractions outside the city: Delphi, the mystic shrine of the oracle; Corinth, the onceopulent city sacked by the Romans; Mycenae, titanic fortress city of Agamemnon; the hallowed Greek isles. Three oneday tourstwo by land, one by seaseemed to be the answer.

title: And in Newark, City Folk Plant Food for Poor
description: NEWARK II'M A CITY BOY, said Guy D. Murphy, a young man in new denim coveralls, as he stood next to a garden plot in this city's predominantly black Central Ward. It's the first time I ever put anything into the ground.

title: Reporter Linked to a Senator's Gifts
description: PHILADELPHIA. Aug. 27 (AP)A forme: political writer for The Philadelphia Inquirer became romantically involved with a State Senator and accepted about $10,000 worth of gifts from him, including a fur coat, The Inquirer reported today.

title: There's a Lot of Leslie Caron In Our Future
description: NORFOLK, Va. If my father had known Leslie Caron, he would not have painted one portrait of her, not even a hundred. He would have spent his life painting her. So said the French film director Jean Renoir in 1955 on the occasion of the Paris opening of his play Orvet, which starred Leslie Caron and was, in fact, written for her.

title: World University Games
description: AT SOFIA, BULGARIA

title: Look what's cooking at A&S
description: The Brooklyn Tomato Races. Tomato fever is spreading in Brooklyn backyards as resident farmers cultivate their best tomatoes for the A&S Great Tomato Sweepstakes. To enter you must be a Brooklyn resident with your own tomato garden. Award winning categories include pint size, plum size, full size and biggest.Y

title: Brooklyn Takes Babe Ruth Title
description: NEWARK, Ohio, Aug. 27 (AP)Doug Weaving pitched a fivehitter to lead Brooklyn to a 30 victory over Huntsville, Ala., and the national championship in the Babe Ruth world series for players aged 1315 tonight.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: On the Value of Bluefish
description: As shore and boat anglers continue to proliferate along the East Coast, one is led to the inescapable conclusion that if the huge runs of bluefish to which we have become accustomed in recent decades were ever to fail, the light tackle marine sport fishing industry would go into a disastrous decline.

title: What's Doing on Boston's North Shore
description: THE STYLE  Boston's North Shore really begins at Marblehead, leapfrogging 30 miles of less fashionable coastal communities to start at a town that calls itself the Yachting Capital of the World. The shore runs another 30 miles or so, tacking and jibbing around Cape Ann and along the ragged edge of Ipswich Bay to Newburyport, a mellow little brick and clapboard city at the mouth of the Merrimack River. Old families, old money and the purest of Massachusetts accents prevail along the ?bore. More striking is the way its old seaports look much as they did in their heyday. For Ipswich it was the 17th and early 18th centuries, for Marblehead the decade just prior to the Revolution. Salem and Newburyport ships circled the globe in the Federal era and Gloucester schooners cornered local fisheries in the late 19th century. Wealthy BostoniansRichard Henry Dana, author of Two Years Before the Mast, is said to have been the firstbegan building summer houses in Manchester and Magnolia in the mid19th century. Up to the stock market crash of 1929 they continued to build ever more elaborate shingled, stone and brick mansions on Gloucester's Eastern Point and Marblehead Neck. A few of these ornate cottages have since been torn down, but an amazing percentage of the earlier, more modest homes survive, many of them occupied by commuting Boston bankers, brokers and lawyers descended from the original builders. If you've got ithold on to it is the prevailing attitude. Flaunting one's riches is considered neither sensible nor in good taste. Cadillacs are rare; jewels are kept in family vaults, and museums display only a fraction of their treasures. The Essex Institute in Salem, for instance, possesses but rarely shows a lock of George Washington's hair or Abraham Lincoln's gloves or the complete skeleton of a convicted witch.

title: Article 7  No Title
A NoFault Plan For Everything: ould It Work?
description: MY SONINLAW the attorney has suggested that since nofault automobile insurance has worked out so well in New Jersey, the concept should. be expanded to cover other activities.

title: APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS PLANNED FOR POLICEMEN
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Aug. 27 (UPI)A gun, a badge and a club do not make a policeman, but the head of a national police union says that is the only training many, law enforcement agents ever get.

title: In the Inferno, Without a Cooler
description: Stewart Mott, the multimillionaire, has a Park Avenue penthouse but no airconditioning. His plants, he reasons, are healthier without it.

title: Pamela Cornwell Is Bride
description: The marriage of Pamela Campbell Cornwell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Cornwell 3d of Garden City, L. I., to Craig Francis Rogers, son of Mr. and Mrs. John F. Rogers of Alexandria, Va., took place at noon yesterday. The Revs. John W. Davis and Paul V. Gallagher officiated at the service in the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation in Garden City, L.I.

title: Starr Cutler, M.P. Gilmartin Wed in Maine
description: Katharine Starr Miller Cutler, daughter of Anne Hoffman Cutler of New York, Palm Beach, Fla., and Bar Harbor, Me., and John W. Cutler of Wilton, Conn., was married yesterday to Michael Paul Gilmartin. He is a, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert James Gilmartin of Stratford, Conn.

title: Dance to The Music
description: IF the number of dance books being coaxed and rushed into print is an indication of anything, we are indeed in the middle of a dance boom. The assumption of many publishers seems to be that it's primarily pictures of dancers the new public is interested in  especially the arresting contrast between the dancerasperformer (leaping: the embodiment of human prowess) and the dancerasworker (sitting drenched with sweat, bleakfaced, rubbing tired feet). With the boom has come an increase in the number of fine dance photographers and in the case of some of the books published during the last few years, the flimsy texts exist principally to set off. the pictures. But the trickle of dance books with valuable texts is increasing too.

title: AUDIT SHOWS FOOD STAMPS ARE GIVEN TO INELIGIBLES
description: WASHINGTON Aug. 27 (AP)Some $18.6 million worth of food stamps, roughly 4.4 percent of the total paid out, went to families not entitled to receive them in each of the last six months of last year, Agriculture Department auditors have reported.

title: Wendy Johnson, Law Student, Planning Wedding Next June to Craig Williamson
description: Helen Wendell Johnson and Craig Robert Williamson, graduates of Princeton University, plan to be married next June.

title: POLICE FEEL SNIPER KILLED 6 AT RANDOM
description: HACKETTSTOWN. N. J., Aug. 27A young riflenian who killed six persons from ambush and shot himself to death as the police cluscd in yesterday selected his victims at random as they jogged, strolled or rode motorcycles near a railroad track. He shot each repeatedly and dragged the bodies into bushes as he lay in wait for the next victim.

title: An Island Away From the Island
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R.I. TWO years ago, during one of their regular hopping from porttoport boating stopovers here, Katie and Jack Maloney of Huntington Bay got fogged in on this tiny island that guards the eastern entrance to Long Island Sound.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: MASS MARKET

title: Book Review
description: August 28, 1977

title: Susan Jane Fiore Bride of Dr. Jack S. Shields
description: Susan Jane Fiore, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank A. Fiore of Ossining, N.Y., was married yesterday evening to Dr. Jack S. Shields, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Shields of Bridgeton, N.J. The Rev. Joseph Casey, Roman Catholic chaplain at Fairleigh Dickinson University, where the bride is a student, and Rabbi Julius Rosenthal officiated at the ceremony in the Hilton Inn in Tarrytown, N.Y.

title: 43Day Toledo School Furlough Set
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Aug. 27A 43day furlough for 55,000 public school students in this Lake Erie city has been ordered by the Ohio Superintendent of Public Instruction, Dr. Franklin Walters.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: THERE is no doubt about it. Atlantic City is going to love me. I'm married, have two children, a fourbedroom house with a fat, 30year mortgage, two cars that break down regularly, a good job and a good salary.

title: Irwin Keeps 5Shot Lead At Pinehurst
description: PINEHLURST, INC., Aug. 27 (AP)Hale Irwin slashed and chopped his way to a doublebogey 6 on the final hole today but, with a twounderpar 69, retained a fiveshot lead after the third round of the 5250,000 Hall of Fame Classic.

title: At Least U.S.Israeli Differences Are Now Out in the Open
description: In the nearly 30 years since the United States became the first nation to extend formal recognition to the state of Israel, Washington and Jerusalem have been linked in an unwritten alliance that may be unique in the modern history of nations. This special relationship, as it is often called, has survived the strains of an oil embargo, four Middle Eastern wars, seven American administrations and countless wrangles between the two governments over issues large and small. Its tangible expression has been awesome: SI2.7 billion in economic and military aid, including an arsenal of modern weaponry, and political support that has included the use of the United States veto in the United Nations Security Council six times in the last five years.

title: YOUNG AND OWEN TALK WITH BLACK LEADERS
description: LUSAKA. Zambia, Aug. 27In eight hours of talks today Dr. David Owen and Andrew Young met with Rhodesian nationalists and leaders of black African nations to discuss a United StatesBritish plan to settle the Rhodesian dispute that included the removal of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith.

title: Home
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y.Soon it'll be time for my annual visit to the home place, the Iowa farm 40 miles northeast of Sioux City where I grew up and where my uncle still lives. For 30 years I've been making the pilgrimage from various parts of the country, each time telling myself, most likely this'll be the last. I usually go in early fall when the nights are crisp, the days golden, and the question, How're the crops this year? has largely been resolved.

title: GARDENING
description: ALTHOUGH the hot, humid days of summer may linger into September, it is time to prepare for fall in your garden. For one thing, from now until the middle of next month is the best time of the year to renovate and reseed a lawn.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ART

title: Weddings
description: RosenBrauer

title: High Tides Around New York
description: DAYLIGHT SAVING TIME

title: Kennedy Net Draws Stars and Idolaters
description: Like bees at the honey festival, starryeyed people swarmed over Forest Hills Stadium yesterday trying to get a look at the big names in the Robert F. Kennedy procelebrity tennis tournament.

title: SCIENCE FICTION
description: By Doris Piserchia. 204 pp. New York: DAW Books. Paper. $1.50.

title: Junior Jumper Competition Expands to 3Part Event
description: There are only two problems to be solved annually in conducting the United States junior international equestrian competition, Jim Walsh ohserved the other day. Money and horses, he said with a smile. They've been there ever since I became associated with competition nine years ago and I guess they'll be around long after I'm gone.

title: Turkish Politics and Proverbs
description: ISTANBULTurkey is rapidly approaching the brink of bankruptcy as unsettled bills pile up, foreign firms refuse to sell needed equipment here for fear of nonpayment, and a breakdown in the hydroelectric system has necessitated nationwide restrictions in power usage for several hours a day.

title: Stylish Excursion Planned for Cup Races
description: For Operation Sail, Peter Kappel came up with Operation Steam, the train and boat excursion to view the tall ships. For the America's Cup, he has a similar venture, reminiscent of the days in which taking a vacation meant heading north from Grand Central to one's yacht in a private railroad car.

title: Realty News
description: The International Business Machines Corporation has almost doubled its space in the Westchester One office building in White Plains, N. Y.

title: Randi Joy Cahan Is Engaged To Dr. Frederic Mark Ettner
description: Mr. and Mrs. Sydney W. Cahan of Lincolnwood, III., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Randi Joy Cahan, to Dr. Frederic Mark Ettner of Chicago, son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Ettner of White Plains.

title: Guest Observer
description: Instantly upon hearing the cries for help, Gus the newsboy dropped his bundle of papers and dashed into the street. Charging toward him at full steam was a runaway mare, to whose neck clung a shrieking young woman. Gus stood his ground and when the mare was within striking distance, he punched it on the nose, halting the animal in its tracks.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Republicans Urged. To Reach Out

title: The Social Value of CourtApproved Wiretapping
description: WASHINGTONIn 1968, the Congress passed the Omnibus Crime Control Act, which provided, under its Title III, for courtapproved wiretaps by lawenforcement authorities. The Congress perceived that such a capability, strictly controlled, was essential to proper and effective enforcement of criminal laws. To put it into today's popular terminology, the Congress provided clear guidelines to be followed in authorizing wiretaps.

title: MRS. ABZUG ASSAILS CONDITIONS IN PARKS
description: Charging that New York City's parks were badly maintained, poorly staffed, usually dirty and often unsafe. Bella S. Abzug yesterday released a 12point program that she said would restore New York's open spaces to their former glory.

title: Kuwait Freeing Crippled Hijacker
description: KUWAIT, Aug. 28 (Reuters)  The Kuwaiti Government today ordered the release on humanitarian grounds of a crippled Lebanese who hijacked a plane in a wheelchair last June, officials announced. Nasser Mohammed All Abu Khalid, 27 years old, hijacked a Middle East Airlines plane on a flight from Beirut and was arrested after it landed in Kuwait.

title: Abigail M. Kristt, Nurse, Bride of Louis Silverstein
description: Abigail Meredith Kristt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Kristt of White Plains, was married yesterday to Louis Silverstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Silverstein of Havre de Grace, Md. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Ervin Preis at Emerald Gardens in Baltimore.

title: NBC's Guided Tour of Old Studios To Lapse Into Nostalgia Sunday
description: In a tiny, windowless room tucked away in the recesses of Rockefeller Center, the wind howls, thunder crashes, and the sound of hoofbeats can be heard in the distance. It's an old NBC radio soundeffects room, and you'd better hurry if you want to see and hear it. After this Sunday, NBC is discontinuing the studio tour sit began in 1933.

title: Stage Activity Up for '7677
description: Broadway is flourishing, Off Broadway is continuing to decline and longrun Broadway offerings continue to make money, according to an analysis of the 197677 theater season released yesterday by State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz. But producing shows on Broadway remains a hazardous undertaking that can be seen by the fact, cited in the report, that 15 productions, capitalized at $4,473,000 lost $3,431,200.

title: Beame Finds Friends as He Seeks Sidewalk Reaction to S.E.C. Report
description: Mayor Beame tested the sidewalk reaction to himself yesterdayafter publication of a Federal report criticizing his role in the city's fiscal tribulationsand found it to be friendly.

title: Ogaden Rebels Gaining Support Against Ethiopians
description: IN THE OGADEN. Ethiopia, Aug. 28 (AP)Mahmoud Alim stood in the gentle desert breeze of the southern Ogaden and gazed at the horizon of sand, rocks and scrub brush.

title: $15,000 for Envelope On Lindbergh Flight
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 28An envelope carried by Charles A. Lindbergh on his 1927 trans  Atlantic flight brought $15,000 at auction here today.

title: Cosmos Win Soccer Title
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 28The Cosmos celebrated Pele's last North American Soccer League game today by winning the league championship game, 21, from the Seattle Sounders.

title: Coed Talent Scouting To Find Volunteers
description: It never hurts for a nonprofit organization to have an adman, or woman, on its board of directors. And when it has both, the results can be even better.

title: Man Posing as Guard Robs Store
description: RADNOR. Pa., Aug. 28 (UPI)A man posing as a Brink's security guard yesterday walked out of a Sears, Roebuck & Company store with almost $53,000 in cash and checks. A police spokesman said, He just walked up the cashier and asked for the money. The girl reached down and gave him two bags and he signed the books as is the policy.

title: Cosmos Win Soccer Title
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 28The Cosmos celebrated Pel's last North American Soccer League game today by winning the league championship game, 21, from the Seattle Sounders.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Quarrels at Home Cited as Cause in Jersey Shootings
description: HACKETTSTOWN, N. J., Aug. 28The first assistant prosecutor for Warren County said tonight that, Although the specific motive behind the murders of six persons by a sniper here remained a mystery, the suspect's violent behavior might have been touched off by quarrels at home.

description: AT CHAGRIN FALLS, OHIO

description: SATURDAY NIGHT AT IRVING. TEX. Cowboys 23, Colts 21
