title: Bridge:
description: McAFEE, N.J., Aug. 28  A Boston expert seemed on the way to his second title as the New YorkNew Jersey regional championships went into its fifth and final day today at the Playboy Club here. Steve Sion of Boston, who had already won the mixed pair title Friday with Joyce Lilie of Woodmere, L.I., was a member of the team leading into the final session of the Swiss teams.

title: Dr. Ruth Nass Bride Of Theodore Gross
description: Dr. Ruth Nass, a fellow in pediatric neurology at the Neurological Institute of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center, was married yesterday to Theodore Gross. a freelance writer.

title: CORRECTION
description: In the announcement of Deborah Gayl Sorcher's marriage to Bruce Martin Berman in The New York Times last Monday, the bride's first name was inadvertently omitted.

title: U.S.SOVIET EXCHANGE ABOUT SOUTH AFRICA SAID TO IMPROVE TIES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28Cooperation earlier this month between the Soviet Union and the United States in dissuading South Africa from proceeding with a nuclear bomb test has contributed, to an easing in relations between the Carter Administration and the Kremlin, highranking White House officials said today.

title: Tennis
description: Tennis

title: Clark Resumes His Walking Campaign in Iowa
description: BURLINGTON, Iowa, Aug. 28The short, chunky man in the yellow poncho was well off the roadway of Highway 61, but drivers still honked their horns and waved. Senator Dick Clark waved back, frustrated that the downpour that came too late for the parched corn fields kept people from stopping to chat.

title: Envoys Preparing To Meet Vorster, Take Firm Stance
description: JOHANNESBURG. Aug 28 (Reuters)Andrew Young of the United States and David Owen of Britain arrived here tonight on the latest stage of their search for peace in Rhodesia and declared that there would be no deals with South Africa.

title: Proxmire Backs S.E.C. Against Beame Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28  Senator William Proxmire, the head of the Banking Committee, said today that he did not think there was any political motivation in the Securities and Exchange Commission report on New York City's fiscal crisis.

title: Hassler and Bird Stifle Orioles, 50, as Royals Extend Lead to 3 Games
description: The bid by the Kansas City Royals to win their second straight Western Division championship in the American League is strengthening as the teams approach the final month of play.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Laurie Anderson: Mostly Pop
description: Laurie Anderson, who gave a performance at the old United states Customs House yesterday afternoon as part of the continuing Custom and Culture series, is a pop artist in a strange and interasting sense. Her overt orientation is not pop. She is part of the CoHo gestalt and usually works at the Kitchen or similar avantgarde performing spaces. She mixes her media almost profligately, throwing electronics, film, spoken words and her own singing and violin playing into a single piece. But ultimately, the pop aspects of her work dominate it.

title: Whites Warned as Racial Violence Erupts at Black Festival in London
description: LONDON. Aug. 28 (Reuters)London's West Indian carnival erupted into violence tonight as black youths roamed through the Notting Hill district of the city, apparently attacking whites at random.

title: Family of Three Burned in Arson Laid to Man at Wrong Apartment
description: A couple and their 2yearold daughter were burned and suffered smoke inhalation when an unidentified man ignited gasoline he had poured in front of their fifthfloor apartment at 312 East 106th Street while they were asleep.

title: PeakHour Toll Rise Studied by Port Unit
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey will study the possibility of charging higher bridge and tunnel tolls during peak traffic periods, a Port Authority spokesman said yesterday.

title: Commodities
description: The major question wheat and corn futures traders have been pondering over the last year was how much lower grain prices would fall. Last week, many grain traders believed they had the answer.

title: GOLDIN REBUTS S.E.C., CITING HIS WARNINGS ON FINANCIAL CRISIS
description: New York City's Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin, forcefully denied yesterday the Securities and Exchange Commission's conclusion that he had misled the public about the city's financial condition, and he asserted that he had repeatedly warned of unsound fiscal practices.

title: Electric Bills for Con Ed Users Were Triple Those Paid Upstate
description: ALBANY, Aug. 28Users of electricity in New York City and Westchester County paid almost three times as much for each kilowatthour in 1976 as did many upstate consumers, according to a report released by the Public Service Commission.

title: John H. Muller, Former Official Of Equitable Life, Is Dead at 78
description: John H. Muller, a former senior vice president of the Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States, died yesterday at his home in Sea Girt, N.J. He was 78 years old.

title: 10 Women Are Due to Win Air Force Wings
description: WILLIAMS AIR FORCE BASE, Ariz. Aug. 26When Kathy LaSauce was growing up on Long Island, she dreamed of going on the stage, and she carried her dream to Ithaca College, where she majored in drama.

title: A British Sports Car Pioneer Again Looks Westward
description: LONDON  Business Opportunity: American partner sought for new venture to manufacture sports cars in United States. Experienced (79 years old) British entrepreneur and former racing driver lacks capital but can supply design team, which has recently been working on windmills. Contact D.M. Healey, Feock. Cornwall.

title: Picnic Offers a Glimpse of Life In Princeton's LowRent Project
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Aug. 28  A glimpse at how, and where, Princeton's lees affluent residents live was provided at a picnic today for lowincome and middleincome employees in town.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 16yearold girl held on several felony charges escaped last night from the Correctional Institution for Women on Pikers Island, according to a spokesman for the City Department of Correction.

title: BUSINESS AID SOUGHT BY CARTER ON CANAL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (UPI)The Carter Administration will seek the support of businessmen with interests in the Panama Canal and will use volunteers from last year's Presidential campaign in an effort to win public backing for the new Canal treaties, Administration sources said today.

title: CrossCountry Jogger Starting From City Hall Today for West Coast
description: People have been giving Tom McGrath strange looks lately. The 27yearold runner does not talk to himself in public. He has not hijacked a plane or scaled a skyscraper. But the strange looks began when he walked into Texaco's Touring Center in New York City several months ago and asked the man behind the desk to plot a jogging trip across the United States for him.

title: Carl W. Peterson, Retired Justice Of State Supreme Court, at 79
description: Carl W. Peterson, a retired justice of thee New York State Supreme Court, died yesterday at Mohawk Valley General Hospital, in Ilion, N.Y. He was 79 years old.

title: A Tenant Checks Out, Leaving 7,000 Library Books
description: A Queens building superintendent, himself a former librarian, yesterday reported finding over 7,000, maybe 10.000 costly technical books from public libraries in shopping bags and piles in the otherwise nearly bare apartment of an absconded tenant.

title: Sadri Young Masters Victor
description: MANHASSET, L.T., Aug. 28 (AP)John Sadri of Charlotte, N.C., scored a 57, 64, 75 victory over Mel Purcell of Murray, Ky., today in the singles final of the International Young Masters tennis championships. Purcell led 42 and 40 in the third set, but Sadri came back and tied the score, then won with a service break in the 12th game.

title: ISRAEL DECLINES COMMENT ON PALESTINIANS' ACTION
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 28Israeli officials reacted to the Palestine Liberation Organization's refusal on Friday to accept Security Council Resolution 242 by saying, in effect, So what?

title: Market Place
description: It is still debatable whether the little guy or the arbsarbitragersheld the key hi the monumental battle for Babcock & Wilcox that was concluded last Thursday, but one thing is certainthere has hardly been a case in the annals of modern business in which the arbitragers risked less in pursuit of gain.

title: Expert Tells of Stimuli Perilous to the Obese
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 28 (AP)Describing a kind of vicious circle, a Yale psychologist who has written on obesity said at the annual meeting of the American Psychological Association here today that once a person becomes overweight, he is likely to become highly, sometimes uncontrollably responsive to external foodrelevant stimuli.

title: Miss Lazear Bride Of Daniel Okrent
description: Rebecca Lazear, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lazear of West. Hartford, Conn., and Guttyhunk, Mass., was married yesterday to Daniel Okrent, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Okrent of Southfield, Mich. The ceremony was performed at the Lazear home in Cuttyhunk by the Rev. Richard Kellaway, a UnitarianUniversalist minister.

title: Only Black in Philharmonic Is Resigning After 15 Years
description: Sanford Allen, the only black to become a member of the New York Philharmonic during its 133year history, has resigned. Mi. Allen, a 38yearold violinist who joined the orchestra in 1962, said he was simply tired of being a symbol. He has decided to pursue a new career as a freelance violinist and soloist.

title: Statement of the New York Comptroller
description: Following is the text of a statement made at a news conference by Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin on a report issued by the Securities and Exchange Commission on the transactions in securities of New York City:

title: SPECULATION ON POPE: WILL HE RESIGN AT 80?
description: CASTEL GANDOLFO, Italy, Aug. 28Pope Paul VI will be 80 years old next month, and speculation is mounting that he may become the first pontiff in modem history to resign.

title: Opponent of Distribution Formula For Federal Aid Steps Up Attack
description: MONTCLAIR, Aug. 26A Town Commissioner here is intensifying his fiveyearlong campaign to correct what he considers are inequities in the distribution of Federal revenuesharing money that allows diversion of the grants to New Jersey's townships at the expense of the state's needy cities.

title: Monmouth
description: Horses listed in order of post positions

title: Japanese Women Find Forum in Film Maker's TV Show
description: TOKYO, Aug. 26  The television show opens with a view of the woman guest. Her identity is hidden from viewers by camera angle or rippled glass, but she is obviously sobbing and wiping her eyes.

title: Bayi Wins 1.500 Meters; Kotinek Takes High Jump
description: RIETA, Italy. Aug. 28 (AP)Filbert Bayi of Tanzania won the 1,500 meters in 3 minutes 37.4 seconds today at the City of Rieti track and field meet The time was more than five seconds slower than Bayi's world mark of 3:32.2.

title: CORRECTION
description: In the announcement of Deborah Gayl Sorcher's marriage to Bruce Martin Berman in The New York Times last Monday, the bride's first name was inadvertently omitted.

title: Georgia Murder Trial Opening; Defense Hopes for Black Jurors
description: DAWSON, Ga., Aug. 28Jury selection in the murder trial of the socalled Dawson Five is to begin here tomorrow. The defense lawyers are confident that an allblack or predominantly black jury can be seated.

title: JUDGMENT REVERSED FOR MERRILL LYNCH
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 28 (AP)A $3.4 million judgment against Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith was reversed over the weekend by a threejudge panel of the Eighth United States Circuit Court of Appeals.

title: Ormandy, at Saratoga, Leads Typical Philadelphia Concert
description: It was a beautiful evening for an outdoor concert at the Saratoga Performing Arts Center on Friday might  but then, one can scarcely imagine an evening that would not he enjoyable in the spacious, handgomely landscaped park on the edge of this historical upstate resort town. Satatoga's amphitheater lies provided a congenial summer home for the Philadelphia Orchestra ever since the center opened 12 years ago, and this imposing structure is a model of its kind.

title: New York Wins U.S.O.C. Praise; Louisiana Out
description: While New York City was compared favorably with Mexico City, Munich and Montreal as a potential Olympic site by officials of the United States Olympic Committee, New Orleans withdrew from the bidding for the 1984 Summer Games yesterday.

title: ExU.S. Comptroller Gave Senate Limited Data, Lance Lawyer Says
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Acting Comptroller of the Currency, Robert Bloom, gave a Senate committee studying Bert Lance's nomination as Budget Director only the limited information on Mr. Lance's background that he used in press releases, Mr. Lance's lawyer said in response to questions today.

title: Swimming
description: AT EAST BERLIN U.S. Vs. EAST GERMANY

title: Debrah Lee Charatan Wed to Bradley Berger
description: The marriage of Debrah Lee Charatan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Charatan of Howard Beach, Queens, to Bradley Ian Berger took place yesterday in Ardsley, N.Y. Rabbi Jeffrey Troodler performed the ceremony at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Howard C. Berger. parents of the bridegroom.

title: AT BROOKLINE, MASS.
description: U.S. PRO CHAMPIONSHIP Quarterfinals

title: Argentine Captures 38th Match in Row, 61, 62
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Aug. 28Who will stop Guillermo Vilas? Not John McEnroe. The precocious 18yearold lefthander from Queens became Vilas's 38th straight victim on clay today when he lost, 61, 62, in the Lionel Tennis Week roundrobin tournament at the Westchester Country Club.

title: Western New York Tries To Offset Economic Blows
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 28  The Bethlehem Steel Corporation's plans to cut production by 40 percent and lay off 3,500 workers at its Lackawanna plant near here could mean a $325 million longterm loss for the state's far western corner, Erie and Niagara Counties.

title: Of Fat Years and Lean Yearsand Food Reserves
description: The Carter Administration should build a sizable domestic grain reserve now. A reserve of at least 25 million tons of wheat and feed grains is in the United States' selfinterest and that of world food security. To delay may mean to miss the opportunity completely to build stocks, and could spawn another round of skyrocketing food prices.

title: Alcoa Reports Two Major Orders
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 28The Aluminum Company of America said today it had received two major orders. They are for 15 million pounds of aluminum mill products for two liquified natural gas ships and more than 2,000 miles of coiled drawn tubing to be used in six cryogenic heat exchanges for a liquified gas plant in Algeria. The contracts were awarded to Alcoa by General Dynamics of Quincy, Mass., and Air Products Inc., of Allentown, Pa.

title: Assad Favors Peace With Israel, But Rejects Any Closer Relations
description: LATAKIA, Syria, Aug. 26President Hafez alAssad of Syria said today that he was ready to sign a peace agreement ending the state of war with Israel, but lie rejected President Carter's idea of a normalization of relations until Israel eliminated its expansionist character.

title: Miss Wade At Core of Apple Title
description: PHOENIX, Aug. 28Virginia Wade's 60 blitz of Chris Evert was both the key element and the main topic of conversation as the New York Apples won their second straight World Team Tennis championship here last night.

title: 62 Young Masters Vie in Chess Tourney
description: PARAMUS, Aug. 28They arrived wearing Little League hats and untied tennis shoes. Sixtytwo young wizards of the grownup game of chess hunched over fullsize chessboards, with puzzled expressions on their faces as they slid their kings, queens and pawns from square to square in an effort to outmaneuver their opponents.

title: Lip Service Pressing In On English
description: LONDON, Aug. 26 (Reuters)England has been seized by a mass outbreak of social kissing, according to one of Britain's most august publications, and worried Englishmen are asking whether their traditional reserve has finally cracked.

title: Program Set to Help Plaintiffs Collect Small Claims
description: A new program to help plaintiffs who have trouble collecting awards won in New York City's SmallClaims Courts was announced yesterday by the city's Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: Australian Cattleman Disputes A Salmonella Link to Native Beef
description: ROCKHAMPTON, Australia, Aug 28. (Reuters)A leading Australian cattleman has rejected a charge that Australian beef could be responsible for outbreaks of salmonella food poisoning in the United States.

title: Toll Raised in Indonesian Quake
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 28 (AP)Government officials today raised to 187 the number of deaths from the powerful earthquake that struck eastern Indonesia on Aug. 19, but they said there were no new casualties from last week's major aftershocks. The authorities said 98 persons had been injured in the earthquake and 76 were reported missing.

title: 18 Die in Indian Wreck
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 28 (UPI)A speeding express train rammed into a threewheeled truck today near Allahabad, killing 18 persons, according to the national news agency, Samachar.

title: Italian Satellite Put in Position
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Aug. 28 (UPI)A spacecraft motor was fired yesterday to position Sirio, Italy's first experimental communication satellite, in a stationary orbit 22,300 miles from Earth. The motor was fired upon command from the Goddard Space Flight Center at Greenbelt, Md. where engineers will check out the satellite for the next 30 to 45 days. Then, control of the spacecraft will be turned over to Telespazio, a control center at Fucino, Italy.

title: Mary Jack Lloyd Is Wed to Dr. Alvin Stanley Wald
description: Mary Jack Lloyd, daughter of Enoch Light of Redding, Conn, and New York and the late Mary Danis Light, was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Alvin Stanley Wald, son of Ida Nemiro Wald of the Bronx and the late Hyman Wald. Rabbi David Posner performed the ceremony in Temple EmanuEl.

title: AntiApartheid Delegates Urge Tennis Cup Boycotts
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 28Delegates to the World Conference for Action Against Apartheid approved a recommendation urging all nations to withdraw from the Davis Cup and Federation Cup until South Africa is expelled from the International Tennis Federation.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, AUGUST 29, 1977

title: The Standings
description: Monday, August 29, 1977

title: Condor Loses Lead
description: PORTSMOUTH, England, Aug. 28 (AP)The British yacht Condor, which had swept to an early lead in the 27,000  mile Whitbread around  theworld race, dropped to second place today.

title: Lebanon Is Planning a Campaign To Reduce Drug Addiction Problem
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 28 (Reuters)Lebanon is preparing a campaign to cornbat the drugaddiction problem that that worsened during the country's recent civil war, a Government minister said today.

title: Most Israelis Support Settlement In Occupied West Bank, Poll Says
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 28 (Reuters)More than twothirds of Israel's Jewish population favors continued Governmentbacked Jewish settlement of the occupied West Bank of the Jordan, according to a poll published today.

title: Chess:
description: After a grim struggle. Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union, a former world champion, won his semifinal Candidate's Match with the Hungarian grandmaster Lajos Portisch in Geneva by a score of 86.

title: A Slapdash Approach to Nuclear Plants
description: The Carter Administration's effort to reform nuclear licensing procedures is on an erratic course. When the President presented his energy program to Congress last April, he lamented that it should not take 10 years to license and build a nuclear plant in this country when it supposedly took only three years in Japan. His aides promised a thorough review and study of a process they described as unsatisfactory to all concernedgovernment, utilities, and citizen groups concerned about safety and environmental issues.

title: Deaths
description: ADAMSMary Roberts, at Utica, N. Y., on Aug. 6, 197?? after a prier illness. The beloved wile of Howard C. Adams, devoted mother of Katharine A. ??ras ?? Peter k. Adams, grandmother of lan Bouras, daughter or Cora Roberts, sister of Martin Roberts. Memorial Service at Grace Church Lacy Chapel, Utica, N. Y., Aug. 2., 1977 at 11 A.M. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the Grosvenor Neighborhood House, 35 E. 72d Sr., N. Y. C. For information, contact Elwood T. Day Funeral Home, 1222 State St. Utica, N. Y.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Giants' Offense Faces Key Test Against Bills
description: The Giants play the buffalo Bills tonight at the Meadowlands, in the time of the preseason when the games are not so meaningless.

title: How to Assure a Long Life
description: LONDONThe purchase of a pair of handmade shoes is only the beginning. Like a spouse upon marriage, they demand loving care from then on.

title: Basques Mark End Of Freedom March At Huge Legal Rally
description: PAMPLONA, Spain, Aug. 28 (AP)About 75,000 demonstrators chanting Long live Basque liberty! converged on a rainy hillside today to demand autonomy and political freedom in the largest authorized rally by Basque nationalists since the Spanish Civil War.

title: In Memoriam
description: ADELMANArthur A. In everlasting loving memory of our dear one. The source of so much toy and wisdom and good friendship.

title: Rock: The Cosmic Echoes Satisfy
description: Lonnie Liston Smith and the Cosmic Echos returned to Smucker's, the Brooklyn club where they recorded their recent live album, over the weekend. The crowds were large and enthusiastic, and the group responded with unified and stylistically varied ensemble playing. Widely criticized during their early days for purveying a diluted, vapid brand of jazzrock, the Cosmic Echos have quietly become one of the most musical and satisfying bands in their field.

title: EDWARD J. ENRIGHT
description: Edward J. Enright, a retired stock broker who lived in Fresh Meadows, Queens, died Saturday in Flushing Hospital at the age of 73.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list scheduled for week follows:

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Vance Briefs Carter On His Discussions With Top Chinese
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (UPI)Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance reported to President Carter today that he had made clear to Chinese leaders that the United States would continue to be guided by the Shanghai communiqu in dealing with China.

title: Couple Die in Crash at Airport
description: HORSHAM. Pa., Aug. 28 (AP)An unidentified man and woman were killed and their two daughters seriously injured when their singleengine plane crashed at about 7 P.M. today while making a landing approach at Turner Field, a small airfield here, state police said.

title: Belmont Racing
description: Horses listed In order of pest Positions Letter gesignates OTB listing

title: Small Plane Missing in Alaska
description: ANCHORAGE, Aug. 28 (AP)A private airplane with seven persons aboard was reported missing yesterday on a flight over remote wilderness between Juneau and Anchorage. The twinengine Cessna 411 had been cleared for emergency landing at Yakutat, about 150 to 200 miles from Juneau. The pilot had radioed that the craft had lost one engine. The occupants were not immediately identified, but the plane was said to belong to Eagle Flight Center of Hillsboro, Ore.

title: Yarborough Triumphs
description: RISTOL, Tenn., Aug. 28 (AP)Cale Yarborough of Timmonsville, S.C., won his fourth straight Grand National stockcar race by capturing the Volunteer 400 at Bristol International Speedway today.

title: Oshima's Troubles
description: TOKYO, Aug. 26 The controversy surrounding his film, In the Realm of the Senses, is only part of the trouble that faces Nagisa Oshima.

title: U.S. Takes Berlin Swim; Records Fall
description: EAST BERLIN, Aug. 28 (UPI)Three world marks tumbled today, the last day of a twoday meet, as the United States, led by a stunning record performance from its 400meter freestyle relay quartet, defeated East Germany, 176168.

title: PREDICTED RATE RISE BY FEDERAL RESERVE APPEARS DISCOUNTED
description: The credit markets advanced last week for the second consecutive week, and the Federal Reserve contributed to the trend by not raising the interest rates most directly under its controlthe discount rate and the Federal funds rate.

title: Farm Workers Celebrate the Past And Plan Expansion at Convention
description: FRESNO, Calif., Aug. 28The United Farm Workers of America ended its third convention here today with a mixture of exuberance and seriousness that has pervaded this threeday meeting.

title: Jets Working on the Run (59 Rushes Against Saints)
description: Why won't people believe the Jets?

title: GOLDIN REBUTS S.E.C, CITING HIS WARNINGS ON FINANCIAL CRISIS
description: New York City's Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin, forcefully denied yesterday the Securities and Exchange Commission's conclusion that he had misled the public about the city's financial condition, and he asserted that he had repeatedly warned of unsound fiscal practices.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 28 (Reuters)  An emergency team of American engineers today began surveying damage and planning reconstruction work after a weekend blaze that swept through sections of the United States Embassy building here that housed classified material.

title: Miss Navratilova Takes Final
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Aug. 28Martina Navratilova started slowly, then unleashed devastating power and routed Mima Jausovec today in the Women's Tennis Classic, 36, 62, 61. Miss Navratilova, ranked second in the world, won $6,000 in her sixth singles championship of the year.

title: CON EDISON ADMITS ITS OPERATOR ERRED
description: In the final moment before the blackout of July 13, a system operator for the Consolidated Edison Company may not have pushed the buttons properly to cut off some customers to avert the collapse of the entire electrical system, according to the utility's own analysis of the power failure.

title: Retreat Still Tough 201 Years After Washington's Defeat
description: The problem facing George Washington on the night of Aug. 28. 1776, was how to remove 9.000 of his soldiers across the East River after their defeat at the Battle of Long Island.

title: Outside the Law?
description: Griffin Bell, who returns this week from a brief vacation, must deal soon with what may be the prickliest question he has faced as Attorney General: whether to let a grand jury indict Richard Helms, former Director of Central Intelligence, for perjury.

title: Study by Aspin Disputes Navy Estimates of Strength
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28A new study by a Congressman shows that contrary to repeated predictions by the Navy, the size of this country's naval combat fleet continues to decline and probably will do so at least until 1980.

title: Books of The Times
description: The Last Best Hope is a huge, baggy, voracious novel that seeks nothing less than to swallow the 1960's whole. This ambition is going to land Peter Tauber in trouble. For one thing, the decade was more than the digestive tract of any single novel can handle. For another, everybody else thinks he or she owns the 1960's, and nobody is going to take Mr. Tauber's many words at face value. In trying to tell us too much, he risks our having nodded off, or having left the room in a rage, just when he gets to the good parts.

title: A High Syrian Calls Hope for Peace Thin
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 28 (Reuters) The Syrian Information Minister, Ahmed Iskandar, has issued a thinly veiled call to the Arabs to go to war with Israel if current efforts to reach a peaceful solution to the Middle East conflict fail.

title: Beame Finds Friends as He Seeks Sidewalk Reaction to S.E.C. Report
description: Mayor Beame tested the sidewalk reaction to himself yesterdayafter publication of a Federal report criticizing his role in the city's fiscal tribulationsand found it to be friendly.

title: De Gustibus: A Provencal Herb Recipe
description: A short while ago a reader wrote to ask if we could identify or offer a formula for what are known commercially as herbes de Provence. These are the packaged herbs to be found in fancy food shops around the world, including Fauchon's in Paris and Bloomingdale's in New York.

title: New Season for SALT
description: President Carter's efforts to improve deteriorating SovietAmerican relations seem to be achieving results. His conciliatory Charleston speech in July has now received a public response from President Brezhnev, judged favorable by Washington; and Soviet Ambassador Dobrynin has returned from Moscow for a private followup. Personal attacks on Mr. Carter in the Soviet press have ceased. Both sides are muting public differences. What this means is that the atmosphere is now right, for the first time since January, to move beyond the stalled 1974 Vladivostok accords and to complete SALT II, the critical second strategic arms limitation treaty, It is a propitious time to give control of nuclear arms priority over other SovietAmerican problems.

title: CON EDISON ADMITS ITS OPERATOR ERRED
description: In the final moment before the blackout of July 13, a system operator for the Consolidated Edison Company may not have pushed the buttons properly to cut off some customers to avert the collapse of the entire electrical system, according to the utility's own analysis of the power failure.

title: Patriots' Field Goal Beats Steelers, 1310
description: FOXBORO Mass., Aug. 28 (UPI)John Smith kicked a 32yard field goal after 4:36 of overtime today to give the New England Patriots a 1310 victory over the Pittsburgh steelers in a National Football League exhibition game.

title: Mental Patient Recaptured
description: MORIARTY, N.M., Aug. 28 (AP)An escaped mental patient left a ranch house and was arrested last night, 30 hours after he took an 84yearold man hostage and seven hours after he released him. The police threw tear gas shells into the house and then arrested Fred Patrick Creley, 38, as he stumbled from the house. No shots were fired and no injuries were reported. Earlier yesterday, Mr. Creley had released unharmed Joe Abrahams, the Moriarty rancher he held prisoner for more than 23 hours.

title: Nearby Yachting Results
description: AT BELLE HAVEN CLUB

title: U.S. Art in ScotlandBut Why?
description: EDINBURGH  Scotland seems an unlikely place to study the roots of modern American painting, but they are being vividly traced on the walls of the Royal Scottish Academy.

title: Around the Nation
description: DETROIT, Aug. 28 (AP)  Striking workers at a vital General Motors parts complex in Indiana returned to their jobs today after a contract settlement early this morning. But 13,600 General Motors workers remained laid off, due to plant shutdowns brought on by the walkout.

title: Car to Air in Breathtaking Stunt
Braves Extend Met Loss Streak to 5
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 28When the Mets got here Friday, the Atlanta Braves were one of the few teams in baseball whose fortunes were worse than those of Joe Torre's club. When the Mets left today, though, the Braves were on their longest winning streak of the season.

title: Canada Developers Face Glut of Offices
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 24With the Canadian economy in acute disarray, building developers have been left with millions of square feet of empty and unwanted office space on their hands in principal cities across the country, according to sources in the industry.

title: Mime and Middle Eastern Dance
description: Lincoln Center Out of Doors gives away the entertainment that New Yorkers ordinarily pay substantially for. On Saturday, bargain hunters by the hundreds saw Morocco and the Richard Morse Mime Theater at the fountain and even had a free lesson in Middle Eastern dancing thrown in by Morocco, a nom de danse for Carolina Varga Dinicu.

title: NearSlavery Is Found in Southern Migrant Camps
description: BENSON, N.C., Aug. 28Despite a substantial tightening of the nation's 14yearold migrant worker protection laws in 1974, many migrants continue to live in squalor and work under conditions that legal aid officials here describe as little better than slavery.

title: NearSlavery Is Found in Southern Migrant Camps
description: BENSON, N.C., Aug. 28Despite a substantial tightening of the nation's 14yearold migrant worker protection laws in 1974, many migrants continue to live in squalor and work under conditions that legal aid officials here describe as little better than slavery.

title: Barbara Breitbart, Therapist, Wed to Gary Stuart Bader
description: Barbara Breitbart, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. Robert S. Breitbart of Roslyn Heights and Amagansett, L.I., was married yesterday to Gary Stuart Bader, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Bader of Roslyn. The ceremony was performed in Temple Judea in Manhasset, L.I., by Rabbi Eugene Lipsey.

title: Man Bludgeoned to Death In a Bryant Park Dispute; Pipe Wielder Gets Away
description: A man was bludgeoned to death with a pipe yesterday during an argument in Bryant Park.

title: Molina, Stockton Bow at U.S. Pro Net
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 28 (UPI)Thirdseeded Manuel Orantes of Spain, the topranked surviving player, breezed through his quarterfinal match at the United States Professional tennis championship today, downing Ivan Molina of Colombia. 64, 62, at the Longwood Cricket Club.

title: One for the Hambletonian, Maybe
description: Green Speed won the Yonkers Trot Saturday night, and the Naughton boys plan to keep the triple crown in the family just as they did last year. The triple crown series for trotters began with the $239,000 stake at Yonkers, continues with the $270,000 Hambletonian in DuQuoin, next Saturday and concludes with the $100,000 Kentucky Futurity on the Red Mile in Lexington Oct. 7. Last year Billy Haughton won the first two races with a colt named Steve Lobell and Billy's son Peter finished the job for the family by driving Quick play home first in Kentucky. When Haughton pore got back with Green Speed Saturday night, Haughton fils was in pursuit with Cold Comfort. Green Speed was the favorite at Yonkers and maybe the choice in DuQttoin, but Mrs. Beverly Lloyds of Great Neck, L. I., who owns the colt, didn't make him eligible for the Futurity. So Kentucky the Haughtons chances for a second straight triple crown would depend on Cold Comfort. It isn't easy to execute this sort of pincers movement, and Andy Grant and Del Miller are willing to save the Haughtons the trouble.

title: TEACHERS LAID OFF IN '75 ARE REHIRED
description: Two years of hardship and uncertainty for hundreds of laidoff elementaryschool teachers have ended with their reassignment to teaching positions.

title: Article 1  No Title
Phyllis Rubin Is Bride of Dr. Lewis D. Polk
description: Phyllis Rubin. daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Harry Rubin of Philadelphia, was married there yesterday to Dr. Lewis Polk, Commissioner of the Philadelphia Department of Public Health. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Richard F. Steinbrink at Temple Rodeph Shalom.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A freeze on state school aid proposed by State Senator Raymond H. Bateman of Somerville, the Republican gubernatorial candidate, would increase property taxes by a $100 million, a Democratic lawmaker said this weekend.

title: Rebound Flags Around World
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The world's economic recovery is faltering, uneasily shifting toward a, phase some analysts are calling a growth recession. In western Europe, as growth rates fail to meet economic potential, unemployment has risen to levels without precedent in th last quarter century. Common Market figures show 5.6 million people, or 5.4 percent of the labor force, unemployed in the ninenation economic community last month, up 12 percent in one yar.

title: Sweden Drops Out Of Currency Group
description: FRANKFURT, Aug. 28 (AP)Sweden announced today it was withdrawing temporarily from the sevennation European exchange rate system until its foreign trade and economic situation improved.

title: Republican Elected to House Seat From New Orleans Held by Tonry
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 28Robert L. Livingston Jr., a Republican who was elected yesterday to succeed former Representative Richard A. Tonry, said here last night that the voters in the First Congressional District had chosen him over his Democratic opponent because people were tired of what they were getting and they wanted a change.

title: Bucs Lose 2d Quarterback
description: TAMPA. Fla., Aug. 28 (AP)Tampa Bay's quarterback, Gary Huff, will be out four to six weeks with a leftknee injury suffered in yesterday's game against Atlanta, team officials said today. The Bucs have now lost their top two quarterbacks in two games. Mike Boryla was hurt aweek ago and is out for the season.

title: Rhodesian Leader Appears to Have Changed His Course
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 28By every indication so far, the BritishAmerican initiative on Rhodesia being carried on here this week will fail, but many here whose interests are not involved are questioning whether Prime Minister Ian D. Smith can be blamed as he was when past efforts collapsed. For months journalists who cover Rhodesia at first hand, many of whom regarded Mr. Smith as a headin thesand white supremacist in the decade following his declaration of independence from Britain in 1965 have been coming around to the view that the Prime Minister has made a fundamental change of course.

title: Hanoi Reports Failure to Reach Some Municipal Production Goals
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 28 (Reuters)The city of Hanoi has failed to achieve several municipal production targets this year, the official Vietnam News Agency reported today.

title: Lopez Wins on Knockout
description: STATELINE, Nev., Aug. 28 (AP)The world featherweight champion. Danny (Little Red) Lopez knocked out Mexico's Jorge Altimirano in the sixth round of a scheduled 10rounder this afternoon and declared himself fit for his first title defense Sept. 13 against Jose Torres in Los Angeles. It was his 34th victory against three defeats. He weighed 128 pounds to Altimirano's 130.

title: Nassau Democrats Given Chance for a New Image
description: MINEOLA. L.I.With party primaries less than two weeks away, the Democrats in Nassau County appear to have been handed a golden opportunity to regain the County Executive post and perhaps help shed the party's image as a city party.

title: Peter Altmeier, 79, Helped Draft PostwarCharter for West Germany
description: COBLENZ, West Germany, Aug. 28 (AP) Peter Altmeier, former president of the West German state of RhinelandPalatinate and one of the drafters of the West German Constitution, died today. He was 79.

title: PRINCE REEMERGING ON THE DUTCH SCENE
description: THE HAGUE, Aug. 28 (Reuters)A year after being publicly disgraced by a governmental inquiry into the Lockheed bribery scandal, Prince Bernhard has made a partial comeback in the eyes of the fiercely royalist Dutch public.

title: ExU.S. Comptroller Gave Senate Limited Data, Lance Lawyer Says
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Acting Comptroller of the Currency, Robert Bloom, gave a Senate committee studying Bert Lance's nomination as Budget Director only the limited information on Mr. Lance's background that he used in press releases, Mr. Lance's lawyer said in response to questions today.

title: Indian Artifacts Of 12,000 Years Ago: A Leap for Egos In Connecticut
description: WASHINGTON DEPOT, Conn., Aug. 26Clearcut evidence of human habitation in Connecticut far earlier than had previously been believed has been discovered in a field near the Shepaug River here.

title: Rosilyn Hirschberg, Nurse, Bride of Jonathan E. Myers
description: Rosilyn Ruth Hirschberg, daughter of Jean Topf and the late Benjamin Hirschberg, was married yesterday in the BethEl Chapel of Temple EmanuEl to Jonathan Edward Myers, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Myers of South Orange, N.J. Rabbi Howard A. Berman officiated.

title: Eagles 28, Broncos 24
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 28 (AP)A 90yard kickoff return by a rookie, Wilbert Montgomery and two scoring passes by Ron Jaworski rallied the Philadelphia Eagles to a 2824 victory over the Denver Broncos tonight in a National Football League preseason game.

title: Dance: 3 Premieres by Philobolus
description: The 1977 American Dance Festival ended Saturday night at the Rogers Auditorium in Newport, R.I., with a performance by the Pilobolus Dance Theater, the company that, in recent years, has probably been most closely associated with the Festival. This was its second appearance of the festival, for it also danced last month when the Festival was in its other New England venue, New London, Conn. But in between these two visits, the company sandwiched in what was apparently a highly successful South American tour.

title: U.S. Is Increasing Phone Security To Foil Russians
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26In the last two years, the Federal Government has increased the security of its sensitive telephone calls because of concern about electronic eavesdropping by the Soviet Union in the United States.

title: Irwin Rolls to a 5Stroke Golf Victory
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Aug. 28 (AP)Hale Irwin, thwarted by a computer and facing what he called a mustwin situation, romped to a fivestroke victory today with a threeunderpar 68 in the final round of the Hall of Fame Golf Classic.

title: L. P. Bogorad Weds Cindy E. Schneider
description: Cindy Ellen Schneider, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Philip Schneider of Jamaica Estates, Queens, was married yesterday at the Sephardic Temple in Cedarhurst, L.I., to Leonard Paul Bogorad, son of Dr. and Mrs. Lawrence Bogorad of Lexington, Mass. Rabbi Israel Mowshowitz performed the ceremony, assisted by Cantor Ari Albrecht

title: Mature Israel Settles Down To a Normal Abnormality
description: JERUSALEMSoon after Israel was established its first police chief, Yehiel Sahar, exulted that at last there would be Jewish policemen arresting Jewish prostitutes and Jewish burglars, because in their own country again after two millenniums the Jews could settle down and be just like anybody, a normal nation.

title: GOING OUT Guider
description: THE WAY IT IS Things may have changed in Greenwich Villageand where haven't they changed?but the downtown sector still provides cozily bohemian dividends from the good old days, pools of quiet that seem timeless. There's also a familystyle diversion tonight toward dusk that typifies the spirit of staunch unity now prevalent in certain Village neighborhoods. Outsiders can take in a knockwurstvolleyball dinner set up on the Commerce Street turn near the Cherry Lane Theater, a block and a half west of Seventh Avenue. Visitors with spare time can also sample some continuing bonuses nearby. within short blocks.

title: Court Study Reports 8,500 Evaded Warrants in Detroit Since 1970
description: DETROIT, Aug. 28 (UPI)A court study released yesterday reveals that nearly 8,500 persons, including many charged with murder, rape or other violent crimes, have evaded arrest, forfeited bail or violated probation in Detroit since 1970.

title: Episcopal Rift: Women Priests
description: Long before the Episcopal Church decided to admit women to the priesthood, opponents insisted that they would refuse to accept such a change. Since the church's vote in favor of revision last September, the resistance has built to a point at which a formal rift appears inevitable. Some of the most implacable foes of women in the priesthood have already severed ties with the church and are organizing an effort to form a new church body. Others are remaining in the fold, but warning that their loyalties are waning. Still others are waiting to see how far the rebellion spreads before they decide whether to join it.

title: MARKOOSH A FISCHER, 88; WROTE ABOUT U.S.S.R.
description: Markoosha Fischer, the author of several books on the Soviet Union, died yesterday at St. Vincent's Hospital. She was 88 years old and lived in New York City.

title: China Announces Rehabilitation Of a Minister Who Died Last Year
description: HONG KONG, Monday, Aug. 29 (Reuters)China today posthumously rehabilitated an education minister who was purged in the antirightist campaign last year.

title: Students Get Courses They Like by Creating Them
description: TRENTON, Aug. 28Students at colleges across New Jersey are being encouraged to design their own courses of study for credit toward their degrees. In many cases, one year's student brainstorm shows up in next year's curriculum as a regular course offering.

title: Those Declining Test Scores
description: Why have the scores registered in the Scholastic Aptitude Tests (S.A.T.'s), taken by a million high school seniors each year, been going down steadily since 1963? That question, of considerable interest to educators and parents alike, has now been addressed by a panel appointed by the College Entrance Examination Board, which administers the tests, and headed by former Secretary of Labor Willard Wirtz. Its report combines documentable evidence with intelligent guesses.

title: Seven Candidates Make Democratic Primary for Mayor a Rare Contest
description: Seven candidates  four of them bunched near the lead in the race  have made the Democratic mayoral primary next week a rare contest in which the winner will very likely have about a quarter of the vote and in which 4 or 5 percentage points could make the difference between qualifying or not for the twocandidate runoff primary two weeks later. And, if the conventional political wisdom is correct, the apparent but narrow frontrunners in next week's primaryMayor Beame and former Representative Bella S. Abzugaccording to a New York Times/Channel 2 News survey would both be very vulnerable to either: Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo or Representative Edward I. Koch in the runoff.

title: Yonkers
description: Horses listed In order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: 3 Long Island Men Arrested On Firearms Charges in Florida
description: NEW PORT RICHEY, Fla., Aug. 28 (UPI)Three Long Island men have been arrested on charges of firearms violations by Pasco County, Fla., deputies acting on a tip that a heavily armed Nazi group was in the area.

title: Racing Returns to Belmont Park Today
description: After a recordsetting fourweek meeting at Saratoga in which the highest attendance and handle figures in the 114year history of the track were set, thoroughbred racing in New York returns to Belmont Park today for a sevenweek fall meeting.

title: Advertising
description: Paramount Pictures has had plenty of experience with retail promotions for motion pictures in recent years as a result of its previous activities for The Great Gatsby and King Kong. So when the film distributor decided last April to undertake a massive effort with retail stores in connection with its big Easter 1978 release, Grease, it knew how to get going.

title: A FastGrowing City in Russia Is Enjoying the Siberian Summer
description: NOVOSIBIRSK, U.S.S.R. (Reuters)On a sultry summer evening the mosquitoes bite as hard here in the capital of Siberia as anywhere in the world.

title: U.S. Is Increasing Phone Security To Foil Russians
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26In the last two years, the Federal Government has increased the security of its sensitive telephone calls because of concern about electronic eavesdropping by the Soviet Union in the United States.

title: Indian Wins Tax Fight Based on a 1787 Law
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Aug. 28 (UPI)A Federal judge, upholding an ordinance passed by the Continental Congress in 1787, has ruled that the greatgrandson of an Indian war chief does not have to pay taxes on his land.

title: Handmade Shoes That Fit Like a Glove
description: LONDONHandmade shoes are like a massage, a shameless luxury but attentive to the parts that most appreciate it.

title: Karen Marcuvitz Is Married to Paul Levy
description: Karen Marcuvitz, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. Nathan Marcuvitz of Great Neck, L.I., was married there yesterday to Paul S. Levy, son of Philip. Levy of the Bronx and the late Jane Levy. Rabbi Jerome Davidson performed the ceremony at the Marcuvitz home.

title: Irish Police Believe Arms Route To Ulster May Have Been Broken
description: DUBLIN, Aug, 28 (Reuters)Dublin police believe they may have cut a major route used by the Provisional Irish Republican Army to ferry arms to Northern Ireland, police sources said today.

title: Anne Ireland Married To Kevin J. McCarthy
description: Anne Margaret Ireland and Kevin Joseph McCarthy, 1976 graduates of Bowdoin College, were married yesterday at the home of the bride's mother, Mrs. Charles T. Ireland Jr., in Chappaqua, N.Y. Rabbi Michael Robinson performed the ceremony.

title: U.S.SOVIET EXCHANGE ABOUT SOUTH AFRICA SAID TO IMPROVE TIES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28Cooperation earlier this month between the Soviet Union and the United States in dissuading South Africa from proceeding with a nuclear bomb test has contributed to an easing in relations between the Carter Administration and the Kremlin, highranking White House officials said today.

title: Jackson Bats In Run Yanks Lead by 2
description: Ron Guidry, who became an endangered Yankee last spring because of his unexpectedly poor pitching, won a 10 game yesterday from Dock Ellis, a pitcher who became an irrevocably endangered Yankee last spring because of his predictably tarttongued remarks.

title: SHIPPING/MAILS
description: Incoming

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Lauda Takes Dutch Race After 2 Top Rivals Depart
description: ZANDVOORT, The Netherlands, Aug. 28 (AP)Niki Lauda of Austria won the Dutch Grand Prix in a Ferrari today after his two leading rivals, James Hunt, the current world drivers champion from Britain, and Mario Andretti of Nazareth, Pa., collided on the fifth lap.

title: East German Men Win 5 of 8 Finals in Rowing
description: AMSTERDAM, Aug. 28With Crown Princess Beatrix of the Netherlands and her three sons watching, East Germany did as everyone expected and took five gold, two silver and one bronze medal in the eight events for men contested today in the world rowing championships.

title: 126 Make a Lunar Tour of Washington by Bike
description: It was an invasion by bicycle, and It took place between 2:30 A.M. and 9 A.M. The occasion was an insomniac's tour of the nation's capital, sponsored by an organization of New York City conservationists called Friends of the Parks.

title: Renewed Optimism of Enterprise Crew Is Squelched by Broken Headstay
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 28Despite their precarious position in the America's Cup yachting trials, the men of Enterprise were thinking positively today as they put to sea for a doubleheader against Courageous.

title: The Minimum Wage, Continued
description: As the sampling of letters to the right suggests, our stand against raising the minimum wage didn't win many friends. Readers wonder why we are willing to relegate the working poor to the cruel discipline sweatshop wages.

title: Sav, the Senator Asked, Read Any Fiction Lately?
description: His pulse quickening, the legislator arose. I speak, he thundered, because I cannot remain silent on this matter. Just one problem: He wasn't there, and hadn't said a word.

title: Carey Spends a Hot Day At Winter Olympics Site
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., Aug. 29 (AP)Governor Carey took his first look today at construction for the 1980 Winter Olympics to be held in this Adirondack Mountain village.

title: WILLOBROOK HEAD TO TAKE POST IN OHIO
description: Dr. Levester Cannon, director of New York State's often controversial Willowbrook Developmental Center on Staten Island for the last 13 months, said yesterday that he would leave the center to become Ohio's Commissioner of Mental Retardation and Developmental Disabilities on Sept. 25.

title: U.S. Jury Indicts Galiber and Four On Fraud Charges
description: State Senator Joseph Galiber and Robert Munoz, the former director of a Bronx drug rehabilitation program, along with three other persons, were indicted yesterday by a Federal grand jury on charges of conspiracy to defraud the United States through a realestate scheme financed by antipoverty funds.

title: Storm Developing Over Gulf
description: MIAMI, Aug. 29 (AP)A rainladen tropical wave over the Gulf of Mexico developed into a tropical depression today with winds of 30 to 35 miles an hour, the National Hurricane Center said. Forecasters advised boaters on the northeast Gulf Coast and all marine interests in the Gulf to keep informed of the depression.

title: CARNIVAL IN LONDON ENDS AMID VIOLENCE
description: LONDON, Aug. 29London's Notting Hill Carnival, the largest celebration for Caribbean immigrants in Europe, ended in violence tonight. More than 100 persons were injured, including 30 police officers. Twentyseven others were hurt in a brief outbreak last night.

title: Canada Fines Soviet Fishing Captain
description: ST. JOHN'S, Newfoundland, Aug. 29 (Reuters)The captain of the Soviet trawler Petrokretost was fined $8,000 today after pleading guilty to two charges of fishing without a license inside Canada's 200mile limit. A lawyer who entered the plea on behalf of Capt. N. V. Chumak said the captain had suffered a heart attack after his first court appearance last month, when he had pleaded innocent, and was recuperating in the Soviet Union.

title: Arab Ministers to Meet
description: CAIRO, Aug. 29Arab foreign ministers who are due to meet next month in the United States with President Carter and Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance plan to confer here next weekend on the positions they expect to take.

title: Queens Trial on Videotape Barred
description: Trial by television, with the defendant watching on a screen at home or in a hospital, would deprive the defendant of his rights and would make him in many respects a spectator at his own trial, a State Supreme Court justice in Queens ruled yesterday.

title: 2 Safety Investigations Ordered For Cars Made by British Leyland
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)Two safety investigations involving automobiles made by British Leyland were announced today by the Transportation Department.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission's staff report, besides accusing Mayor Beame and several banks of misleading the investing public, also accused Moody's and Standard & Poor's of failing to investigate New York's finances thoroughly and of not acting quickly enough. Page 43.

title: 10% Swedish Devaluation Roils European Market.
description: PARIS, Aug. 29  Currency markets were thrown into confusion in Europe today and political tensions flared, following today's decision by Sweden to devalue its currency by 10 percent: Norway and Denmark then followed suit with 5 percent devaluations.

title: SOMALI GOES TO MOSCOW AT SOVIET INVITATION
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 29 (AP)President Mohammed Siad Barre of Somalia has flown to the Soviet Union, the major supplier of arms to both the Somalians and their Ethiopian rivals, at the invitation of the Soviet Government, the Mogadishu radio reported today.

title: Nancy Hanks Resigns Arts Post
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29The White House announced today the resignation of Nancy Hanks as chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts effective Oct. 2, the date her current term ends.

title: First Alaskan Oil Cargo Awaits Panama Canal Passage
description: The first Alaskan oil is poised to pass through the Panama Canal. On Sunday, the Washington Trader, a 43,000deadweightton tanker chartered by the Standard Oil Company (Ohio), was loaded with Alaskan oil in the Parita Gulf, 65 miles west of the Pacific terminus of the canal. The ship is destined for a port on the Gulf of Mexico, according to Sohio.

title: VOLVO ENDS TALKS ON ACQUIRING SAAB
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, Aug. 29 (AP)The proposed merger of Sweden's two auto manufacturers, Volvo and SAAB. has been called off. The merger would have been the biggest in Swedish history and would have created one of Europe's largest auto manufacturing companies.

title: A Detained Black's Death Troubling Many South Africans
description: DURBAN, South Africa, Aug. 23Until the security police came for him on March 18 last year, Joseph Masobiya Mdluli was a minor player in the South African racial drama. A semieducated black, long in trouble over suspected activities on behalf of the African National Congress, he made his living hawking clothes in a black town outside this coastal city.

title: Dowager Countess Alexander, Widow of Field Marshall, Dies
description: LONDON, Aug 29 (Reuters)  The dowager Countess Alexander of Tunis, widow of Field Marshal Earl Alexander of Tunis, has died at the age of 72.

title: New Faces, New Start in China
description: Exploration was the word used by both secretary of State Vance and Chinese Prime Minister Hua Kuofeng to describe Mr. Vance's recent fourday visit to Peking. There were no agreements to sign, not even a communique to read, but the two seemed satisfiedand so should Americans concerned that good relations be maintained with the People's Republic and that the future of Taiwan be settled peacefully.

title: Board Ousts Draper as President Of Manhattan Community College
description: The Board of Higher Education ousted Edgar D. Draper last night as president of Borough of Manhattan Community College for what it called the good of the college.

title: Bridge.
description: Those who work hard at bridge administration generally have too much on their minds to win major titles, but virtue is occasionally rewarded.

title: Robert Schatten, at 66, Professor At Hunter College for 16 Years
description: Dr. Robert Schatten, professor of mathematics at Hunter College since 1961, died last Friday in Mount Sinai Hospital after a long illness. He was 66 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: China Quite Unhappy With Carter Over Taiwan, a Top Leader Says
description: PEKING, Aug. 29One of China's top leaders said today that the Chinese people are quite unhappy at the reluctance of President Carter to give up his old friend Taiwan.

title: Chief Spokesman for the Port Authority Suspended for Filing False Expenses
description: John Tillman, chief spokesman for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, was suspended from his $55.000 ayearjob yesterday after he conceded that he had been padding his expense accounts since he took the post three years ago, billing for fictitious dinners and drinks with public officials and news reporters and their families.

title: Books of The Times
description: MOURNING THE DEATH OF MAGIC. By Blanche McCrary Boyd. 214 pages. Macmillan. $7.95.

title: The Standings
description: Tuesday, August 30, 1977

title: Tourist Site Seeking Home for Its Sharks
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Aug. 29 (UPI) Sharkworld, a tourist attraction, has closed and officials do not know what to do with 15 sharks.

title: KEY BLACKS PLANNING ATTACK ON NEGLECT
description: In response to what many blacks believe to be a worsening racial situation in the United States, 15 black leaders met here yesterday and agreed to launch a counterattack on the callous neglect of blacks, the poor and America's cities.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Times reported yesterday that the Rev. Stanwood Graves had resigned as rector of St. Stephen's Parish in Plainfield, N.J. In fact, Father Graves continues as a priest for the congregation, which has withdrawn from its Episcopal diocese.

title: Floods and Winds Hit North Italy; Damage Is Estimated in Millions
description: ROME, Aug. 29, (AP)Gale winds and rain battered most of northern Italy for the second day today, causing flash floods and landslides and disrupting train and road traffic.

title: FED'S DISCOUNT RATE, AS EXPECTED, RAISED A HALFPOINT TO 5%
description: The Federal Reserve Board voted yesterday to increase the discount rate, the interest rate the central bank charges on loans to commercial banks, to 5 percent from 5 percent.

title: Double Whammy on Farms: Poor Crops and Low Prices
description: DES MOINES, Aug. 27Robert Casper, who has been doubly blessed by good, rich Iowa farmland and in the past by good average rainfall, is now sharing with many other farmers around the country the misfortune that some call the double whammypoor crops and low prices.

title: Belmont Opener Attracts Only 21,489
description: Fresh from the rustic surroundings of Saratoga where business reached record levels during a 24day meeting, thoroughbred racing returned to welllandscaped Belmont Park yesterday on a disappointing note.

title: Expanded CounselloratLaw to Return
description: Elmer Rice's CounselloratLaw, which attracted crowds during a limited engagement earlier this summer, will return for a regular run on Thursday night at the Quaigh Theater in the Diplomat Hotel, 108 West 43d Street. The theater has been enlarged, from 90 seats to 174 seats, and the production has been restaged and expanded with the use of a thrust stage, different sets, props and lights.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Naval and Civilian Aides See Guantanamo Base as Declining Asset
description: GUANTANAMO BAY, Cuba, Aug. 29This vast harbor on the southeastern coast of Cuba. the home of an American naval base for the last 79 years, has be come a declining asset for the United States in the view of topranking Navy commanders and State Department officials concerned with longrange policy.

title: BEGIN'S VISIT TO RUMANIA SAID TO HELP RELATIONS
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Aug. 29 (AP)President Nicolae Ceausescu and Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel ended talks today that the official Rumanian press agency said had furthered relations between the countries despite differing views on Middle East issues.

title: New Chinese Envoy to Moscow Takes Up Post Vacant for a Year
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 29 (UPI)China's new Ambassador to the Soviet Union, Wang Yoping, arrived by train from Peking today to fill a post that had been vacant for more than a year.

title: City Opera Officials Say Losses Could Curtail or Cancel Season
description: Death in the opera house is usually a dramatic affair accompanied by arias of grief and stirring tremolos in the strings. But, according to officials of the New York City Opera, that 33yearold company is in serious danger of passing away quietly, a victim of the common ailment of the arts in our time: fiscal malnutrition. Its fall season, which opens tomorrow night with Boito's Mefistofele, appears safe. But after that, who knows?

title: Percy Urges Arson Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)Senator Charles H. Percy, Republican of Illinois, saying that urban arson is approaching epidemic proportions, requested today an investigation of whether the Federal riot insurance program encouraged property owners to commit arson for profit.

title: Rice Hits 3 Homers; Red Sox Lose to A's, Trail by
description: Despite the greatest slugging outburst of his career by Jim Rice, the Red Sox cintinued to falter in pursuit of the Yankees for the championship of the American League's Eastern Division. Three home runs and a single by Rice went to waste last night in Boston as an 87 loss to the Oakland A'b dropped the Red Sox three games behind New York.

title: Citizenship Means a New Name To 7,000 U.S. Immigrants a Year
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)Every year some 7.000 immigrants abandon more than their homelands when they bc come American citizens. They leave behind their name as well.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Times reported yesterday that the Rev. Stanwood Graves had resigned as rector of St. Stephen's Parish in Plainfield, N.J. In fact, Father Graves continues as a priest for the congregation, which has withdrawn from its Episcopal diocese.

title: FRUSTRATED WRITER JUMPS FROM BRIDGE
description: In an apparent publicity stunt for his latest literary effort, an aspiring playwright clad in a wetsuit and flotation gear placed his unpublished manuscript on a railing of the Brooklyn Bridge yesterday afternoon and plunged 130 feet into the East River. He was critically injured.

title: Three Pitchers in the Royals' Lineup
description: At his desk in the visiting manager's office at Yankee Stadium yesterday, Whitey Herzog of the Kansas City Royals filled out a blue lineup card and announced, That ought to be a winner. But only for originality. In an era when American League pitchers don't even take batting practice in deference to the designatedhitter rule, Whitey Herzog had three pitchers in his batting orderDennis Leonard batting second as the dh, Jim Colborn batting cleanup as the right fielder and Andy Hassler batting fifth as the first baseman. Whitey Herzog had not misplaced the touch of genius that had Sports the Royals in first place in the American of League West, building toward another playoff with the Yankees for the pennant. No, the Royals' manager was protesting the Royals' presence in New York rather than at the golf courses, swimming pools and airconditioned oases of the Kansas City area. He has been protesting since the Yankees called off a July 25 game with the Royals because of rain, wet grounds and a bad weather forecastcalled off prematurely, griped the Royals, who would lose yesterday, 53, on Chris Chambliss's threerun homer in the eighth inning.

title: S.E.C. REPORT LIKELY TO DELAY NOTE SALE, FISCAL EXPERTS SAY
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission report charging that investors in New York City notes had been misled in 197475 is likely to delay the sale of new notes planned for Octoberthe first since the fiscal crisis brokeand in general make it more difficult for the city to reenter the credit markets this year, several financial experts said yesterday.

title: A Zany Duo Caricatures Dance Style
description: The freewheeling lunacy of the Kat's Pajamas Sunday evening at the Cubiculo stemmed from the boisterous model of Hellzapoppin rather than the more decorous structure of traditional concert dance. Conceived and performed by Debra Zalkind and Cameron Burke, it was so outrageous in delineating character that the results were closer to caricature than portraiture.

title: Decline in Working Teenagers Predicted, May Cause Shortages for LowWage Jobs
description: The great wave of 16 to 19yearolds, a phenomenon that turned youth unemployment into a national problem, has peaked and their number is declining.

title: Sniper Suspect Had Extensive Psychiatric Record
description: HACKETTSTOWN, N.J., Aug. 29Emile Pierre Benoist, who killed himself after murdering six persons at random last Friday, was ordered 10 months ago to undergo psychiatric treatment, but he did not.

title: Cities' Group Wary of S.E.C. Report
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29The National League of Cities said today that last week's voluminous report by the Securities and Exchange Commission on New York City's financial transactions in 197475 should not be taken as indisputable proof of wrongdoing by New York City officials.

title: Main Points of Rhodesia Proposals
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 29Following are the main points of the BritishAmerican plan for the transition of Rhodesia to majority rule and legal independence, as obtained from American and British sources:

title: Brock Eclipses Cobb's StolenBase Mark
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 29 (AP)Lou Brock of the St. Louis Cardinals, already the holder of most of the major leagues' basestealing records, stole two bases at San Diego Stadium tonight, bringing his career total to 893 and shattering the mark that Ty Cobb set 49 years ago.

title: Frustrated Writer Leaps OffBridge as Stunt
description: In an apparent publicity stunt for his latest literary effort, an aspiring playwright clad in a wetsuit and flotation gear placed his unpublished manuscript on a railing of the Brooklyn Bridge yesterday afternoon and plunged 130 feet into the East River. He was critically injured.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: In Memoriam
description: PHARRNye, Aug. 30, 1976.

title: Independence Is Cut From Trials
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 29Sail numbers U.S. 26 and KA5 moved closer to an America's Cup showdown today when Courageous knocked Independence out of the defense trials and Australia sailed to a third straight victory over Sverige of Sweden.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Weicker Supports Treaty
description: Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr. today endorsed the Panama Canal treaty, contending that it follows the only honorable course the United States could have taken.

title: 5,000 Fans Greet Cosmos
description: The Cosmos were met by 5,000 screaming fans on club's return to Kennedy International Airport after championship victory. Page 24.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, AUGUST 30, 1977

title: Judge in Michigan PleaBargaining Case Is Reinstated
description: DETROIT, Aug. 29The Michigan Supreme Court today reinstated a city crminal court judge it demoted last week after the judge repeatedly refused to participate in a broad program to reduce court backlogs and operating expenses through greater use of plea bargaining.

title: Reno Softball Victor
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Aug. 29 (AP)RenoToyota of Nevada won the 1977 International Softball Congress championship last night after a 10day doubleelimination tournament. Reno's Bob Gregory blanked the ninetime champion Long Beach Nitehawks of California, 50, in the title game.

title: Afflicted With Gnats
description: For years Congressmen unable to get the truly vital news of their activities back to the home folks because of intransigent, stupid or vicious reporters have been solving the problem by writing their own newsletters to constituents. President Carter is now having their ageold problem with the press. You may receive his first newsletter any day now. It will read more or less as follows:

title: PETER PARNASSA
description: Dr. Peter Parnassa, chief of thoracic surgery at. Lutheran Medical Center, Brooklyn, died suddenly Sunday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 53 years old and lived in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn.

title: Concepcion, Carty Honored
description: Dave Concepcion, Cincinnati Reds' shortstop, and Rico Carty, Cleveland Indians' designated hitter, were named players of the week yesterday in the National and American Leagues, respectively. Concepcion hit 11 for 26 (.423) with 10 runs hatted in. Carty hit three homers, drove :n 13 runs and batted .430, with a slugging percentage of .960, to edge Mickey Rivers of the New York Yankees

title: Analysts Say Navy Skimped on Planes to Buy F14's
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29An internal Pentagon analysis strongly criticizes the Navy for what it views as buying only onethird of the new planes it needs because it spends too much on the costly F14 Tomcat fighter.

title: A Truly No NonScents Outlook
description: THETFORD CENTER, Vt.The ads show virile fellows swinging their soaponarope in a locker room, or standing explorerlike in a rural landscape. They give off almost visible waves of delicious scent: English Leather, or Eau Sauvage, or Acqua di Selva. An admiring and beautiful woman often stands a pace or two behind, though they ignore her. Her nostrils are slightly flared. She has clearly been following her nose to the source of this splendid masculine aroma. It is so intoxicating that she seems likely to spring from behind, and bear the man down to the grass.

title: U.S. PAID EXPENSES OF ISRAELI MISSION
description: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Aug. 30For the last 20 months, the United States Government has paid the expenses of the 202member Israeli arms purchasing mission, defense officials said yesterday.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission staff report that accused Mayor Beame and half a dozen of the city's largest banks of misleading the investing public also had critical words for Moody's and Standard & Poor's. the nation's two largest bond rating agencies.

title: Deaths
description: ADAMSMary Roberts. The board of directors of Grosvenor Neighborhood House records with deep regret the death of Mrs. Howard C. Adams, a de, vored board member for many roars and chairmen OF the Development Committee. We extend our sympathy to Mr. Adams and the members of the family. MISS JULIE KAMMERER, President

title: Masculine Traits Equal Business Success
description: STORRS, Conn., Aug. 29 (UP)If a businesswoman wants to rise to a top management position, she had best exhibit some strong masculine characteristics, according to a new study.

title: Impending Desegregation Brings Some Uneasiness to Ohio's Cities
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 28Broad public school desegregation programs are expected to begin this school year or next in nearly every major city in this state, marking the end of decades of dual education systems. But, as implementation approaches, confusion, uneasiness and racial tension are growing.

title: SST LANDING DELAYED BY U.S. APPEALS COURT
description: Permission for the Concorde to use Kennedy International Airport was delayed yesterday by a Federal appeals court that will hear arguments Sept. 19 in the long dispute over the supersonic jetliner.

title: Strife in Sri Lanka Abates, but the Tensions Persist
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Aug. 29Ethnic violence has shattered the tropical tranquillity of this lush, and lazy island republic, bringing to a boil a longsimmering hostility. In 10 days, 100 peoplemostly members of the Tamil minorityhave been killed and thousands driven from their homes, vowing never to return.

title: Solar Heating to Be Tested on L.I.
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Aug. 29Five houses will be built in Suffolk County as part of a national research project to determine the most effective and economical way. to combine solar and conventional energy, the Long Island Lighting Company announced today.

title: Reporter's Notebook: China Recovering Sense of Humor
description: PEKING, Aug. 27.The scene is a packed movie theater with the audience intently watching Woman Pilot, a film about female mliers in the Chinese Air Force. At a critical moment, a male pilot, who has established a close comradely relationship with the heroine, dies in a training accident.

title: Murphy Denies Hiding Oil Report
description: Representative John M. Murphy, Democrat of Staten Island, yesterday vehemently denounced charges by Republican National Chairman Bill Brock that Mr. Murphy had suppressed a General Accounting Office report because it was unfavorable to a bill he backed.

title: S.E.C. Dispute: Who Said What
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission report on New York City's financial dealings has set off a debate between the commission and city officials over who is telling the truth about what occurred in late 1974 and early 1975, just before the fiscal crisis Analysis became public knowledge. The fact is, they both are. But they are not always talking about the same things.

title: Pressure Against Soap TV Ads Dismays Agency and ABC Aides
description: With the increasing loss of advertisers for ABCTV's controversial new comedy, Soap, officials of leading advertising agencies in New York have expressed concern about the effectiveness of recent campaigns by pressure groups to prevent companies from advertising on television programs.

title: REPORT ON PINTO DEATHS IS CALLED FALSE BY FORD
description: DEARBORN, Mich., Aug. 29 (UPI)Allegations that Ford Pintos have faulty fuel tanks that make them firetraps and cause the death of 70 or more people each year is pure exaggeration, the auto maker said today.

title: Article 3  No Title
N.A.S.L to Expand Season
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 29 (AP)The North American Soccer League announced at its meetings here today that it would increase its schedule to 30 games a team, from 26, next season.

title: Fatal Spotted Fever Cases May Have Been Borne By Aerosol, Official Says
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 29 (UPI)A Federal health official said today that two workers atthe national Center for Disease Control who died of Rocky Mountain spotted fever might. have contracted the fatal illness through an aerosal.

title: KEY BLACKS PLANNING ATTACK ON NEGLECT
description: In response to what many blacks believe to he a worsening racial situation the United States. 15 black leaders met here yesterday and agreed to launch a counterattack on the callous neglect of blacks, the poor and America's cities.

title: Major League Scores
description: EIvie, DRoberts. DPSt. Louis 1. LO3St. Louis 8, San Diego 3. 2BPhilips Brock. 3BGRilaards. HRIvie (9). 5BBrock 2, Mumphrey.

title: Brooklyn Firemen Use New Computer And Handle Alarm Calls Faster
description: When a fire is called into the emergency number 911 during a hectic period in any borough but Brooklyn, it can take four men as long as 10 minutes to go through eight cumbersome steps to determine where the nearest available fire company is situated and to send it on its way.

title: President Will See Mideast Ministers Next Month in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29  President Carter has invited the foreign ministers of Israel and five Arab countries to meet with him individually when they come to the United States next month to attend the United Nations General Assembly, Administration officials said today.

title: Cosmos Met on Return By 5,000 Yelling Fans
description: Approximately 5,000 fans mobbed the Cosmos when the players arrived on a chartered plane at Kennedy International Airport last night from Portland, Ore., where they had won the soccer championship.

title: David M. Laux, at 74, in Florida; A Publisher and Advertising Man
description: David N. Laux. a retired advertising and publishing executive, died Friday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.. where he was living in retirement. He was 74 years old.

title: Fillol Bows in Three Sets at U.S. Pro Tourney
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 29 (AP)Manuel Orantes defeated Jaime Fillol, 63, 60, 61, in the semifinals of the $125,000 United States Pro tennis championships today.

title: More Miners Returning to Work In Dispute Over Medical Funds
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va., Aug. 29Wildcat strikes by coal miners that have persisted in West Virginia for nearly 10 weeks appeared to be diminishing today.

title: Suspect in Jersey Sniper Killings Had Extensive Psychiatric Record
description: HACKETTSTOWN, N.J., Aug. 29Emile Pierre Benoist, who killed himself after murdering six persons at random last Friday, was ordered 10 months ago to undergo psychiatric treatment, but he did not.

title: U.S. Jury Indicts Caliber and Four On Fraud Charges
