description: Rule No. 1 at New York City's flower market: Never discuss business when the results of the daily double are on the radio. Rule No. 2: Rule No. I never changes.

title: The Gastronomic M. F. K. Fisher
description: ARY FRANCES KENNEDY FISHER, a 69yearold ScottishIrish Yank from California (she's far better known as M.F.K. Fisher), writes about food the way Mark Twain wrote about the Mississippi, as a way of writing about something else. Her books on gastronomy are more kitchen allegories than they are strategies for survival when the wolf is at the door.

title: About Real Estate
description: The strong housing market on the upper West Side has overcome the disinclination people once felt about living on so active a commercial thoroughfare as Columbus Avenue.

title: In London, Round Applause for the Bagel
description: LONDON The American bagel has rolled into London and is holed up in Edgware Road.

title: TV: 4 Church Units Plan to Fight Soap
description: THE NATIONAL COUNCIL of Churches, the United Church of Christ, the United Methodist Church and the National Council of Catholic Bishops, representing among them 138,000 churches, are planning to open a new front in the campaign to head off what they feel may be a deluge of sexoriented television shows in prime time.

title: WOLFRAM L. ERTINGER
description: Wolfram L. Ertinger, who retired in 1973 as senior partner and director of the old investment banking firm of Laird Bissell & Meads, died Sunday in New York Hospital after a short illness. He was 74 years old and lived at 610 Park Avenue and in Monte Carlo.

title: Private Air Force Used by Port Aides, Assembly Unit Says
description: Dr. William J. Ronan and other officials of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey turned the agency's three helicopters into a private air force for their own commuting, shopping, entertainment and personal business trips, a New York State legislative committee charged yesterday.

title: 3 Persons Are Reported Killed In Strong Earthquake in Colombia
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Aug. 30 (UPI)A strong earthquake shook northwestern and central Colombia today, collapsing homes and killing at least three persons, officials said.

title: Article 5  No Title
Metropolitan Briefs
description: David A. Werblin, chairman of the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority, and four others were named as principal partners in a group planning to build a $70 million gambling casinohotel on the Atlantic City Boardwalk.

title: British Football
description: BY United Press International

title: Fast Ended Too Fast
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug 30 (Reuters) Thousands of Pakistanis observing the monthlong Moslem fast of Ramadan have been ordered to extend the fast by a day because they ended it too soon. They did so because of a premature radio announcement. Four radio officials have been suspended.

title: Best Buys
description: INDOORS OR OUT? That is the question this Labor Day weekend. Whether 'tis wiser to risk the elements and on outdoor grill cook? Or to kitchen repair?

title: President and Treasurer Resign From Hyatt Board
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 30 (AP)The Hyatt Corporation announced today that its president and treasurer had resigned from the board of directors in the wake of a dispute over borrowing money withou approval from the board.

title: S.E.C. Investigated U.D.C. in '75 But Issued No Report on Findings
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission investigated the financial collapse of the state's Urban Development Corporation in 1975, but did not issue a report on its findings.

title: LILLIAN GRAHAM THEILER
description: Lillian Graham Theiler, widow of Dr. Max Theiler, winner in 1951 of the Nobel Prize for physiology and medicine, died suddenly Monday in Briar Crest Nursing Home, Ossining, N. Y. She was 81 years old and formerly lived in HastingsonHudson. N. Y.. and New Haven.

title: Market Place
description: If there is any validity in the old adage about misery loving company, stockbrokers and commodities men surely have much in common these daysalthough the picture does have a few bright spots.

title: China to Send A Soccer Team To Play in U.S.
description: A team composed of China's best soccer players will play five matches at various sites throughout the United States in October. This will be the first such visit by the Chinese and the cohosts will be the United States Soccer Federation and the Committee on United StatesChina Relations.

title: The Standings
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Reese in Temporary Post
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., (AP)Harold (Pee Wee) Reese, who played shortstop 16 seasons with the Dodgers15 in Brooklyn and one in Los Angelessays he has taken a temporary post with the Louisville Slugger bat people in Louisville.

title: People and Business
description: There, among half a hundred college professors, bankers, businessmen, and mounting luminaries, is Lawrence Peter Berra of Montclair, N.J. Mr. Berra known in other circles as Yogiwas among the sharpeyed readers of Accounting: The Language of Business who made suggestions incorporated in its newly published third edition. The slim paperback includes a 53page glossary of accounting terms from A.A.A. (American Accounting Association) to zero salvage value.

title: SUSPECT IN SLAYING INDICTED PREVIOUSLY
description: A suspect seized in the killing of Detective Joseph D. Taylor Jr. in Brooklyn Monday was under indictment for possession of a gun with which he allegedly killed another man last month.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: FROM time to time we have discussed the virtues of shrimp for cooking  la minute. Shrimp should be cooked at relatively high heat whether in a skillet or in the oven so that they change from a grayish, translucent state to achieve a red outer coating and a snowwhite inner coating as rapidly as possible. The moment they become piping hot throughout they are ready to be served, although a minute or two beyond that point will probably not make them unsavory.

title: Deaths
description: ACKERMANIsaak, beloved husband of the late Eva, devoted father of Abraham, Louis and Shirley Glanell, dear brother of Sam, Rose and Bertha, adored grandfather and greatgrandfather. Services at BoulevardPark West, 115 W. 79th St., Wednesday, Aug. 31st at 1 P.M.

title: Article 7  No Title
Economic Index Off for 3d Month; Factory Orders Fell 3% in July
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3The Government reported today a 3 percent dip in factory orders in July and the third monthly drop in an index designed to anticipate future economic trendsfurther signs that the nation is settling into a slower growth pattern after an unusually buoyant first half.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: ONE FINE DAY a while back, John Wieting was walking along Ninth Avenue when he spotted a boy and girl coming toward him. Clearly both children had just come from communion.

title: Dollar Ends Mixed In Trading Abroad As Gold Advances
description: The dollar closed mixed against major European currencies in erratic foreign exchange trading yesterday, but improved against the Japanese yen, The Associated Press reported.

title: Police Check Report That Sniper Sought .44 Bullets
description: HACKETTSTOWN, Aug. 30Four men who were ambushed and killed by a sniper here last Friday were buried today in this hilly, pastoral area where crimes of violence had been virtually unknown.

title: Who Will Hold the Guns in Rhodesia?
description: The only uncertainty about today's election among Rhodesia's whites is whether Prime Minister Ian Smith will win all the seats or miss a few. Either way, he will have strengthened his hand for the hard bargaining that lies ahead. The first bargainers he will face, once the votes are counted, will be United States Ambassador Andrew Young and British Foreign Secretary David Owen, who arrive in Salisbury later this week with their AngloAmerican plan for moving Rhodesia to black majority rule. Among the questions the plan addresses, one is paramount: Who will hold the guns during the transition? The plan's answer offers the best hope for an orderly transition and a stable future for all citizens of the new state of Zimbabwe.

title: Della Femina Starts Field Account Service
description: Some ad agencies that handle food or franchiser accounts have used field account executives to present their clients advertising and marketing programs to local managers and staffs. Their role has been to enlist enthusiasm and support, originate local promotional activities and collect feedback for the home office.

title: New York Lottery To Use New Format For Instant Game
description: The New York State Lottery will begin a new bingo game Sept. 7 in which players will know instantly if they have won up to $5,000 in cash or $10,000 and a chance to win $1 million in a later drawing.

title: Yacht Australia Ponders Series Against Sverige
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 30Alan Bond indicated today that his America's Cup challenger, Australia, might take part in a fiverace tuneup series against Sverige of Sweden starting on Friday. He said the Swedes were receptive to the proposal. The series would he for a prize to be called the SwedishAustralia Cup.

title: Borg Injures Shoulder, Gets Delay As U.S. Open Tennis Starts Today
description: An 11thhour injury has threatened Bjorn Borg's chances of playing in the $462,420 United States Open tennis championships, which start today at the West Side Tennis Club.

title: Surgery Chief Quits In the Latest Episode In Port Chester Rift
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y., Aug. 30Dr. David A. W. Wilson has resigned as director of the division of surgery of United Hospital in an action that is part of a monthsiong dispute between the hospital's medical staff and its board of trustees.

title: Smoke Detectors Ordered Installed At Federal Prisons
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP)Norman A. Carlson, the director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons, is ordering smoke detectors for all Federal prisons and sprinkler systems for most of them after a recent fire that killed five inmates.

title: Article 6  No Title
Dow Falls 5.20 to 858.89 on Adverse Economic Reports
description: Unfavorable economic reports weakened the stock market yesterday in accelerated trading.

title: U. S. JURY CONVICTS FIVE OIL COMPANIES ON PRICE CONSPIRACY
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 30A Federal Court jury today convicted five independent oil companies and an oil industry trade association and its director on charges that they conspired to fix the price of 17 billion gallons of gasoline sold from New York to Virginia during a sevenyear period.

title: Belmont Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: A MAN THROWS A PIE AT BERME IN DEBATE
description: A man flung an apple pie at Mayor Beame last night in the closing moments of the first televised debate of the New York City primary campaign.
